reviews: Great location. Great service. Rooms are nice. Everyone who works there is great. Highly recommend!
Wish they had a microwave and better Wi-Fi, but otherwise pretty great overall.

Awesome location. Room nice and big. Nice breakfast options.
Very easy to walk anywhere. Next to the Powell/hyde cable car. Other transport options nearby.

We absolutely loved our stay at the the Argonaut Hotel at Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf, San Fransisco. The view from our Suite included the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz and Gherardellis. It was super spacious comfortable, clean and had a massive tv! The bathtub, shower and bed were all excellent!

Overall clean hotel and friendly staff. Great location if you want to be close to Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf and related Piers. Not too far from North Beach and Chinatown‚Ä¶20-30 minute walk or much faster via Uber.

Fantastic on all fronts. Super comfortable bed, size of the room was perfect with plenty of room for all of your items. Love how quiet it was and perfect location to get to everything (all the piers, the square, plenty of food options, etc.) The staff are so nice and I'll definitely be back.

We stayed at this wonderful hotel this week for 3 days. It is very well located to prime attractions, the staff is very friendly. Joanna and Sevara were very helpful in sorting our excursions and helpful in local tips to make our trip easier.

We stayed at this hotel recently. The staff is extremely helpful. Joanna and Sevara at the concierge were just amazing! They truly went above and beyond to help us with all our queries. They helped us to plan our day and make most of our holiday. Thank you for all your help Joanna and Sevara..

Wonderful stay at the Argonaut Hotel.  Truly top-notch professional service from everyone - the valet service, the front desk staff, the restaurant food and service, and the cleaning staff were the absolute best.  We will be back for sure!  Thank you. :)

The Argonaut Hotel is a wonderful place to stay during your visit to San Francisco! The location is amazing, a quick stroll along the bay and to the Golden Gate Bridge, stunning views, a wonderful historical building that enhances your visit. The on-site restaurant, The Blue Mermaid, is fantastic! Everyone at the hotel made us feel welcome! Thank you!
Awesome location, great staff, our server Martin at the Blue Mermaid was   great

We loved staying here. It was clean, comfortable, and in a perfect location! We only stayed for one night, but I anticipate comng back somewhat frequently and plan to stay here. We had to park in a garage on the street behind the hotel, and then just walked everywhere  or rented bikes. It was also very quiet, which was much appreciated.

We had high hopes staying here, however our experience was a full 1 star.
The 1 star is strictly for location.
We spent 3 nights here with our family of 4 for just over $1,200 only to be surprised at checkout there were over $120 more fees and that's not including parking our own car.

The elevator was down 2 out of our 3 nights. The staff was not friendly, nor welcoming. They also did not help us with navigating around the city, no tips, no advice, no help with direction.

The water pressure was awful, actually there wasn‚Äôt any water pressure ‚Ä¶ more like a trickle.
Great location for Fisherman's Wharf.   Very nice hotel, comfortable beds, great location for food and things to do.

The Argunot is a very special hotel in a very touristy area. Being so centrally located, as we are tourists as well, was important. But staying in a place that felt elevated and close to everything was awesome!
Heavy tourist areas tend to be over loved a bit kept up. The Argunot is an absolute exception! Their bedding, specifically their pillows, are FIRE!
First time in San Francisco and this hotel did not disappoint.  Great location, friendly staff, delicious food.  Will definitely be staying here again.

When we first entered our room, we immediately noticed blood on the outside of the toilet bowl. We called for housekeeping, but no one showed up. After calling again, they sent an engineer - despite me clearly stating there was blood that needed to be cleaned, not a plumbing issue. The engineer left to find a cleaner, and when that person finally arrived, they didn't even clean the bloody area.
My wife is a registered nurse, and seeing unidentified blood in what should be a clean, sterile environment was deeply upsetting. She understands the serious risks of bloodborne pathogens like HIV, Hepatitis B, and Hepatitis C, and was honestly disturbed that proper sanitation protocols were not folowed. She made it very clear that under OSHA and health safety standards, this kind of contamination is unacceptable and potentially hazardous. We ended up using the lobby restroom instead of the one in our room. On our way out to dinner, we spoke in person to the front desk, explained exactly what happened, and were assured the issue would be resolved before our return. But when we got back hours later, the blood was still there. This experience  left us feeling extremely  uncomfortable and ignored. For a hotel of this standard, this was a major failure in both cleanliness and responsiveness.
Update: The hotel publicly replied, stating they've already "reached out to me directly" to address my concerns , but no one has contacted me. I have not received a phone call, email, or message from management. This adds to my frustration, as it feels like they are more focused on
appearances than genuinely addressing guest experiences.

The room was great, spacious and beautiful.
However we were offered a ‚Äú$75 upgrade to the bay view, with a $50 credit to their restaurant‚Äù. We happily accepted, and at no point did anyone clarify the upgrade was $75/day, and we did not confirm the total price of the upgrade either. We ended up paying 100s of extra dollars that we had not budgeted for.

When checking out we tried to clarify that we were told the upgrade was $75 flat and they said that‚Äôs not how their upgrades work and there‚Äôs nothing they can do to correct this misleading offer.

We really enjoyed our stay but we felt this ‚Äúpromotion‚Äù was quite predatory, so watch out for the offers they make.
The location is fantastic and the hotel is lovely. Everyone is very friendly and the room was spacious. We would definitely stay again.

Loved everything about this place. Clean, cozy room with charming nautical decor and mine has a distant view of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge, sunrises and sunsets were beautiful. The location is unbeatable, right in Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf and close to souvenir shops, restaurants, and the Powell-Hyde cable car stop.

Huge thanks to Corinne, who greeted every guest with a warm smile, so friendly and welcoming. She truly made the stay even better.

Great value for money. Highly recommend, and I‚Äôd absolutely stay here again solo or with my family!

I was looking to be near Fisherman's Wharf but a bit removed from the crowds. This was the perfect location for that. ||The only negative was the parking situation. We had planned to leave the car all day upon check out (and fully prepared to pay) but they said our car had to be picked up by 1pm from the valets. I should have researched it ahead of time so I could have made different arrangements because it really made us shift our plan for the day to all of a sudden have our car for our SF sightseeing day.||Oh, and the windows desperately need to be cleaned. We had a Bay View room and the view was really compromised by the very filthy windows. If paying a premium for the view, I would expect a clean window. The rest of the room and hotel was very well taken care of and clean so the windows were a surprise. Probably just caught them on an off day.
Came for a family vacation and the hotel lived up to it's promise and more!

We love boutique hotels and this hotel exudes charm. Everyone we dealt with ( check-in, bellhop and concierge) were wonderful and pleasant. |The concierge was friendly and helpful to book tours for us and recommendations. |Room is small but charming and comfortable. Not to mention it is located centrally on fisherman‚Äôs wharf. This was a win
Our room was good-sized and nice, and the employeeswere very helpful. The bed was comfortable, and the location was great. There was some noise in the hallways, but it wasn't too bad.

Very nice hotel. It smells great and beds are comfy and rooms are clean. There is a nice little beach just down the street, cable car, good restaurants close to the Warf and Peer 39. The Blue Mermaid has some of the best clam chowder I've ever had. Normans ice cream, just outside of the Blue Mermaid has the best sundaes ever. Lots of good stuff there and Norm and his wife are the nicest people on the planet. If you like ice cream, you won't regret it.
Great location very nice hotel.

We stayed at this wonderful place for three days, about two weeks ago. We were welcomed so warmly by the bellman, who helped us to our room and was so charming. The room was spacious and elegant. The beds were very comfortable, and the bathroom was large and well appointed. The location was perfect, and we loved watching the cable cars and viewing the Golden Gate Bridge from our window. Loved The Argonaut and would stay again in a heartbeat.

Location was good, however the bay view rooms were not value for money. The windows were dirty, and weren‚Äôt cleaned until after we checked out even though the front desk staff said they would be cleaned the previous day. Paid a premium for the bay view but was not worth it. Service as well overall was not satisfactory.

Everything was ok until the check-out time the 17th of June.
There was a charge for breakfast on my bill that was not mine. The man from reception, BRENDAN was so unkind to me. It was not my falt and he did not even say sorry or ask, he just looked at me and printed the new bill. As I did not understand well the charges because the language, I asked for more information and he started to make faces, to huff and look at his peer as I was stupit, making me feeling so bad.

Charming Hotel in Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf ‚Äì A Comfortable Stay

This was my second time staying at this hotel in the past 10 years, and it still has its charm. The location in Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf is perfect,convenient and scenic. The reception staff were relatively friendly, though they seemed a bit overwhelmed at times.

The room was spacious and featured a very comfortable king-size bed, which made for a great night‚Äôs sleep. While the bathroom felt quite dated and the shower pressure was underwhelming, everything was clean and well-maintained.

Overall, I was happy with my stay and would consider returning again.

This hotel has elegantly whimsical nautical styling, including various staff uniforms (!) All employees were welcoming and helpful, the Blue Mermaid restaurant had wonderful food and excellent service. We never had to wait to be seated and were pleased with every dish we tried.  The hotel location at the end of the fisherman's wharf area was ideal for our long weekend of experiencing some of the highlights of San Francisco.
The room was clean, seemed recently updated, and it also featured unique interior styling details that made our stay feel special and certainly out of the ordinary.

Considering where it is located, a very quiet hotel. Our room was at street level but only heard the occasional loud car. Location was great close to pier 39 but also far enough away to not be overwhelmed by all the people.

Amazing location, iconic Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf and a stunning conversion to a hotel from a previous fishing warehouse. But what has made our 9 days here are the people, the team at this hotel are just beautiful people! Particularly Sharon on the front desk, who from the moment we checked in made us welcome like royalty, but also like close friends! That‚Äôs a talent! The whole team have been nothing but courteous and accommodating our whole vacation! We will be back!!

This hotel ended up being better than I thought. If you're a super light sleeper like I am, you may have issues unless you get a "courtyard" room (just inner walls & a couple plants.) My room was on the street but on the very backside of the hotel. Day time was still noisy but night was quiet enough. Beds/ pillows sup comfy. Inside dark/ no natural light but nice & clean. Only had drinks at the restaurant & they were so bad we sent them back. Didn't try the food. This was disappointing. ALL employees were nice & helpful. BUT our stay was tainted by a BUNCH of sneaky & undisclosed extra fees. They advertise valet parking as $75/ night (you have no other choice if you have a vehicle.) But when you checkout they charge you a "tax" on the valet so it ends up being $85/ night. Just be upfront & honest & say it's $85. Then all the other taxes/ fees also, which isn't necessarily the fault of the hotel. However they double charged us for parking. When we tried to call & discuss both the front desk guy & front desk manager tried to tell us the bill was correct & to just accept it. It was only after we didn't let up that they acknowledged & corrected the mistake. But even the correction they didn't fully refund us. Whether that was an honest accident or another sneaky attempt to extort more money, I'm not sure. They did eventually fix that as well but it required yet another phone call on our end. This truly soured the whole experience which was otherwise wonderful and pleasant.
The location is perfect, the staff went above and beyond to make our stay special.

My husband and I have been staying at the Argonaut Hotel every year for over 20 years and always get a Bayview room. This year, I tried to make reservations the week of April 28th, and the rates were extremely high. I emailed Argonaut and Tony recommended we select any other week because of an event in the city, and he would provide us with a great rate and a great City View room. When we checked in Steven provided excellent customer service. He also introduced us to the Assistant Front Desk Manager, Stephanie. She welcomed us to the hotel and thanked us for being a returning guest. She also offered to help us with any reservations for future stays. Steven allowed us to have an early check in at no charge. We had a great room as promised. All front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We always love talking to their bell captain, John. Domingo and John both provide excellent customer service and are a great asset to their team. Eileen Thompson

My Wife and I stayed in the Argonaut for four nights in May. We were very inpressed with the location, the hotel staff were exceptional including the restaurant staff. our room was lovely and the star shaped pillow on the bed was a great touch. The food for breakfast and the evening meal were exceptional and we loved the way the restaurant was decorated. We were sad to leave the Argonaut and as a momento wanted to take one of the star pillows home with us. Sadly we could not fit one in our luggage but since returning home to the Uk I have contacted the hotel to ask about getting a pillow sent back to the Uk. Aaron from the housekeeping team was extremely helpful and our pillow turned up and looks great on out own bed as a constant reminder of our stay. I would not hesitate to recommended the Argonaut hotel and will be looking to return as soon as we can to stay.

The Argonaut is a world class hotel. The staff are professional, friendly, and pay attention to detail. The whole hotel is clean and well maintained. We felt safe and the bill had no surprises. The Argonaut is a wonderful place to stay in a great location.

The Argonaut is a world class hotel. The staff are professional, friendly, and pay attention to detail. The whole hotel is clean and well maintained. We felt safe and the bill has no surprises. The Argonaut is a gem.

Hotel is clean and has a convenient location. Rooms, service and amenities are average for any hotel.
Edit: follow up to concerns was prompt and issues resolved efficiently. I appreciate the contact.
Stayed for 11 nights from late May to early June. A great home away from home! Central to lots of mass transit, which is an awesome way to see the city.
Place was amazing. Staff is friendly and respectful.

My husband and I stayed here on a romantic weekend and had the absolute best time! We booked a King suite  with a huge bathtub and it was comfy and spacious! We were spoiled by the hotel staff with a welcome gift of wine and a stuffed seal, and they also surprised us on our wedding day with chocolate covered strawberries, and champagne! The location was perfect for exploring cute little shops and restaurants. I will say that the neighborhood is loud with music outside and bustle of people until about 10 PM and the restaurant blue mermaid opens early, so expect some noise. However, we will definitely stay there again and highly recommend!

From beginning to end, our stay was exceptional, the staff went above and beyond, the knowledge of the local area was brilliant. The restaurant was superb,  and location was perfect. Can't wait to visit again soon !!
This was the perfect place for our family of four to stay for our first visit to San Francisco. We could see the bridge from our window! The room is extremely comfortable.
Beautiful clean hotel, amazing location right next to Fisherman's Wharf, and very friendly and helpful staff.  Would stay here again!

I loved the hotel, the front staff, location, decor and overall vibe. From the bellboy to check-in, the entire process was smooth. The hotel is very nice and has a great atmosphere. I‚Äôd like to thank the entire team, but a special shoutout goes to Brendan, who went above and beyond to help me. The room had a great view and was in the perfect location. I will definitely be coming back.

What a brilliant hotel in such a fab location.  The staff were all very helpful and cheerful! Brendan , the concierge, was particularly accommodating.
We had a superb view of the bay and we glimpsed the Golden Gate Bridge through the bedroom window on the left and the Bay Bridge on the right.
Location is ideal to explore Fisherman's Wharf. The Cable Car Terminus is round the corner. And Pier 39 is a short walk away.
Added bonus - great restaurant Blue Mermaid  is part of hotel. Food was excellent.
This hotel is highly recommended for food , location, service and accommodation. We would definitely return here in the future.

Spent 5 nights and had a great experience. Special kudos to the entire staff. Special call out to Brendan at the front desk for going out of his way to find information for me. Service and food at the Blue Mermaid was terrific and the cleaning staff kept the rooms and hotel spotless. A great option in a fun part of the city.
Ottimo hotel

Lovely hotel. Spacious classy rooms. Ideally located to explore. Restaurant food was fantastic. All staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Highly recommend. Will be stopping there again on my next  visit to that wonderful city

We came in from Chicago to SF for the first time and stayed here. The location could not be better. It's really close to the water, lots of restaurants and stores, and right across from the Powell and Hyde cable car turnaround. The service was great as well. We only stayed in SF for 6 days, but we were able to check off everything on our bucket list while here.
First time to San Francisco. The argonat was a great hotel and location for us.   Great staff and decor.

We recently stayed at the Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco and had a fantastic experience! Situated in the heart of Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf, the Argonaut is just steps away from the cable car turntable and Ghirardelli Square and a few blocks down from Pier 39.  While the area is bustling with tourists, it offers convenient access to many attractions and transportation. From the moment we entered, the inviting atmosphere and helpful staff made us feel welcome. The hotel's nautical theme, with its exposed brick walls, wooden beams and maritime decor, adds a charming touch. ||We stayed in a City View King Room overlooking the cable car turntable. Despite some nearby construction, the view was still enjoyable and is sure to improve once the work is completed. The room was spacious, clean, and the bed was comfortable. There were a few dust bunnies along the wooden beams, but nothing that detracted from our stay.|The Blue Mermaid restaurant. |The French toast was exceptional! We‚Äôre from south Louisiana  and know a thing or two about donuts and French toast and my son said it was the best he‚Äôs ever had. Chef‚Äôs Kiss! It was so good, it would be worth it to just stop in for breakfast even if you didn‚Äôt choose to stay at the hotel. | Staying in Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf is undoubtedly touristy, but it was exactly where we wanted to be. The Argonaut Hotel's prime location, comfortable accommodations, and attentive staff made our trip memorable. Thank you for having us! We would gladly stay here again on our next visit to San Francisco.

Good bits: the location, the view from our room of the bay and Alcatraz, the complimentary bottled water at reception. |Bad bits: not good value for money - our suite was very expensive and the rest of the hotel did not live up to expectations. Service was non existent - we took our own bags to our room (no assistance was offered), every time we tried to call guest services we got an AI bot that was utterly useless and infuriating. The restaurant was average with surly service and very expensive. Our one and only experience with the concierge on our first morning was so poor we relied on Google from there on in - she ignored the questions we asked and tried to upsell us on things we weren‚Äôt interested in. The one piece of info we did get out of her turned out to be incorrect. |The hotel is in a beautiful old building but alas feels soulless in the communal areas and there is no sense of a ‚Äòhub‚Äô. Staff weren‚Äôt rude but neither were they friendly. There was little proactivity - there was a lot of chatting amongst themselves while guests stood around waiting for attention. |Overall our stay was not terrible, but neither was it great and for the money we spent it wasn‚Äôt good value so we could not recommend it. |We were not asked about our stay at checkout. |I was send a satisfaction questionnaire after leaving which I filled out honestly but the hotel has not followed up about any of our feedback. |It just felt like they didn‚Äôt care very much. |A real shame.
Incredible experience. Must stay for a family vacation to the Bay Area.
Beautiful hotel, excellent location and service. Will definitely stay there again next time I am in SF!

Great location! Very family friendly, clean rooms, easy to get around downtown SF. Service was great, everyone was so nice and attentive. Inside rooms don‚Äôt have a view at all but it‚Äôs as advertised.
Everything was excellent. Very clean, classy , and great customer service. We wish, we could have stayed longer.

We love the Argonaut Hotel. This is our second Visit . We chose the Hotel for the location, the service, the ambiance the rooms  We were surprised to be greeted by Angel again , he is so friendly and helpful. We  also upgraded to a corner suite! This offers such comfort and a cozy place to relax.  Angel was friendly every time we walked by the desk.|Also enjoyed, Stephen, Brendan and coco.

Staying in an upscale hotel is always worth it, in my opinion.
Top notch service all around and the location cannot be beat.
Definitely, spend the extra 30 bucks for a view of the bay.

This hotel has amazing staff. They are efficient, friendly & welcoming. Especially Luis Flores who helped me leave a nice gift for my partner in his hotel room.
The interior decor is nice and soothing. It is a short walk to the water and promenade. The rooms are comfortable.
I would definitely recommend coming here.
Great location, close to everything.  The room is a good size, with the desk since I was on a business trip. Very nice restaurant on premises. Spacious lobby, good for meetings

The hotel is very comfortable.  Service is generally very good.  I stayed at this hotel for a week.  However, for one day of my stay the service failed to provide me with any towels or even a bath mat.  I had to run to an important meeting and, without these basic amenities, had to resort to drying myself with hand towels.  That was -- and is-- unacceptable.  I complained to the hotel and was ignored.  For that reason I am downgrading the hotel's review.
Did not stay there, random spammer!

I was surprised to find such a cool, independent hotel right in the heart of the tourist zone of Fisherman's Wharf in SF. The atmosphere was great and the staff were attentive and kind. What a gem! And I really appreciated their sustainability efforts and that they were Green Certified by the San Francisco Green Business Program. I will definitely be back!
My favorite place to stay in SF. Close to everything!

Tile in bathroom  and room needs better cleaning. Overpriced and paying only for location. Valet parking was overpriced. The restaurant was great for breakfast, large portions and tasted great. Rooms were average at best but the main public areas were very nice. Friendly staff. Considering we couldn‚Äôt check in until after 4 we paid wayyyyy too much for one night.
This is by far one of the best hotels that we have stayed at. The rooms and the service were impeccable. Highly recommend!
Good hotel Great location

Reserved a deluxe king room through Costco travel.  Going up there to meet family.  Arrived late.  Brother waiting in lobby.  Checked in and was assigned room 401. Brother and I went up together.  We both gasped when we opened the door.  Argonaut had upgraded me to a gloriously beautiful suite.  I‚Äôve been to some nice places, but this was easily the largest and nicest suite I have ever been in.

Stayed Thursday through Monday.  The level of service matched the quality of the room.  Corinne at the front desk was exceptionally kind, patient and helpful.

The location is pretty great.  Short walk to the F train stop to go to Embarcadero and Giants Stadium.  Short walk the other way to the bus stop for the #19 bus which links to the rest of the city.  Great place, great location.

I‚Äôm so happy I booked this hotel. It‚Äôs in the perfect location. The cable car is 1 minute walk, there is also a great coffee shop, Cafe de Casa opposite the cable car. The hotel is situated at the beginning of the seafront so you can start your walk towards the piers with lots to see and do along  the way.
The hotel itself is excellent. My room was comfortable, clean and spacious. The staff are very friendly and polite.
Their restaurant, the Blue Mermaid, serves delicious food.
A really good experience.
Basil Benedetti

Just had 6 days staying here. Excellent hotel, welcoming, helpful, clean.
The breakfast included in our stay was lovely.
Our room was very clean and the bed was very big and comfortable.
Would definitely recommend

The room was not properly cleaned ‚Äî there were food crumbs on the carpet, and the mug was not clean enough to use. The walls were thin, and I could clearly hear conversations from the neighboring room. However, the location was good. Food was good too.
The hotel was beautiful, clean and in a great location with easy access to several tour sights.
Be prepared to pay $85 a night for parking. On street parking free after time on signs, this is what I chose. No issues. Saved $85 üëåüèª

I don‚Äôt normally leave a review like this but it was rather upsetting for the money we spent for the last few days of our honeymoon. Firstly the location is great, the hotel is clean and a nice size room.
However we had what sounded like a party next door to us through paper thin walls we could hear everything. We eventually called down at 1am to ask if they could call up next door to tell them to quiet down however they didn‚Äôt ask what side, said they will do and the ‚Äòparty‚Äô continued until gone 3am. Following that evening our AC unit rattled ridiculously loud we had to turn it off but it continued making a whirling noise for several hours as well as the fridge and pipes in the bathroom whenever next door flushed the toilet. You can just hear everything next door and above.
We have also been to plenty of hotels on our trip where they have made us aware of the holding charge and how much, but here the person at the desk was very transactional and did not warn us about the $300+ holding charge‚Ä¶ my husband and I are concerned for being charged so much without even communicating it (hoping we receive this back promptly)
Dinner at the restaurant, did not stay at the hotel.  Small value for price. Water glasses still dirty with lipstick, food was average. Expected more from the reviews that led me to pickup the place.
Luxury Hotel, Very near to beach and cable car starting point. Good place to walk near by tourism places..
Wow. I mean, wow. What a perfect hotel. From the service to the gorgeous rooms. Amenities. Location. Just wonderful. If you are visiting San Francisco, stay HERE.

I stayed at the Argonaut for a work trip. I was running around the city for work and having to come back to my room to work some more. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Steven was particularly awesome. He accommodated me so I could take a late meeting and the staff held onto my bags (and my husband‚Äôs who met me after check out) until we were ready to head out of SF. After two weeks of work travel, Steven and the staff made me feel so much less stressed finishing my trip.
Joanna and staff were so wonderful to us during our stay.

Check in was great, Steven is very professional yet welcoming and funny at the same time.  Suite was nice and it was  clean, bed comfortable.  Bathtub was dirty and we did not use it.  Since our last stay it seems like this hotel is more geared towards the tourist and not locals wishing to stay there.  Everything feels like an up-sale from the $20 stuffed seal on the bed to the strategically place bottles of wine and water in the room. All placed with glasses, yet no pricing anywhere.  Are they complimentary or?  We left them alone as they didn't appeal to us as we were heading to Gary Danko's for an elegant dinner near by. (the only reason we stayed here on this night).  Check out was not as nice as check-in, it was more here ya go get out.
Received printed copy of room bill and we left.  Two days later receive an email with a new invoice stating we are being charged for eating a bag of Cheeze-it's and Tates cookies.  We did not! First diabetic people can't or at least shouldn't eat that junk and second I suspect they are trying to just up-charge us thinking we are tourist or the maid stole them.  But it definitely wasn't us.   This hotel is off our list.  Beware of your bill people check it well.
Tried to call their billing department after the usual phone tree garbage, press 1 the press 2 then press .... ending up talking to an answering machine.  Lets see if and when I get a call back.
Additionally this was a Thursday night in early may yet we enjoyed (NOT) the loud motorcycles and cars racing up and down the street until about 11 pm.

Its location was really good. On our second day the gentleman receptionist was very kind to give us recommendations about the city however we had a bad experience at the beginning. We booked through
Booking.com , in its picture of the room it was showing a room facing the sea but what we received was a room facing another room( very depressing actually ), the receptionist only offered to change the room with an expensive fee.

Super clean rooms and quiet for San Francisco whether outward or inward (courtyard) facing.

The rooms facing the bridge have the best views in San Fran

I stayed at the Argonaut recently and had a really enjoyable experience. The location is absolutely fantastic, right in the heart of everything and perfect for exploring San Francisco on foot.

All the staff I encountered were friendly, professional and courteous. A special mention goes to Brendan and Matt, who were both incredibly helpful and genuinely went above and beyond to assist. They made a great impression and added a personal touch to the stay.

The room was spacious, with plenty of storage, a comfortable bed and a nice modern shower with good amenities. It was clean, well kept and ideal for relaxing after a day out in the city.

I had breakfast at The Blue Mermaid, which is attached to the hotel. The free option included one pastry and one drink, which felt a little stingy. I upgraded to a cooked breakfast. It was OK overall, though probably a bit pricey for the quality. I only ate there in the morning so can‚Äôt comment on the rest of the menu.

Overall, it was a great stay in a lovely hotel with fantastic staff. I would certainly book the Argonaut again and recommend it to others looking for a comfortable and well-located base in San Francisco.

Well appointed and clean rooms. Perfect location by the bay with the ability to safely get outside and walk/go for a run/bike ride through Fort Mason, through Marina field, and all the way to the Golden Gate. Hyde  St cable car is right nearby!  Staff members so kind and helpful! Left my jewels in the safe, and housekeeping brought them to management where I was able to swing back through the city to pick them up. So very grateful to them. Joanna Boyle of ‚ÄúThe Social Butterfly‚Äù concierge services in the hotel was so helpful with ideas of where to go, made us a dinner reservation where we got a window seat at a popular restaurant, and she was just a delight! Our family (two teens, my husband and I) highly recommends the Argonaut!

The Argonaut was the perfect place for the one night we stayed in San Francisco. Great location, excellent customer service from all the employees we interacted with. My one suggestion would be to request a room on the top floor. Older buildings are tough to soundproof, and it sounded like the group who was staying above us were running a daycare for toddlers from 3am through the rest of the night.

We had a fantastic stay at the Argonaut. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The hotel is perfectly located for visiting fisherman‚Äôs wharf and the local area, with the vintage tram starting just around the corner. Both ladies on the concierge desk were amazing and helpful. I organised an in room massage which was just what I needed. And Dad got tips on the perfect place for an evening glass of wine.
I would highly recommend the Argonaut hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco

(truly 4.5 stars). great location right by the water. the hotel itself was nice and clean. the restaurant was nice and convenient but very expensive. I would recommend this hotel but felt like it was slightly overpriced.
The windows in the rooms  are old and neither sound nor wind proof. Knowing that this is a noisy and windy place you certainly know what it means.

Paid for the king suite with bay view.
Highest room level.
Room was beautiful however WORST VIEW AND THE NOISE WAS HORRID.  we were placed right above the bar, horribly loud music that shook the floor. Our View was of the  restaurant  across the street. NO BAY in sight.  Would NEVER STAY there again. Beware if you choose the king suite with bay view!
Sharon really helped us out checking in late at night with a toddler and infant - location is amazing - rooms are great
Wonderful hotel excellent location staff can not do enough to help make my stay more enjoyable
Great location near the wharf and very kid friendly. Service was wonderful and Sharon at the front desk was extremely helpful and kind to our 2 kids!
Great location and proximity to all SF city has to offer.

As an international visitor I'm comparing this to other hotels in the world.
The beds were very comfortable, reception staff very helpful although understaffed on one occasion so I gave up waiting.
Internet was unusable, the hotel tried hard and got me connected but as soon as I went back to my room the speed was so slow we could not use it. We had four devices all experienced the same problem, even when they gave us another network to try. By reception it did work much better but no good within the room. Service connected but no bandwidth capacity.
QR code for room service did not work, displayed table not found message. Tried to call, no answer. After going to reception I was told it was closed already, I think it was soon after 9pm. I thought the whole point of room service was to get food late at night, obviously not here. Luckily there is an in & out just up the road.
The room fridge had nothing in it, not sure why they take a $100 per night deposit?
These things may be usual here, but I'm sure many visitors are from other countries, the price was high and I expected more, so I won't be staying here again.

If there's ever a problem, they go out of their way to make sure you're taken care of.  Don't miss the restaurant.  Their clam chowder and fish and chips was outstanding, as was the wait staff.  Overall great stay (my 3rd time in a row staying there)

This hotel deserves a 5-star rating in every sense. From the moment I arrived, I was warmly welcomed by the most thoughtful, caring, and sincere staff‚Äî(thank you, Steven) in an incredibly pleasant way to begin my stay. The service throughout was impeccable. I was offered complimentary water bottles and helpful information that made me feel genuinely looked after.

The room amenities were spotless, well-maintained, and clearly cared for with attention to detail. Everything from start to finish exceeded my expectations. This is a place I will absolutely return to again and again.

I have stayed here for the RSA conference the last two years and have always had an amazing experience.  To be able to walk outside to view classic San Francisco landmarks like Alcatraz, the Golden Gate Bridge, Ghirardelli Square, and Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf is an amazing way to finish a long business day.  The staff is infinitely helpful and kind and the rooms have all the amenities I could want.  Plenty of food around as well.

This hotel is not worth it. Old raggedy carpeting and the la k of a stellar view. I had to clean the bathroom myself. The desk is stained with all kinds of liquids had to clean it off. This place is raggedy.
Great hotel and awesome location!

The hotel staff was fabulous. From the time the guy took my car till they checked me in, everybody was wonderful. The room. was OK. It was. clean. The floor in the room was going downhill. And then they had given us an upgrade to this room. If we had paid the full price it probably was not worth it The other room we booked was small. because of the location. And the personnel. I would recommend this hotel.

This hotel is fantastic.  I have been here a few times, and it seems to get better every time. The staff is kind, welcoming, and knowledgeable.  I have never been disappointed.

ON my most recent trip, Steven & Coco helped me out huge. I accidentally booked one night instead of 2 nights.  It was highly stressful, since i had business meetings all day.  And my fiance was going to have to vacate the room.
THey were booked solid, and things looked hopeless.  They put in a ton of extra work to move reservations around, and make things happen for me.  They were booked solid anyway.  So, they could have just told me I was screwed.  That would have been th easy route.

This place is fantastic no matter what. But this type of service and effort makes me an even more loyal customer.
Sharon did a great job checking me in. Very nice and professional
I paid for a higher price for an upgraded "city view" room. The room was looking directly at the wall of another building. No view at all. Totally scammed by hotel.
Stayed over easter weekend, really loved the staff and front desk they never had a no. Will be coming here every time we come to San Francisco. Really Recommend

A fabulous experience all-round.  Very helpful, friendly staff, great rooms with themed decor, comfortable bed, fabulous location next to the cable car terminal, Ghiradelli Chocolate and Fisherman's Wharf, and a nice restaurant onsite.
If you haven't been to San Francisco before, make sure you book a room with a view of the Golden Gate Bridge!  We loved our stay!
Great hotel!
The best customer service and the best hotel in San Francisco! Thank you Angel, Sharon and Steven for taking care of myself and my family during our stay.

The hotel is very quaint, I just Love the architecture and people here are super friendly. Sharon at the front desk couldn‚Äôt have been nicer. We had a Bay View which I would highly recommend. First time visiting California from Ohio and my wife and I had a great time.
Lovely, well- maintained hotel in a great location. Would definitely stay again !

This was our third time coming to this site because of its location near the wharf and our experiences from the past.   We actually like this location because it forces us to walk around to see everything that the wharf area has to offer AND it‚Äôs a way to burn off food as you have to walk back to the hotel.
This was our first time bringing our 7 year old daughter as we wanted to share the experience with her.  The staff were nothing short of amazing and went above and beyond to make her feel welcomed.  We had a two queen bed room facing the bay.  This time we got the Alcatraz view and it was great to see my daughter enjoy that view of the bay.   The rooms we get are always clean and fully stocked with what we need‚Ä¶.sound proof too.
The best part of this trip and I know this is a small little hype but my wife forgot her earplugs and sleep mask.  The hotel apparently had a bunch of them in stock for guests like my wife.
The restaurant attached was always delicious and we normally utilize it as our breakfast spot before hitting the town.

Fantastic hotel! The location is amazing - right on the wharf and easy walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants, and things to do. The room was spacious and comfortable! Would stay again and highly recommend.

The Argonaut Hotel is in San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf. As someone who lives nearby, I have not stayed there, but I've heard many positive comments from friends who have. This review looks at the hotel‚Äôs history rather than its services.

The hotel is located in the historic Haslett Warehouse. This warehouse was built between 1907 and 1909 by the California Fruit Canners Association, which later became known as Del Monte. At one time, it was part of the world's largest fruit and vegetable cannery. Architect William Mooser designed the building, which features red brick walls and Douglas fir beams, reflecting the industrial style of its time.

Canning stopped in 1939, and the building was used for various purposes until the National Park Service took it over in 1978. In 2001, plans were made to turn the warehouse into a boutique hotel. However, in March 2002, a five-alarm fire caused significant damage and delayed the project. I remember that night well. Aaron Peskin was the District 3 Supervisor at the time, representing the Fisherman's Wharf area. He played a key role in saving the old historic walls from demolition. Despite the fire setback, restoration continued, and the Argonaut Hotel opened in August 2003.

Today, the Argonaut Hotel has 252 rooms decorated in a nautical theme to celebrate the building's maritime history. The ground floor also includes the San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park's Visitor Center, which offers guests insights into the area's rich seafaring heritage.

Spacious rooms with first-class box spring beds ‚Äì we slept very well. The solid brick walls give a high-quality, quiet feeling. However, at check-in (12:00), we specifically asked for a quiet room, and the receptionist assured us we‚Äôd get one. But when we arrived later, we were given a noisy room by the street and next to a loud ventilation system. Thankfully, we could switch to a great room on the 4th floor.

Another issue: we were told we‚Äôd get a $15 credit for the restaurant, but it was only mentioned verbally. The next evening we ate there and paid by card ‚Äì only afterward did we remember the credit. Reception then said nothing could be done. A simple voucher would‚Äôve avoided this frustration.

Overall, still a very good hotel ‚Äì just a few things to improve.

Albergo nella zona pi√π bella di San Francisco, Fisherman's Wharf, comodissimo per raggiungere a piedi l'imbarco per Alcatraz e il molo 39 ricco di negozi e ristoranti. Camere spaziose, in stile marinaro. Personale cortese e disponibile.

Very clean, nice hotel to the far east side of the wharf district. It's located in a great spot right next to parks and Ghirardelli Square, just down the hill from Lombard Street. The staff is very nice and helpful and the general hospitality is excellent. Really liked the restaurant the Blue Marlin as well and came back more than once, something we usually wouldn't do with a hotel restaurant.

if you want to be close to Fisherman‚Äòs Wharf And Pier 39, this is a great hotel to stay in while in San Francisco. Only a few minutes walk to Ghirardelli Square, across the street from the California line Trolley.  Can‚Äôt say enough about the location. The hotel was clean and well kept. The staff were friendly, courteous, and helpful. More of a boutique hotel atmosphere.  Would recommend upgrading to a bay view room.

My wife and I celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary this weekend, and we couldn't have chosen a better place to stay!  Conveniently located for all of our outings, staffed with friendly and knowledgeable professionals, we were shown personal care that made this trip even more special!  Can't wait to go back!

I will ONLY stay here when I come to SF for work. And also - 100%, most definitely haunted. üòÇ

The hotel: I was SO impressed by the staff here. Most all of the staff called me by name, asked me how my day was, delivered my luggage and packages to my room. They were always in a good mood and it was overall just a breath of fresh air. Comfy beds, amazing food, and just a super cozy spot in a safe part of the city.

The ghost story: I was staying in room 4024 (I think!) - and at around 4:00 in the morning, something woke me up. I'm still not sure what. I am partially deaf, so I normally sleep through the night. I looked down the hallway in my room and the bathroom light was turned on. I knew that the light was set to be motion activated. I sat there for a while and waited for it to turn off, which it did. And about 30 seconds later, it turned back on, and I heard things moving around on the counter in the bathroom. It sounded like my makeup powder jar being shifted and picked up a few times. This lasted about 60 seconds. I eventually got up to look, but there was nothing there, and it was too hard to tell what if anything had been moved. Needless to say it took me an hour to fall back asleep. üòÇ - I didn't feel super scared at all, it was just an experience that was unexplainable. I did try to explain it. I even looked up any seismic activity that could have caused it to give an explanation and there was nothing on that date / time reported. I tested how sensitive the motion light was and I had to fully walk in the bathroom for it to turn on, it wasn't sensitive at all. If it was only the light, ok - it could be electrical. But the fact that it happened twice, and I heard what sounded like someone in the bathroom moving my things around? üëÄ

I asked the front desk about it and they kindly turned the motion setting off for me for the final night haha. Overall - LOVE this spot, it felt like a home away from home and the spooky element added a fun paranormal experience & reminder of the history behind the location.

When booking over the phone, we were told we would have a double queen with "two large windows looking out at the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz". Upon arrival, we had one window with a bridge view only. Felt like a bait and switch. Otherwise, fine hotel. Just be careful what you are told if booking over the phone!

Overall beautiful and in a great location.   It's a very nice hotel.

Avoid the blue mermaid, we did not have good experiences there during each of our 3 instances, and the Wifi was bad. (low single digit downstream with high latency, and it's unsecured.)
The hotel is beautiful and in a great location.

pretty decent hotel with classical style, super close to Fisherman Wharf Pier and the Chocolate Factory, has rental car company nearby as well. They have a restaurant called Blue Mermaid as well for breakfast, lunch and dinner serving. The ice-cream shop is good by the way.

Don‚Äôt stay here!!  We had a terrible experience!  The staff was very unfriendly and unaccomodating.  The bed was hard as a rock and there were no chest of drawers to store clothes.  We had to live out of our suitcases.  Needless to say, we got a refund and went to a much better hotel the next day.
Stayed in this hotel during the recent business trip, 5 star overall experience. And shoutout for Corinne‚Äôs great hospitality and definitely bringing additional joys to the trip!

Nice bell/maid staff and location but I would NOT rate this a four star hotel. ‚ÄúBay view‚Äù was staring into a shop and restaurant across the street. Tiny bathroom with no space to set anything, tiny tub don‚Äôt even think about a bath. Website said there was in-room yoga and spa services, so why is reception clueless about these amenities? In-room Nintendo also nowhere to be found. We heard sneezing and TV next door, stomping and jumping above and EVERYTHING happening in the hall. Parking, food, minibar‚Äîeverything $$$$ and on top of that they charge a daily ‚Äúresort fee‚Äù.  Overall a disappointing stay.

As always it was OUTSTANDING!

Location, safety, service, ambiance all TREMENDOUS!

THE ARGONAUT ROCKS!
John C - Yuba City Ca
Check for their specials that include valet parking- very friendly + professional staff when you arrive at the front door!
Awesome hotel: high quality, clean, nicely equipped and great location
Great location, kind staff, clean quiet room (inside courtyard view probably masked roadside traffic).  We'd love to stay again.
Beautiful Hotel and the service is always top notch. We attended for an event and everything went wonderful and smooth!

We enjoyed our 2 N/3D stay. Expensive but reachability and travel with kids became very easy.
Neat hotel and food options are also decent.
Grt place to eat
Awesome hotel. I loved the nautical theme. Staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean. Location was great.

Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Highlights: walking in the mornings before the crowds arrive to the fishermen‚Äôs wharf.

John with his sense of humor and hospitality.

I stayed 2 nights at The Argonaut over the weekend, and being classified as a 4 star hotel but having outdated bathrooms with shower curtains and $8 water bottles in the room was not what I expected and frankly disappointing. The location is nice, but you can get better value at other hotels in the area.
Excellent location

Having been a loyal customer for many years including over 20 nights in 2024 and 3nights last week - we arrived on the last leg of our US holiday to be told there was a ‚Äúmaintenance‚Äù problem and we were shipped off to a local hotel. After travelling all day this was incredibly frustrating and disappointing- particularly as they sell themselves as a hotel that respects loyalty- there was a conference on and they obviously oversold and loyalty went out the window when there was a buck to be made. Ironically I have also recommended this hotel to many travelers to SF - which makes the experience even more frustrating
Location is ideal on the waterfront, next to the Hyde Park cable car depot, and the BV Cafe.

We had an ocean view with a direct line of site to Alcatraz. It was very comfortable and surprisingly quiet given the location. The hotel is a great option even if the wharf isn't your primary destination. We'll definitely stay there again.

What a bad experience! I made a reservation several months in advance. Thinking this would be a great place to stay. I had visited the attached restaurant a few times. Staff were always so helpful and courteous.

We suddenly needed to cancel a full 2 months in advance. They wouldn't work with us at all. They will keep everything, "it's just non-refundable" over and over. Would only let us change dates with a few days. When you want to stay around home for a close family memeber with stage 4 cancer, it's tough luck.

I travel to SF a couple times a year, and I will never even consider them again.

I am sure the rooms are nice, but unfortunately, this is my one and only experience with them.
Wonderful stay. I don't think that 900$ a night was worth the suite.  Maybe if your there longer. Two nights was hard to situated.
Great location!  Close to touristy things!  Beautiful view of Golden Gate bridge from our room!  Room was cozy and well appointed!  Would definitely stay there again!
The location was perfect for us easy to walk around with trolley and big bus blocks away

Bonne ambiance tr√®s bonne viande Luis est un serveur parfait nous reviendrons avec plaisir et nous conseillons cet √©tablissement sans probl√®me. L'emplacement et le service sont impeccables. Great location right at the waterfront. Helpful employees. Room is with great view and classy decor.
Loved this beautiful hotel, location was perfect, staff was kind and courteous. I will definitely be coming back.
Great location
Mold and mildew, worn/broken furniture and paper-thin walls where I could hear coughing, talking and worse. Positives: beautiful old building, nice reception.

The Argonaut understands hospitality. All of the staff went out of their way to make sure that our stay was amazing. The onsite restaurant Blue Mermaid was also really good. On the hotel side, Luis, Steven, Tenzin and several others went out of their way to accommodate us during our 6 day stay and make our stay wonderful.  One of our favorite destinations. Good value for money, excellent service and a first class location.
As Australians, this was our third visit over eight years.
Would recommend as comfortable and welcoming without any fancy trimmings.

The hotel vibes are really nice, the location are super accessible, the staff were kind, helpful and polite and they have a lot of flexibility to have a wonderful trip. So I highly recommend it. Chat out to Corinne if you need any assistance.

will never find a better location for a hotel. boutique, on brand and beautiful.

Loved staying here. The staff were all really friendly and helpful. Clean and quiet rooms, comfy beds and prime location by the ocean. Situated towards the end of fishermans wharf so you avoid some of the commotion and noise  and have easy access to the park/walking path to see the Golden Gate.

Holiday stay at the Argonaut Hotel was excellent . Our room was very comfortable and spacious. All the staff were professional. This is a San Francisco treat! Hope to stay again soon. Also don‚Äôt miss out on the Blue Mermaid...

We were delighted with our stay at the Argonaut! The hotel kindly upgraded us to a beautiful room with a view of the Golden Gate bridge. The hotel felt so cozy and welcoming to return to after our days of exploring San Francisco. We especially appreciated the fireplace in the lobby, where our sons liked to sit and play Connect Four. We also loved how the hotel was within easy walking distance of so many attractions, including the trolly stop and Ghirardelli's. We will certainly be back!

The location is top notch right at fisherman's wharf, you can't really beat the area in SF.  As for the hotel, 5* all the way. The rooms are gorgeous and have great character. It doesn't feel like a bland Hilton room or anything like that, where a room in Dubai is essentially the same room as a room in Hawaii. The hotel really owns the maritime theme of their surroundings, which we loved. The service is 5*+. The attention to detail and the little things set them apart, like leaving a Sea Lion plush animal in the bed for our 3 year old daughter to working with us on late check out. I will be coming back here next time we're in San Francisco.
great hotel, beautiful location near bus stops, cable car locations, near everything, staff super friendly and kind, rooms clean and comfy beds

Booked 3 rooms at the Argonaut during the holidays and were very satisfied with our entire experience.  The rooms were spacious and clean, the Blue Mermaid restaurant had excellent food and service, the staff was beyond helpful and cordial and lastly the location is perfect.  Close enough to the Wharf but not right in the middle.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend to anyone.
Great hotel.  The Wharf area can be a bit touristy and get pretty busy, but overall a great area.

I am so happy I was referred to the perk offered here of luggage storage! Because of this amazing service I was able to check off a bucket list item and visit Muir Woods knowing my belongings were safe before my flight. Jason and Junior were immediately helping me at the door and took care of getting me in and out seamlessly. Shey was my hero after a day of walking and loaded my suitcases into the Uber for me so I could be on my way. After a week in SF and multiple interactions, theirs were tops for guest customer care ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Let me start by saying that I would give a 5 star review of this hotel, however with the obsessive amount of noise that will prevent you from relaxing and getting rest, which is the main thing one would be looking for when booking a hotel, then I cannot honestly give 5 stars. Whether it was noise traveling through the walls from neighboring rooms or stomping from rooms above, you won‚Äôt be able to get passed the loud noises. Then top it off with the street noise right outside the rooms on the street below. Our last night here, there was a gathering of low rider vehicles who had their sound systems up so loud, all you could hear is the base rattling the walls of the room. Not much that the hotel could do about it, but they knew that this took place on a regular basis when the weather is good outside. Sure wish they would‚Äôve have mentioned this when booking! Nonetheless, if extreme noises are your thing, stay here. If you‚Äôre liking to get rest and be able to relax, beware. It‚Äôs an expensive nights stay to not be able to enjoy your stay.

Edited Review: I was called by the restaurant manager and my frustrations were addressed wonderfully.  I am grateful for your patience with me and I look forward to reattempting my visit in the future.
As a warning, be very sure that you know if you really want breakfast for your bookings, otherwise, pick the Valet package.
That is my takeaway.
Otherwise, the hotel is great, and we really enjoyed our stay.

We've stayed here twice. If you want to be in the Fisherman's Wharf area, don't even think about it... just book The Argonaut. It cannot be beat in terms of location, service, and quality. Everything is top-to-bottom perfect.

Wonderful location with incredible views.  Very friendly staff, cozy fireplace in the lobby, comfortable beds and real down pillows.  Walk right to the cable car round-about, hear the seals barking in the morning, watch the mist rise from the ocean.  We loved our little local staycation.  Will be back!

I recently  had the pleasure of staying at the Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco, and I must say, it was a memorable experience that deserves recognition. From the moment I checked in, I was impressed by the cleanliness and comfort of the room. It was spotless, well-appointed, and remarkably quiet‚Äîa perfect retreat after a day exploring the city. I also want to commend the hotel for maintaining such a fresh and odor-free environment, even though it is pet-friendly. It made me wish I had brought my dog instead of leaving her at a boarding facility!

One highlight of my stay was the excellent customer service. During checkout, I noticed unexpected charges on my final bill. After reaching out to the team, Angel Palacios, the Front Desk Supervisor, responded swiftly and professionally. They identified the error, issued a refund for the charges, and even went above and beyond by waiving the daily guest amenity fees as a gesture of goodwill. This level of attentiveness and care turned a potential inconvenience into a positive experience.

Additionally, I want to give special kudos to the Blue Mermaid restaurant. I forgot to bring dining utensils, but their staff kindly provided us with plates and silverware without hesitation. It‚Äôs these thoughtful touches that truly elevate a guest‚Äôs stay.

If there‚Äôs one small improvement I‚Äôd suggest, it would be offering complimentary refreshments in the lobby or waiting area. However, I understand that health codes may pose a challenge. I‚Äôd also love to see bidets added to the bathrooms‚Äîan amenity that would add extra comfort and convenience for guests.

The Argonaut Hotel has left a lasting impression with its outstanding service, attention to detail, and guest-centric approach. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco‚Äîit‚Äôs a gem that combines charm, comfort, and top-notch hospitality.

The hotel is very good, but the location of the hotel is very excellent. I recommend it because it is close to Pier 39, restaurants and shops and overlooks the golden Gate.
Neat and Tidy.
Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Argonaut Hotel.

I'd recommend this hotel any day of the week. The rooms were very comfortable, the staff was excellent, the location was outstanding! John at the door had a smile every time and was courteous and knowledgeable. I'll definitely be back!

Great room, comfortable bed, and an amazing staff.  I would rate 5 stars were it not for $8 bottled water and describing the interior light-well as a ‚Äúcourtyard‚Äù view because they tossed a few planters on the roof.
Enjoyed our stay here and definitely will be back!! Great location and beautiful inside the hotel, clean and neat

Argonaut hotel exemplifies the true meaning of Hospitality.
Guestrooms are very clean and welcoming.

They provide excellent guest service.

The hotel location is the best in San Francisco.
THANK YOU to Management and staff for the wonderful stay.
I will definitely stay there again for future visits and will recommend it to everyone for both business and leisure. The hotel itself and the staff exceeded my expectations.
ARGONAUT HOTEL is the BEST Hotel in San Francisco!
Excellent location, staff, clean and organized.  Very cozy and comfortable.

Overall badly disappointed for the service and the location. The Argonaut has potential but the service just plainly is not good. From the front desk to the room service is extremely overpriced for what the service provided. There was dust everywhere and it seemed like no one has ever vacuumed the room in weeks because there was trash and dust from previous guests underneath the bed which made our stay very unpleasant due to dust allergies. The location although historic,  is next to a park full of homeless and reckless behavior by teenagers with motorcycles, it just doesn't feel safe. The parking garage charges 75 dollars per day that's way too expensive therefore guests need to go and look for alternatives and end up digging on more of the crime that surrounds that community. Definitely not a 4 star hotel, sorry.

This hotel is a great option when staying in San Francisco, specially if you want to be near the cable bus, which station is just up the block. I found it really relaxing since there aren‚Äôt a lot of people on the street, however there aren‚Äôt many shopping options either. The chocolate shop nearby, Ghirardelli, is really good and I totally recommend you to try it ‚Äìwaiting lines here are huge, so be patient; it‚Äôs totally worth it! There are also many great restaurants in the area which you can walk to in less than 15 minutes; of course, you can always dine at the hotels restaurant, which is also really tasty. Overall this has been a great experience and I can tell you you won‚Äôt regret to stay here.

Perfect choice for our quick trip to San Francisco. We could not have been more pleased with the room and the view. The location was spot on for the things we had planned during our trip. The staff was friendly and helpful. The establishment was very clean and we loved the extra amenities provided. The beds were comfy too!

Very nice hotel, with a great location. Walking distance to Pier 39, the start of the cable car line and other places, but not too much traffic and noise. The Blue Mermaid restaurant right next to it is nice and make sure you visit the museum next door. Also, you have to go for an original Irish Coffee at the Buena Vista Caf√© just around the corner.
Perfectly placed hotel, well furbished and with a quirky style. Very clean and comfortable, and the staff we encountered were great.

Awesome location we walked everywhere‚Ä¶in the rain and wind and still all good!  We visited during November and weather was rainy, windy and a little chilly but not miserable. We found the restaurant here very good with many options.  We found restaurants within walking distance and spent more than we should for some Ghirardelli chocolates as the square was right next door! Had the weather been a little better and had we more time we could have walked have a block to catch the start of the trolley cars - we splurged for a day excursion to Alcatraz and Muir Woods through aviator and this was a perfect way to see - however- once here at hotel found the6 have a concierge you could coordinate tours with so wish I had investigated prior to - we took a transfer from Transfeero.com to and from airport for 80 bucks each way for 2 -  we highly recommend! !
Great location.  Nice rooms & service.  Would highly recommend

Rooms are in need of an update, especially for the price.

The hotel is beautiful and in a great location.  However the front desk staff at this hotel are less than helpful and basically do not communicate anything about the hotel, amenities, procedures, or charges on your card.  Before you give them a credit card you had better ask them what they intend to do with it to avoid surprises like we had, since they won't volunteer this information up front.

The location is unbeatable. It is half a block from the beach and huge park with museums. It is part of a national park building and has a museum in it as well. It is adjacent to the cable car stop. It is a ten minute walk downhill from the section of Lombard that is considered the world‚Äôs most crooked street. You can walk to Pier 39. The hop on hop off stop is down the street. Alcatraz is visible in the distance. We booked through Costco for extra perks. It was an amazing stay and will definitely return if staying in the area.

Amazing experience from the rooms, comfy bedding and views to the friendly and professional staff; This is our go to when we're in one of the most ecclectic and culturally significant cities on the planet.

Quiet rooms,  great view of the bay and in a perfect location! Wouldn't stay anywhere else in San Francisco.  So many things to do and places to eat nearby. Absolutely loved everything about the hotel and staff! Stayed in a queen, bayview room.

Terrible hotel whose sole goal is to extract as much money from their guests as possible while providing subpar services.

I came expecting more because of the good reviews, but ultimately, it's a big disappointment.

The hotel is dated, and not super well cleaned. The shampoo/conditioner is the lowest quality you can get (basically what you'd expect from a Motel Six). For the price and the crazy high resort fee ($75), you'd certainly expect more.

They charge $5 for a small bottle of water, and fill the room with candy that they can't wait to gouge you on. They have coffee, but don't have any tea bags to offer (come on! They're really not that expensive, do you really have to cheap out here when you charge so much already?)

They also don't have a microwave. And when asked about it, the receptionist gave some "oh it's cause of the fire code" answer. The real answer is that they want to force you into the extremely overpriced hotel restaurant on-site.

All-in-all, it's a hotel designed to extract every penny from rich older people while delivering subpar value. I'd stay away from this one.
Beautiful hotel in a great location. Wonderful hospitality from front desk and housekeeping. One Blue Mermaid waiter soured our experience. Other than that we enjoyed our stay.

We arrived at the front desk intending to drop off our bags and explore Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf before check-in. Seeing that we had kids, the staff thoughtfully checked if an early check-in was available and then let us into our room‚Äîsuch a kind gesture, and we were really grateful. Every staff member at the Argonaut Hotel was incredibly welcoming and helpful.

The location is also fantastic. Just a short walk to the left brings you to a beautiful beach with views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Ghirardelli Square. Head right, and you‚Äôll find the kids‚Äô favorite, In-N-Out, as well as Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf; walk a little further, and you‚Äôre at Pier 39. Highly recommend this hotel!
Fantastic place for a light lunch and a cocktail. The calamari is to die for...the clam chowder sampler was so delicious.

The hotel doesn't serve breakfast and bed cover was like sleeping under a tarp.

Arrived after a six hour flight and was told that my room wasn't available until tomorrow due to repairs, then sent me to another hotel across town at 11pm. I booked weeks in advance and they didn't say anything until we arrived. The next day the room wasn't ready until 9:30pm, but the hotel they sent me to had checkout at 11am.

Would not return if they paid me. Go to the Zephyr or Hotel Capri instead, both are better.

Uncomfortable beds, no pool, no hot tub, no sauna, no outside access from your room, no on-site parking... if you stay here then your options for entertainment are to sit in your dark room on your uncomfortable bed and watch TV or leave your room and spend loads of money to do much of anything.

The only things this place has going for it is a decent location and really friendly staff. If you're seeing this review, do yourself a favor a book at one of the dozens of better options in the immediate area.

Nicely situated within the Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf complex. After a very long flight we appreciated our room being ready three hours ahead of check-in. Hotel was well appointed including the gym. Standard but comfortable room. Friendly and accommodating staff. Blue mermaid restaurant was, in our view, one of the better eateries in the area and reasonably priced. We dined there more than once. Would be happy to recommend this hotel.

What would you do if you turned up to a hotel at 7pm and was told that due to a late check out your room wouldn't be available until 9pm? Context, I'd just flown in and the time at home was 3am when I arrived. I saw the air stewards loading up in their bus as I arrived so this looks like standard practice. No alternatives room were available and they wanted to charge full price for my stay. I'm guessing they charged for the late check out too.

The hotel did provide a $100 voucher for the Blue Mermaid bar, which is mediocre in food and drink. The staff were helpful enough. I would have rather been sleeping though.

When I did get to my room, the thin walls meant that I was woken up by the room next door - at least someone was enjoying themselves.

If you like themed hotels in the centre of a tourist village then this might be the place for you.

The Argonaut is our "go to" hotel when visiting SF. They offer top notch service and accommodations. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The Blue Mermaid restaurant offers great food selection, great quality of product and very friendly service. We highly recommend the Argonaut for their accommodations, location and service.
Loved it!!!  You won't be disappointed by the room, staff, view or location.  Very convenient!!
Absolutely one of the nicest hotels anywhere if you like a character hotel.  Great rooms, superior location, quiet and has all the amenities one would expect.

We booked a City View Suite, which vary in size from approximately 600-900 square feet. We requested that we be assigned a corner; the corner suites are larger than the non-corner suites.

The room was spacious and beautifully-appointed in a nautical theme. Sliding wood doors separate the bedroom from the living area and from the bathroom, which had a deep massage tub and a standalone shower. A door separates the main bathroom area from the toilet, which further enhances privacy.

There are two large flat-screen TVs and a formal dining room table and chairs. A hideaway bed couch and two large chairs occupy the living space, along with two smaller tables. The room also has a mini-fridge that contains beverages for purchase if one is so inclined. A small safe sits in the coat closet in the main space, while the bedroom also contains another closet.

Housekeeping service provided by Eva was exceptional, and I want to also single out Josh, Karina, and Brian at the Blue Mermaid for providing service that was above and beyond. The front desk staff was also friendly and helpful.

The location at the end of Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf near Ghirardelli Square and across from the National Maritime Historical Park was optimal. We had stayed near Union Square and/or Market Street and Nob Hill on previous visits but we found this location to be the best and most convenient overall.

***UPDATE***
After seeing Mr. Tony Roumph's response, I actually asked to meet with him (since we were still at the hotel when I had posted the review), especially since his response was so professional, and not at all argumentative. He introduced me to the chef, Mr. Amod Singh. Mr. Singh was personable and friendly and so willing to create a vegetarian Indian meal for us for that evening.

We enjoyed an amazing dinner of dal, rice, and sabji (vegetable) along with a delicious appetizer, pakoras, and finger-licking-good dessert, kheer.

Also, regarding the shower, Mr. Roumph immediately sent a maintenance person to our room to fix the shower handle thing - and it worked perfectly the next morning.

Will I go back to the Argonaut? YES!!

Thank you to Mr. Roumph and Mr. Singh for making our trip even more pleasurable.

*****************************************************************

Rooms are OK, a bit smaller than expected. The bathroom is OLD and needs upgrading, but the shower has good water force. The bathroom is VERY, VERY SMALL, one sink, barely any room to put toiletries.
**
And I miss the amenity kits offered by hotels in the past. These days, it's all about large bottles, locked down, and nothing else - no shower cap or those fragrant hand soaps that I absolutely love. At least 4+ star hotels should bring those back.
***
The drinks served at the restaurant were fantastic....the breakfast, not so much. What's up with such few vegetarian choices?  We thought about having dinner at their Blue Mermaid restaurant but found scarce vegetarian options, surprising since it's SFO, and even more given their chef is Indian, a Mr. Amod Singh.
**
People have got to do more to cater to vegetarian people, and no, offering one or two token dishes is not adequate.
Rushed at checkin, no offering of adjoining room, city view is of an alley.
The bed is really hard.
Stayed 3 nights for start of honeymoon  this place is great, we got a good price and the quality/feel of the hotel is amazing. Very cosy and fitting for the location, helpful staff too

This hotel is absolutely beautiful! Perfect spot within walking distance to several great places to visit and eat. The location of the Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco is excellent, offering a respite from some of the more challenging issues currently affecting the city. However, the overall experience was mixed.

While the hotel‚Äôs location is a strong point, the staff were not particularly friendly or engaging. They performed their duties but did not go beyond the basics to ensure a pleasant experience for guests.

The rooms and hotel facilities are nice, but we did notice that they could benefit from more thorough cleaning. There was a noticeable amount of dust, which detracted from the overall comfort.

Additionally, we had an issue with the air extractor (or AOV system) in our room‚Äîit was quite noisy. The management did offer an apology and a small reduction on the taxes, which was appreciated given that we only stayed for two nights.

Overall, while the location and the hotel's features are good, improvements in staff friendliness and cleaning standards would enhance the guest experience.
Excellent position. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Coming back next year for my birthday
One of my favorite hotels.
My favorite place to stay!
We can‚Äôt wait to spend our honeymoon at your hotel in a few days

They used to have smoked salmon scrambled eggs on the breakfast menu. I also really miss the little wine happy hour in the lobby sitting by the fireplace. So many great memories at The Argonaut. It's just the best!
Lovely hotel, enjoyed our stay
Looking forward to our next stay!
Great hotel, we loved it.
It was so beautiful there!
And the Blue Mermaid Chowder House next to the hotel.
Perfect location to walk everywhere!

The hotel's nautical charm and prime location made it the perfect base for our explorations. Our City View King Room offered a cozy retreat plus a good desk for me to get some travel work done. A sweet view of the cable car turntable and the bay- such a quintessential San Francisco sight!

We checked into the Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco and while the location and the view from the room is amazing, I am absolutely not impressed with the parking situation. I am so not happy with The Argonaut Hotel.

I loved the scenery, water, restaurants, all of it. I couldn‚Äôt sleep though. I kept hearing what sounded like people running on the top floor. I don‚Äôt believe in ghosts or other weird things, but on our last night there after remembering that we were on the top floor. I want to go back because it was so nice

We just returned home from our first stay at the this beautiful hotel. We stayed in the Argonaut suite and the entire experience from beginning to end was nothing short of amazing. The room was beautiful and the views were amazing. The staff went above and beyond to help me pull off a birthday surprise for my husband. The hotel itself is incredible. We love the old historical buildings and the Argonaut did not disappoint. Not to mention, it‚Äôs within walking distance to everything, which makes the location perfect. Thank you Argonaut for being part of such a wonderful vacation! We‚Äôre already planning our trip back!
Perfect location and wonderful staff!
Beautiful property and everyone is so nice!
Great location and beautiful decor! Felt safe
Multiple stays at this property, never disappoints! From the nautical charm to the unbeatable location on the wharf
We are staying at the Argonaut Hotel right by Fisherman's Wharf.  We can see the Golden Gate Bridge from our hotel room when it's not shrouded in fog.
Great place to stay.I loved it.
Great breakfasts! We were just there for a week!
