We love the Argonaut Hotel! We've stayed there before and plan to again pre-cruise in April!¬†
Pretty excited for our trip. We actually added the breakfast, I wonder what there is to offer
We stayed there for 5 days during my Thanksgiving break and we had a great time. We love Argonaut Hotel.
Great Location, at Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf
Can't wait to try it and enjoy your hotel for my pre cruise stay with my parents in a couple weeks.
Is the continental breakfast included or separate?
The view from our hotel in San Francisco. We booked the room especially for a bay view. The best hotel for those types of views is Argonaut hotel right on the parks edge.
The Argonaut seems closer to more ‚Äútouristy‚Äù things and looks like I can get a Golden Gate Bridge view room.
And the Argonaut is a nice hotel, though the clientele can sometimes skew toward Midwestern tourist families. My advice is stay at the Argonaut and consider doing a brunch at the Garden Court.
The Palace is not a bad place, but it's mainly there for history. If you prefer modern amenities, take the Argonaut hotel. It is the best

Compare to LUMA hotel, Riu Plaza, Harbor court hotel ,Argonaut hotel is probably going to be the most centrally located hotel based on the fact that you‚Äôll be doing touristy things and transportation.

Would highly recommend the Argonaut hotel. One of my favorite places to stay and is right where a lot of the sights are. Also connected to the historic trolley and cable cars to get around if you won‚Äôt have a car. Close enough to touristy area without being in it directly. You can get anywhere quickly from where this hotel is and it‚Äôs beautiful as well.

My parents actually still stay there every time they go to San Francisco because they love the quietness. The hotel is also dog friendly and they like to travel with their dogs. I wouldn't say the bar/food/drink options in that area are great. There are definitely homeless people who sleep in doorways and alcoves around there but I don't consider that sketchy.
I‚Äôd very strongly recommend the hotels around Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf over those in Union Square. Check out the Kimpton Alton and the Argonaut. Both are very nice and reasonably priced

The Argonaut would be a better option if you do want to be in a more bustling location where lots of activities are quickly walkable. But yes, it will definitely be louder since it‚Äôs right in a busy area of Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf.
I believe hotel argonaut is lovely and right next to Ghirardelli square.

You should check hotels near Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf area like Argonaut hotel. The prices are surprisingly on the lower end and in the heart of everything that you and your girl friend will want to see. Everything is accessible from there. We stayed at The Argonaut a few weeks ago and it was awesome.
The argonaut hotel is very nice but likely above your expectef budget right now. You could choose Hyatt regency, Marriott union square or Marriott Marquis will be good home bases.
The Argonaut in Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf is very nice. Walk to Ghirardelli Square and take the trolley from just around the corner. Rooms are very nice.
Argonaunt is much nicer views and easy to get around on public transportation
The hotel have a couple bigger rooms with multiple king beds too. Nice hotel
Great hotel with excellent service and walking distance to so much.

Really like the Argonaut hotel it‚Äôs near Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf but not too close and in the old Del Monte building, so it‚Äôs all refurbished brick and super beautiful and very historic. Next to a lot of shopping and tourist attractions like the Wharf, Boudins
The Argonaut is super nice and near wharf!
If you want to stay by the Wharf, the Fairmont Heritage Place and Argonaut are much better choices than Marriott‚Äôs offerings. But Argonaunt is still the best for me.
Great property and location
Great location and very friendly staff
Our stay at The Argonaut was fantastic, the staff were really helpful and friendly and the location was excellent.
Excellent location, extremely clean rooms and comfortable beds. Loads of restaurants in the area.
loved staying here lots of character, clean and great location. we also enjoyed sitting by the fireplace in those big comfy chairs in the lobby.
Love the nautical vibes of the property. Calm and quiet, rooms soundproof is a plus. Would stay here again!
Beautiful building, great location close to fisherman‚Äôs wharf and cable cars. Very helpful and polite staff. Would stay here again
Great location right between the popular wharf shopping and Ghirardelli square. Spacious rooms. Enjoyed our bay view. View of the Golden Gate bridge was an added bonus
We had a greay stay, the property was very beautiful and clean.

Can't beat the location of the Argonaut. Walking distance to so many great restaurants and sights and classic cable car boards right next door! Hotel restaurant is excellent for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Super comfortable rooms, great bedding, and the huge lobby with fireplace is perfect spot for morning coffee or late cocktails! Our 3rd time here, and we will definitely return.
Hotel was great. Unfortunately there was only one chair in the room. My wife and I could not sit and have a coffee/drink.
I really like staying at this hotel. The only drawback is the lack of staffing for the valet parking because it‚Äôs your only option.
Decor in rooms was very nice! Location was great! Not so happy with amenities fee and concierge! Pretty expensive I must say, but I guess it is all about location!
Lovely big rooms with comfy beds. Great location with easy walking to local amenities
On Fisherman's Wharf, nice walkable area. Lots of restaurants in the area and other shopping.
We had a poor experience from the jump, starting at checkin.
Just spent one night. Great view of Alcatraz. Room was great!
Did not have room type booked available. Tried to downgrade me into a tiny dark room without any compensation. Would not book again!
The people were so kind and the hotel was older but very well maintained. We loved everything about our visit and the restaurant, the Blue Mermaid is outstanding.
The stay was excellent, with a view of Alcatraz from the window and excellent service.
The air-conditioner shuts off at night when you are sleeping. I ended up waking up so many times just to turn the aircon back on. I had terrible sleep during my stay. Will not stay there again.

The staff was unhelpful; they played on their phones the entire time and were not interested in assisting the guests.This hotel is in a good location but next time I'll save myself the money and park stay somewhere else.

my family and i went to san francisco for the 4th of july weekend and it was quite hectic to get there. upon arrival at the argonaut hotel, everything changed for us. luis immediately greeted us with a big smile and made the check-in process so smooth and he even escorted us to our room and established that we had everything we needed before he left. he gave us some great recommendations for food and drinks before he left also. throughout our stay, anytime luis saw us in the lobby, he greeted us by name and made sure our stay was comfortable. his professionalism and courteousness was unlike anything i've experienced locally. this was our first time at argonaut hotel, but it definitely won't be our last because of the experience luis gave us. thanks so much for making an otherwise stressful holiday weekend a better and more joyful experience!

location was perfect. hotel is by the beach, close to the cable car stop, and walking distance to pier 39 and the ferris wheel, and a variety of food stalls and restaurants. valet parking available for a fee, which was worth it! all the employees we met, from the front door to the front desk were helpful and friendly! they even gave my kid a toy when we checked in. rooms were clean.

great location for a tourist visit, convenient and scenic. outstanding service. spacious and comfortable rooms. the destination fee includes a dining credit and i was hoping to use it one night, but the bar closes frustratingly early! i love reuse of a historic building, and all the furniture & decor fit in well. having the lobby shared with a national park visitor center underlines that history. surprisingly given that fact, the walls between rooms were quite thin, i could hear a normal-volume phone call by my neighbor, and my colleagues on other floors reported similar.

great atmosphere, nice well maintained historic building. clean ( except the new carpet and little trimmings and the edges weren't done. ). great bed and the accessible shower was done correctly ( not common in hotels). the bar is small and i hope you like common drinks ( not well stocked). the breakfast bakery items and fruit plates were wonderful. the bar (restaurant) staff is very nice and accommodating. the front desk is polite. the concierge is often not there and when they are they do not have a lot of fun answers. overall i would return, and do my homework on what is in walking range.
i paid additional money for an upgraded city view room. it's such a joke that it actually feels like i was taken advantage of.

i dine at the blue mermaid frequently with my family. i'm a long time local of san francisco. last night i was taking a walk from pac heights to the area and needed a bathroom. i figured i would pop into the argonaut hotel since i'm always there for food. the puny little fella behind the counter was rude and inconsiderate and said that i needed to be a hotel guest to use the bathroom when i was already in the lobby and our friend kylie was in room 407. can you believe to my surprise that he would not let me use the lobby restroom?! i've just never heard of such rude customer service or behavior from anyone. the security guard was nicer since he was about to offer it to me until the guy behind the front desk intruded in our conversation and refused the door code. shame on you for refusing a lady a common courtesy task of allowing someone to use your facilities. honestly, i'm still aghast at your thoughtlessness. someone needs to fire him. he has glasses and a hat. he's just a heartless human, sad to say. what has this city become where you can't be kind to locals anymore?

great hotel. the food was good location is amazing and the staff was very helpful. close to a lot of different places and the trolly car is right outside. i even took a sightseeing tour bus and it was outside the hotel as the meet up area.

the room was very comfortable, clean, and well appointed. we had an ocean view on the wharf side and still found it to be surprisingly quiet. the restaurant and bar are the standouts here with really exceptional food and drink. we loved it.
beautiful hotel, excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, large clean room and great food from the mermaid. we will be back!

great hotel and location on the fisherman's wharf. only issue was the local musician who played music off his car speaker every night til 10 pm on the wharf side. rooms are clean and nice, staff is professional and helpful.

yeah, hotel was very spectacular. i had had a great day with a reusing, indulging and still kept water in touch overall was very nice with the baby being very and very comforting but if you am bringing a child, make sure you keep them out of the snack bar or the adopt a seal because they will charge you $10-$20 i however, loved the free amenities. i would recommend staying because it is very close to pier 39 and it is right beside the ocean. also connecting to the restaurant overall was very nice and that's why will be giving us a four star.

location is very good and convenient to many fun things with in walking distance. however, the room with an exterior view is extremely noisy with amplified street music and car traffic. make sure to have earplugs! beware that the pull-out bed in the suite is not usable, that is, unless you can tolerate sleeping directly on the mattress springs. would not recommend due to extreme exterior noice and uncomfortable beds.

unfortunately, our stay at the argonaut hotel wasn't very pleasant. my husband, our two-year-old daughter, and i got so many bug bites from our one-night stay, which cost a total of $450. we felt that the stay wasn't worth the price. the only reason we chose this hotel was its close proximity to the marathon--it was just a few minutes' walk. however, i feel awful that my daughter is scratching constantly because of these bug bites. i'm not sure if it's flea bites or bedbugs . and yes, we're 100% sure the bites came from the hotel. we had family who did all the same activities as us but didn't stay at the hotel, and they didn't get any bites.
rooms were very nice!

we stayed here recently for a two-night stay. it is a great location, we were able to walk to much of what we had on our list. and when we needed to book a lyft, it was very easy to get picked up/dropped off. the room, while small, was so cute and quaint, with the brick, star pillows, and nautical theme. and best of all, it was so quiet! i booked a courtyard room and did not hear anything. if you've been in that area, you know there are a ton of tourists, music, etc. so the fact that it was dead silent was amazing. no view, but we don't spend time looking out the windows when we're on vacation so it was worth it lol. service was very nice both on the hotel and blue mermaid next door. we had a deal for a free continental breakfast and the second morning they had run out of pastries. so the server subbed in toast (which we preferred anyway) for free. next time we are in san francisco, will absolutely stay here again! just one suggestion for the front desk staff (who were all very friendly and nice) -- it would be great if they could note the amenities like free bottled water and the $15 credit for the blue mermaid. you have to scan a qr code to see the amenities which guests may or may not do. secondly, there is a lot of stuff in the room. snacks, wine, beverages, stuffed animal for purchase and in various areas of the room. given how small the room is, it was a little annoying to have all that in the way. recommend removing most of it from the desk, and reducing the sheer quantity altogether.
we had an amazing stay at the argonaut hotel. excellent customer service.
great hotel- location, service, amenities, decor, room, bed. all great! i would definitely stay here again!

service is excellent, very friendly folks at the door and the desk. beds are lovely and comfortable with great sheets. the room was great to hang out in. total bonus is having a delicious restaurant attached. and a wine bar! i ordered a bottle of wine, walked over to the restaurant and the staff was very helpful. i ordered food-to-go, sat and had a glass of wine while they prepared my food. extra bonus: the 6-year old loved her fruit and mac-and-cheese. san francisco is not a large town, but i love the location of this hotel. it's easy to walk the entire city (north beach is very close). but if you want to feel safe, this is a good area.

room was adequate, if dated. staff engagement was fairly positive, which was a definite plus. however, false advertising, we were charged a $15 guest amenity fee which supposedly included a $15 food/beverage credit, bottled water, and a daily newspaper - none of which we received.
thanks to angel for an amazing check-in experience. he remembered me being a return guest, even though booking was made in my wife's name. he still recognized our loyalty! we'll be back!

me and my husband planned to go to a comedy show at cobbs comedy which is about 1/2 mile from argonaut hotel, so this is why we chose this hotel. initially we reserved a king suite but upon arrival management had upgraded up to room #256 which is one of the better suites you can get. and let me tell you it was beautiful! it was very clean and smelled good we had a living room and a bedroom with the king bed and the bathroom had a huge jacuzzi tub and a stand up shower. the toilet had its own room which was nice as i could still get ready while my husband does his thing lol! we loved the hotel and will definitely be staying here every time we come to sf, not to mention it's right on the pier.

the argonaut hotel is a very nice hotel with great customer service. my only criticism is that if your room is close to the air conditioning unit you can hear a loud hum. luckily we were able to switch rooms without a problem. overall the argonaut hotel is a very nice luxury hotel in a great location of the wharf.

if i could give this place 0 stars i would. they had guests screaming out this windows scaring people. this hotel claims that they do not tolerate guests being disruptive but when they were, they didn't do anything about it. the hotel allows their guest to scare people for no reason and claimed, it's new years, they're allowed to. okay and if it wasn't new years? what would the excuse be? this hotel clearly does not hold their guests to their standards. a hotel like this is not worth staying at. would you like to be disrespected and have an employee say that they can do what they want, it's new years. there is no respect from guests or employees. you have employees defending disruptive guests that scream out into the streets from a side window. a hotel that allows this type of behavior from guests is not worth staying at. all around terrible service and behavior.

if i could, i'd give this 0 stars. they clearly tolerate their guests acting liken a fool. while walking past this hotel with some friends, a random guest staying in this hotel stuck their head out the window and started screaming at us, and it scared my friend causing her to spill hot chocolate all over our belongings and our faces. when we looked up we asked why he did that, and explained it wasn't funny because his obnoxiousness led to us ruining our belongings. he made weird noises at us then called security saying we were being loud and obnoxious, but we were all just incredibly upset. a $400 white purse was ruined with irremovable stains + two hoodies that were both over $80. hotel front desk said there was nothing they could do, which only adds to our frustration because we want to be paid back for the stuff ruined. literally none of this was funny. a hotel that can tolerate such behavior from guests is not one to stay at

stunning hotel and unbelievable customer service. from the front desk, to the wine bar, the bellhop, valet and restaurant, we had the most wonderful experience. it's a long story, but i royally screwed up the reservation for my partner's 60th birthday. the hotel was so gracious about it and gave us incredible accommodations in spite of my mistake. can't recommend enough!

my husband, dog, and i had a 5-star experience during our 3-night stay at the argonaut hotel a few weeks ago. although the price may be high, it is a true luxury experience. the rooms are exceptional, their attentive staff is top notch, and the location can't be beat. their entire hotel is nautical themed, which fits perfectly with their location near the water. the lobby was extravagant with a beautiful fireplace and a lot of comfortable seating. there is also an intimate, upscale bar adjacent to the hotel lobby. valet parking is available if you have a vehicle. our room was pleasantly spacious with a large bathroom, an open-space bed and desk area, and extremely comfortable beds. the room was more than suitable for two adults and our pup. upon arrival and checking in, we were greeted by the doorman and valet with excitement, especially when they saw our dog. we were happy that the dog fee was a reasonably-priced, flat rate, compared to other hotels, but when checking in, they pulled out a welcoming gift for our pup. the packaging was impressive, though we weren't expecting much. however, when we got to the room and opened the package we were surprised to find a box fully packed with quality items which included a rope toy in the shape of an anchor, cheetah-print tennis ball, a branded argonaut neck scarf, and a treat, all for our dog. she even made the paws of fame board while we were visiting. as noted above, this location can't be beat. located near ghirardelli square and fisherman's wharf, there are plenty of options for dining and shopping close by. we had a great experience during our time at the argonaut hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat.
great hotel! easy check-in, all staff are very friendly.
loved this hotel and location! brendan at registration was superb and so accommodating. and gianni was so helpful with all our luggage. good restaurant too. we had a blast! what a great weekend.

deceptive pricing! on their website it states free valet parking with stay, but what it doesn't say is that you have to book directly with the hotel. if you use third party site, booking for example. you will not receive that perk and have to pay $65 for parking. steven the hotel staff member was unapologetic and could care less about our concerns i would think twice about reserving a room at this hotel unless you want some surprise costs when checking out. the rooms were clean and comfortable and the hotel location was perfect if your visiting pier 39 and other attractions nearby.

this hotel is nice, but not so nice that it demands the price they're charging. i had a suite with the bay view, which is essentially their nicest room, and after our long weekend i felt i had overpaid.
great hotel with a very nautical feel. didn't take advantage of many amenities but it was a great stay!

fantastic hotel in a great location! steps away from some of the best restaurants and the famous cable car stop. rooms are cozy and housekeeping comes every day to make the beds and replenish the towels. security on site and super fast valet service.
stay away from this place, they will overcharge you.
great location and nice enough.

the argonaut hotel is not only the perfect location, it is adorable! it's just steps away from the aquatic park, the buena vista, ghirardelli square, cable car hop on location, fisherman's wharf, and pier 39! it appears it has been newly renovated with a nautical theme. bed linens were super comfortable, and so was the bed. although we did not eat any food there, the bar was great. front desk staff was super helpful and accommodating. they gave us bottled waters and helped me adjust our reservation to a parking included package, which saved us some money. if we need to get away and want to stay in san francisco or have out of towners visiting again, we will definitely be going back to the argonaut hotel!

bed was super comfy. pillows were great. the room was ok and there was some machine noise outside that interrupted my sleep. other than that decent experience. location was great. blue mermaid restaurant was just ok.
lovely hotel in the wharf area. room was clean, quiet and service was excellent! we'll be back!

i thought this place was a cute hotel, but be careful on personal items being left in the room. people from our group had their passports and laptops stolen. the room was a very tight space with very little walking room between the beds and door. after the missing items i decided to no longer have housekeeping come to clean the room.
we had a great stay! it's right in all the mix, but you would never know it by being in the hotel. we had a perfect night!

we have stayed at the argonaut multiple times. it is very close to the piers and the various activities in the wharf area. the rooms are generally quiet and the top floor rooms have a good view of alcatraz. the lobby is quiet and a great place to hang-out and people watch. the restaurant has a good bar and the food is also great for brunch / breakfast. the rooms are good sized and the bathrooms are relatively modern. the service by the staff is great. very much our favorite hotel in san francisco.

from checking in to checking out and storing my luggage here while i grabbed a bite to eat before heading out to the airport, my experience was nothing but great. anything the hotel could do to make the stay a little better, they did. i flew in and came straight to the hotel for a conference for work, so i didn't pick this location myself. typically these situations make me a little nervous because i don't get to vet the location i'm staying in myself. but when i checked in early, steven at the front desk made it easy and was super accommodating. me and the other guests were given water bottles each time we stopped by the desk, and that was so thoughtful. the room itself was clean, modern, and comfortable. it had liquor and snacks inside (for a charge). there was even an umbrella for guests to use during their stay. if they want to take it with them, they can let the front desk know and they would be charged for it when checking out.
outstanding in every way. great location to see the sights of san francisco. clean, comfortable and the price is a great value.

staff was very friendly. we noted it was our anniversary in the reservation, and appreciated the extra nice touches they did for us. the suite also had a large jacuzzi tub, which for the amount of walking we did, was great to have.

incredibly pleased with our stay at the argonaut hotel. the location was right in the heart of fishermans wharf, and could not have been better situated. we reserved a room with bay view and our view of the golden gate bridge, ghirardelli square and the cable cars was priceless! walking distance to some of the best restaurants, right by hyde,st pier, and right near ghirardelli square. cable car roundabout literally just across from the hotel as well. staff was very friendly and helpful, and hotel felt very safe with keys needed to use the elevator and reach your room floor. we would definitely stay here again!

this hotel isn't very exciting from the outside, but inside was quite nice. i had a rental car, and the valet immediately greeted me when i drove up. the woman at the front desk was kind, answered all of my questions and was very friendly. the room itself was very narrow, but had enough space for one person. two oddities for me - there is a gigantic mirror at the foot of the bed. as someone that's a very light sleeper, having a reflection of myself all night was a bit odd. second, the shower was quite disappointing - i would have expected a hotel like this to have a nicer bathroom. overall though, nothing specific to complain about. the spa services on the website are actually outsourced and occur in your room. this was a first for me, and i booked a massage during my stay. i've never had an in-room massage before so perhaps its not a fair comparison, but for the price i don't think it was worth it despite the massage therapist being quite wonderful. i'd much rather be in a spa, and wouldn't schedule that a second time. i had a room overlooking the bay. this was nice, but i was expecting to be able to enjoy the outside a bit more and that wasn't possible so i personally don't think it was worth the higher room price for the view alone. to touch on the reviews regarding this hotel being haunted - this was corroborated by a bus driver on a tour that i took, but i didn't personally experience anything out of the ordinary! overall this was a nice hotel, in an excellent location, and i would certainly stay here again.

excellent location close to the park, the piers, cable car stop, ghirardelli. the rooms were nice, comfortable and had a nautical theme. the staff was friendly and helpful. the restaurant in the hotel is pricey with limited options, but there are a number of restaurants within walking distance. great place to stay if you want to be close to the tourist areas in san francisco.

chose hotel based on reviews and location. we were not disappointed. we were able to walk everywhere and there were incredible views. i loved this hotel, it was super cozy. the staff were all wonderful, cheerful and happy. the room and property were super clean. i loved the aesthetic, with the exposed brick, etc. also, having the blue mermaid restaurant downstairs was super convenient (and the food was really good).

we stayed two nights at the argonaut and were overall pretty happy. it's on a very busy street right in the heart of the waterfront - go left as you exit and you'll be right at the cable car & ghirardelli square, and go right as you exit and you'll be on fisherman's wharf. check in went smoothly - they offer a number of tiers of room when you book and we got exactly what we paid for, which was a partial view of alcatraz and the bay. it was directly over the front entrance though so street noise permeated during the daytime. at night the area was much quieter. the hotel is not new but has been maintained fairly well. we were happy with the in room amenities. we took advantage of the valet parking and our car was available within 10 minutes of our numerous requests. we didn't sample the in house restaurant but it looked pretty good and certainly smelled good (lobby always had a waft of brunch). the little nps exhibit in the lobby was also a nice touch to walk around. overall can't beat the location if you want a classic sf tourist experience.

this review has several layers as we hosted an event here, managed a room block for guests, and stayed at this hotel. i will start with the event since that is where our journey begins. we hosted our wedding in december, 2022 at the maritime ballroom at the argonaut. we were planning our wedding for about a year with diem tran. diem is the best event coordinator we have ever worked with. she is extremely friendly, quick to respond to e-mails, and very professional. a big reason we chose this venue is because we felt comfortable with diem. the venue itself takes imagination. when you go on a tour it is an empty brick room. however once the argonaut staff places all the tables put's out the dance floor and up-lights are added the room becomes very charming. there is also the adjacent del monte courtyard available for the cocktail hour and for your guests to mingle during the reception. the catering staff was very professional and the food came out warm and tasting delicious. great service is a theme of this hotel. everyone staying in our room block was extremely happy with the argonaut. the staff was very helpful and nice and even gave our guests welcome gifts that we curated for them. i have stayed at a lot of hotels and have not stayed at one this size where the staff made it feel like i was staying at a friends house. as for the rooms, this is clincher. the views from the hotel rooms are the best in san francisco hands down. our honeymoon suite was a corner suite thatoverlooked ghirardelli square and the golden gate bridge on one side and alcatraz on the other. whether you stay in a basic room or a suite you will be staying in a very nice room for a fair price. i will recommend this hotel to anyone staying in san francisco or anyone in the bay area wanting a staycation.

my wife and i really enjoyed our stay. the room was quiet, clean and the staff was super. the robes are amazing and i actually ended up purchasing one. close to the wharf which we loved and everything met expectations. plan to stay again soon.

deysa was very helpful after a bad experience with reservation line. our room was large with great view. i do wish they had shower caps in room, and i prefer little single use toiletries versus the reusable bottles they use. we were excited for thanksgiving dinner. however, my daughter and i both got sick after eating it (very disappointing considering it was $75 each and quite honestly not very flavorful). we always choose this hotel because of great service & location to everything. however, a lot of restaurants directly across from hotel have closed down. i really like this hotel, but the hallway carpet desperately needs to be replaced. it was unsightly, stained & smelled. it's very off putting, especially when you trip at seams that are separated. again, 4 stars because of deysa, but definitely wouldn't eat another holiday meal here.

we were a group that stayed at this hotel for a work function. initially, the hotel was pretty standard but it was in a good location close to the local sights. the hotel staff was also okay, middle of the road. the reason why i'm giving them one star is because they charged every room minibar fees when none of us used the minibar. when you are travelling for work, you know that your company does not pay for such inflated charges, especially when all meals are planned and prepaid. none of us even knew at the time because we only received the bill under the door that of course didn't include these fees. they never sent us the final bills with these charges. the only way we found out was when we received the credit card statements a month later. i'd understand making an honest mistake for one room, but there were five rooms that were affected by this fraud. this really seems like they make it a regular practice to add minibar fees regardless of it they were actually used. usually we try to stay away from boutique hotels, but thought we'd give this one a shot since they were slightly lower than other. sorry to say we got what we paid for. never going back
add on charges are ridiculous. beautiful hotel with terrible service. location good, but everything closed after 8 pm.
dear sweet god, if you call here to do anything with your reservation, be ready to be stuck on hold in their endless cycle of hold.
watch for hidden fees: this hotel will charge you $35 a day for free wifi and call it an amenities fee.

this hotel far exceeded my expectation. huge bright room with one of the most comfortable beds i've ever slept on. quaint view of the trolly turn around and water were an unexpected suprise. the customer service was exceptional with director deysa so helpful in answering all my questions regarding transportation and dining options. truly a boutique hotel experience i look forward to visiting again!
i got a good view of the beach and sunset from my window! it was so beautiful to look at! the bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. the lobby is well decorated and has a cute theme.

arrived late to the argonaut while an unhappy customer laid into the the front desk guy about his reservation - mr front desk kept is cool, while the customer grumbled the travel website's name under his breath and carried on with our check-in without needing a breather! very nice. i would highly recommend the argonaut.

would i stay again? probably not. next time i'm in town i'll find my way to the wharf from accommodations elsewhere. i learned on this trip that the convenience factor is not a fair trade off for luxury accommodations. to each's own, though.

my husband and i booked the argonaut hoping for a more high-end experience as we are on vacation. when we arrived someone treated us which was very nice. our room was dirty, hair in the sink and tub, stains on the bed skirt and although we did not book a room with a view our window directly faced another room's window - meaning we could not open the blinds for natural light at all without seeing other guests. during our stay the hotel had kids running and yelling in the hallways - which was awful. and probably a one-off but the alarm in the room next to ours went off for about 25 minutes at 5am, we had to call security to shut it off. during our 12 day vacation in california the argonaut was one of 5 4-star hotels we stayed at. it was by far the worst and does not deserve the accolades and the experience does the demand the price point.
convenient location, friendly staffs. valet parking attendant is very helpful and courteous. rooms are clean, old school but well kept. definitely we'll be back.
awesome hotel great restaurant great staff everyone's amazing they can clean really historic great feel right on the water right near fishermans wharf especially if you're swimming alcatraz
we stayed here over the long weekend and i thought it was fine. i wouldn't come here again but it wasn't horrible.
horrible bed, coffee, thin walls, sandpaper sheets, $85 for parking! i'm not going to waste more time but $250 for room, $75 online fees plus $30 when you get there plus $85 to park.

our overall stay was okay. tensin at front desk was amazing! super helpful with booking & at check-in. the location is amazing right in the middle of the wharf & close to practically everything down here. our room was great with a partial view of the golden gate but we did have an issue with our tv's connection & netflix a few nights in a row. the wifi isn't the best as it went out a couple times while i was working so just be aware if you're working remotely! most of the employees were helpful (some more than others). it was frustrating to some degree as i felt i was being treated differently due to my age being younger than many of the other guests staying here. there seems to be some confusion with dining as they advertise room service on their website, open until 9:30pm, but when i called at 9 the resturaunt was already closed. when i tried again in the morning, they said they don't offer in-room dining and that i would just pick up my food to-go instead. i'm not entirely sure if i would stay here again solely because of the service i received but if you're just looking for a good location & nearby place to sleep after sightseeing this is your hotel.

the staff were all terrific. veronica, corrine and the rest of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. they made our stay perfect. perfect location, good gym and pet friendly. we had dinner at the blue mermaid on-site. mac and cheese with crab, and chowder with crab were both very good. we will definitely stay here again.

couldn't be happier. our recent 4 night stay at the argonaut hotel exceeded our expectations .the wonderful staff made us feel welcomed from the moment we first entered the hotel. they were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. the beautiful bay view from our room was amazing. location couldn't have been any better. walking distance to the piers, restaurants, stores and tour locations. it was an amazing experience and will definitely be back.

what a delightful hotel! this is a historic building dating back to the early 1900's. the decor is beautiful and the staff is friendly and eager to help. the hotel is pet friendly and right in the heart of fisherman's wharf.

unfortunately the walls in the hotel room are paper thin and i could hear my neighbors talking, moving and doing some other physical activity i would prefer not to hear on my solo staycation. i moved hotel rooms so i could have a view of the golden gate bridge versus alcatraz and now i wish i was looking at a former prison than hearing them do the deed. the location is great and i took advantage of the free bike rental. but when i go away on my own for a relaxing staycation i'd prefer to sleep rather than having pillows on top of my head to block out the noise. guess i should've requested to move a second time. sigh.

first, excellent covid-19 safety measurements followed throughout, which includes care packets. the argonaut is the most fantastic historical landmark hotel on the san francisco fisherman's wharf. previously a cannery. a 102 year old building. you will see, and can feel, the historical integrity throughout. a place to have a beautiful and comfortable stay, with the utmost impeccable service. exit and you are truly a stones throw to fisherman's wharf, ghirardelli square, the buena vista (best irish coffee in town), maritime museum, fort trolley service. also, lovely bay area views, walks and parks. hotel is also walking distance to the world famous scoma's restaurant and boudin sourdough bread factory.

good location but mediocre overall. paper thin walls and nothing really special about the experience. they sell $6 water bottles in room and that's it. it is communal toiletries which makes me really unsure about cleanliness because of covid. blue mermaid food was nothing special. i probably won't be returning to this hotel.

wonderful staff! room was clean, fresh and the bed was comfortable. we opened the window to listen to the rain. the concierge, angela, was so very kind and helpful. she went out of her way to set up our trip to muir woods. thank you for helping and helping us check off my bucket list.

such a cute nautical theme hotel! highly recommend! the staff at check in were pleasant and efficient! they have valet parking so you don't have to deal with it in sf! between the comfy beds and pillows, it's the location that we love. near ghirardelli and the pier plus my husband runs the half marathon so it's the best location for his race. the biggest part is check out is at noon. we can enjoy some breakfast and resting after my hubby's race! bonus: gotta love (and take advantage) that wine bar downstairs. daemon at the wine bar is hilarious.

it's a nice location, but attention to detail badly needed.trash still in room,candy or pills in the corner of the east elevator,left with the impression that breakfast would be deliver to room left tip for that then finely picked it up myself needed to move the outside heater to have some warmth was told that it couldn't be moved due to plumbing connections i could see the propane tank inside. dinner napkins well by this point i am doing the staff's job. final note sunday morning i need coffee go down sit at the bar, i may be invisible since the 2 people who came behind the bar did not say a peep. in the end if your going to lie to your paying guests have enough self respect to tell one that sounds good.

the argonaut hotel is a beautiful brown stone corner building building next to the shops and eateries of the del monte cannery building. luxurious hotel with impeccable hospitality and sincerely helpful staff.

two stars for the great location and that's about it. we stayed in a suite which looked like it hadn't been renovated in 30 years. size was great at over 900 sq. feet and the corner view was good. the toilet smelled like a hundred years of flatulence. the kind of smell that only a renovation can address. on top of that, the toilet paper, towels, and pillows are of a grade reserved for cheaper motels, not a $1k a night. the bedding was not hygienic, they take a flat sheet and wrap it around the comforter and it smelled like they only wash the sheet and not the comforter, the smell works as a wake up call. there was mold in the bathroom. if you are looking for luxury, this is not the place. staff was adequate, they do their best with what their employer provides them. it is a historic building that has a good location to fisherman's wharf. if you go with the cheaper rooms you get an inside view of a concrete courtyard which is probably their best value in terms of what they can provide; location without frills. if you want a luxury suite in the same price range and location, there is the hotel fairmont in ghirardelli square.

5 stars for location on the wharf and amazing, friendly staff who go above and beyond. note to hotel manager about 356 - clean your jacuzzi tub jets and fix the water pressure in the shower. we'll be back soon!

absolutely adorable. pristine clean and terrific walkable location to anything you want/need in sfo. the trolley car turn around is literally across the street so if you can't walk around to what you want to explore, you can ride. they also offer complimentary bikes. we arrived late and tired and the room and reception was perfect. they recommended the in house restaurant which we had not known about, and were so tired we thought well we'll try it. so glad we did. it was excellent. i had the fettuccini alfredo and added grilled chicken. might have been the best chicken i've ever eaten and i've eaten chicken all over the world (except china). daughter had the salmon and some sort of chowder. staff was masked and distanced and very accomodating as well as cheerful, which is especially appreciated in these covid travel times.. and just a 20 minute ride to the airport. i look forward to my return.

walking by you wouldn't think nothing about thus place but once you walk in you're taken back by the beauty. the ambiance is definitely breathtaking. everything is really right there from the winery next door if you're in the mood to come downstairs or just relax in the chairs in their amazing lobby. great customer service and great experience.

we booked this hotel because i had a surgery in the sf area and we wanted to bring our dog. this hotel went above and beyond to make us comfortable. from giving my dog pets and treats, to helping with luggage, getting me a kettle for tea post-surgery and upgrading us to a fantastic suite ...we were 100% satisfied. we will only stay here from now on. this place is worth the money. the location is also fantastic and so close to literally everything in san francisco. grateful for a stress-free recovery during the 3 days i spent here.

wonderful place. beautiful room and restaurant. kind and caring staff who made me and my daughter feel very special. we will always remember our visit to san francisco because of the argonaut. and oh my gracious--the crab and corn chowder! it was scrumptious!

if you're visiting san francisco and staying at fisherman's wharf this is definitely the place to stay. it's right near the action and it's very clean, and beautifully decorated. the staff are all delightful to interact with. we were offered to upgrade our room so we got a bay view for a little more each night. the only thing i would advise is that they placed an additional $300 hold because i think they wanted me to spend that at their restaurant ( which was the most expensive mediocre breakfast i've ever had ever $73.00 for eggs and toast and meat). other than that, it's an amazing place to stay! i would stay here again.

we enjoyed our time here. we loved how it was right next to a large park to walk the dog. each room comes with chromecast to easily stream from devices. beds were comfortable. parking was expensive but at least the cars are parked in a secure location.

such a lovely hotel in a great location! we were blessed with a king suite and honestly, it was amazing! a great jetted tub in our huge bathroom, along with a really comfy king sized bed and a wonderful sitting area. the staff was really nice, especially brandon who helped us to our room with our massive amount of luggage. we were there on the 4th of july and it was so fun to be right next to where the fireworks were. we loved our stay and experience!

excellent location and very friendly staff. they gave us a free covid protection package at checkin, which is nice. the only minor issues is they don't have their own parking and the nearest parking lot recommended by the door man is full, thus we end up having to find a different parking place (not too far). we will choose valet parking next time instead of self parking to avoid the problem if having to solve the parking lot full problem

we came here for a staycation and it was great. the rooms were a lot bigger than expected for the location and were pretty comfortable. for this type of hotel, i'd probably expect slightly nicer bathrooms but overall it was good. they are also dog friendly and the dog had a very enjoyable time. the location is great - right by fisherman's warf and ghiradelli square (a bit touristy for me usually but every now and then is nice) and you can easily walk to the water. lots of nice restaurant options around too. the hotel restaurant does have a restaurant with a nice courtyard type area. didn't try the food but did go for cocktails which were good. some stuff could be a bit more efficient (getting stuff brought to the room, bag check, valet etc) but overall had a solid visit and would recommend this hotel if you are visiting san francisco.
absolutely amazing staff and service, they really saved us from sleeping on the street last night with incredible service. i highly recommend going here above any of the main stream hotels.

this place was terrible. poor service. couldn't check us into our room for several hours after stated 3pm check-in. lobby smells like a dirty cafeteria. there is barely any service staff at all to help with much of anything. awful.

participated in organizing in two professional events here and both times felt the support staff and amenities were good at a price that was palatable. the views (if you do outside seating in the small plaza) are pleasant and calming, even on a saturday. the ballrooms less so but good enough. the provided bar and barstaff were ok, no complaints from our visiting patrons. i wouldn't be against renting a ballroom here again or opting for an outside seating function here.

the only issue we have with visiting the argonaut is that we don't visit enough. the staff is simply amazing to work with. we have been booking blocks of rooms with the argonaut for years now for our workshops every year. we have multiple workshops and they are our preferred hotel of choice. it's important to note that our company allows us to decide who we want to work with and my team and i consistently choose argonaut. the accommodations are lovely and consistent. the rooms are very cool and always clean. i know this because i've toured the rooms and i ask the attendees how they felt. no complaints to date, always great feedback. this hotel is a special gem - it was once a cannery and they kept the charm of the history with the theme of their decor. also important are the other areas that can be rented for events. there is this very cool outdoor spot that is just gorgeous and perfect for a small workshop. the indoor space is just as grand. our conference numbers have grown otherwise we would book the space they have. from the front desk to the coordinators for room blocks, everyone is super friendly and helpful. we works specifically with ayu and michelle. these two ladies are the absolute best. i honestly cannot say enough good things about our experience here. it's so great we book our room blocks for the year without a single worry about being trapped in a bad situation. they are one of the very best hotel accommodations in san francisco, and they are right on fisherman's wharf. very close to some great bars, restaurants and entertainment. we will continue to book with their awesome team.

pretty disappointing stay, particularly because the was almost empty due to fears over the coronavirus. when we arrived we were assigned arguably the worst room in the hotel (second floor interior, dark, view of roofing, etc.) after specifically requesting an upper floor and bay view. my guess is that the room assignment may have been because we were able to secure an excellent rate due to march visit and low occupancy. not sure why our request was completely ignored. television was glitchy, turning off at will, and when we request a late checkout, we were told check out is noon, no exceptions, regardless of occupancy, etc. have stayed at this property in the past and enjoyed it very much as it's location is perfect for exploring the fisherman's wharf area, access to cable cars, ghirardelli square, etc. not this time, particularly at this price point. even with a great deal, we still paid $250.00 per night. we had a choice between the fairmont and the argonaut hotel, both at the same price point at this point in time. we made a mistake. it's not the cool, class hotel we've frequented in the past. very dissatisfied and disappointing.

it was a nice hotel, checking in was easy, it was my first time to san francisco and i was tired lol sell the bed sounds great, room service food wasn't that great but i guess you can only expect so much from places.

this hotel was in a prime location and close to pier 39 and all the sites to see at fisherman's warf. the hotel was stylish and clean. the staff was very accommodating and we very much enjoyed our stay there. nice nuances and little nautical designer touches that make this hotel above the rest. we highly recommend and would definitely stay there again or refer this hotel to family and friend!
great location and clean hotel. checkin was a bit slow i think because it was late at night and the front desk guy was having to pull double duty with valet tasks.

very difficult customer service. we had a 2-night reservation which we made directly with the hotel. we were forced to cancel due to unforeseen circumstances. we called them directly and cancelled 4 days in advance. their policy is at least 2 days in advance. they said we would get a refund. never got it. called them 10 days later and they said we would not get a refund. when i tried to talk to them on the phone they were rude and dismissive. they finally refunded after we raised bloody hell. all of this through numerous phone calls, etc etc. impossible to know what was going on. this place has really gone downhill since kimpton hotels sold it to this lower-rated group.

check in took about 45 minutes and resulted in me getting a room with someone already in it. when i first arrived, the check in line took about 20 minutes for the three people ahead of me. apparently, they are upgrading their system. i don't know why they chose to do this when there was a big conference going on. when i finally got to my room the key wouldn't work. went back down stairs and waited in the line again, another 20 minutes. when i got my new key, i went to the room, opened the door and someone was already in it! i went back down stairs and was told the check in person put in the wrong number. i was finally given a room that worked.

my husband and i were excited to stay here because of it's beautiful location and photos online. it was expensive ($455) but decided to splurge for one night. for the price we were disappointed with the attention to detail. the hotel itself was beautiful. the doorman was very helpful with tips of where to eat and what to do. the bellman/concierge was also very friendly. my reason for a two star rating is that our room, although on the surface was clean as we looked further, it was not. we found a dirty sock in the closet and the creamer was so old and curdled when poured in my coffee. also, the restrooms in the lobby had two stalls with no toilet paper in them. i didn't take a picture as i was already annoyed with the previous two things. it was not a bad experience, but for the price, this was disappointing. we stayed there 01/22/20.
overpriced for what you get. price of a high end luxury hotel but really bad quality and service all around. they also sneak in extra fees here and there. i'll never come back.

the hotel is nice and the basic rooms are clean and comfortable but the staff is so unwelcoming. literally every person we encountered, whether it was the front desk or in room dining, made us feel like we were bothering them for asking basic questions. the night audit guy was particularly unhelpful. typically if you can't accommodate a request, you come up with some sort of solution. in his case though, he couldn't have been less interested in what we were saying. i know people have bad days, but come on; if you can't put on a smile and be helpful you may want to reconsider being in hospitality. everyone at the restaurant and the guy at the valet were nice, pleasant and helpful, though. probably will stay somewhere else next staycation.

the atmosphere is nautical. quality in a minimal style sea charm. love the name, too. the family area downstairs has board games but is very drafty. the decoration was a xmas at sea feel for me. loved the candy the front desk staff shared along with treasures for children from the sea chest (as trader joe's does). two brothers both work the front desk and it's delightful to see the homely style of service. sweet guys! expensive is the nearby restaurant as we only got a spending allowance for breakfast and not a meal. however, staff are nice letting you grab an extra takeaway coffee.

i absolutely love this hotel. we have stayed here several times while visiting sf, and it will now be our hotel of choice every time we come to the city. the location is beyond perfect. walking distance to fisherman's wharf/pier, ghirardelli square, trolleys, tour boats, and so much more. i love that they are pet friendly; and not just friendly, but they genuinely make you feel like your fur babies are welcome, cherished guests. they put your pet's name on a welcome board, say hello to them, offering them treats, and water. so comforting when you have to travel with your pets. the rooms are beautiful, spacious, and clean. i love the exposed wood beams and brick in the rooms. the beds are comfortable, and the provided toiletries are luxurious.

as a passerby, this hotel is beautiful. but what makes this hotel amazing is the service. zuri, a young lady who works at the front desk, does not resist assistance to those who are not staying at the hotel-- but rather does everything she can to help. i would stay here, simply because of her! thank you, zuri.

very nice,clean place to stay. downstairs bar and restaurant, very comfortable with a pleasant staff. one major caveat however; the quoted price is a far cry from the actual cost at checkout. while most of us are accustomed to a few additional charges at departure, these added costs,while probably legal,ethical would be a stretch. there was even a separate "tax" on the 75.00/night car park. ask before committing.

the argonaut hotel in san francisco is a great place to stay when you are in san francisco. not only is it right on the wharf the staff is very helpful, friendly, and all around great. when you come please say hi to the doorman with the great yellow and blue shoes.

excellent location on the wharf. great selection of rooms and delicious restaurant attached to hotel. 20 restaurants with-in 1 mile of the hotel and all of them are worth stopping in and visiting. great seafood and italian around every corner.

we were evacuees from the kincade fire in santa rosa. we will never forget the care extended to us by everyone at the argonaut hotel. we reserved here because they are pet-friendly and were astonished to learn that they offered a substantially discounted rate to fire evacuees. everything is a bit of a blur right now, but i think we were there for four or five nights. the staff is lovely and extremely responsive to every request we had. my husband has limited mobility. we ate all of our meals either at the hotel restaurant, the blue mermaid, or from room service. the food was delicious, very fresh, and plentiful. the menu has lots of healthy options but also some splurges. the salmon dishes were particularly well-prepared. and my nightly mescal margarita was the best i've had. no skimping on the mescal. our room was clean, comfortable, and very quiet. i read the review that down-graded the hotel for the garage they use charging for all three cars. this is not the hotel's choice. the reviewers beef is with the garage, not the hotel, and i wish they would revise their review to reflect that. we will definitely return here, either as vacationers or evacuees. thanks to everyone at the argonaut. you are much appreciated.

extremely insensitive staff upon check in. we booked this hotel a few weeks ago for a fun trip, however we were evacuated from our home in santa rosa this morning at 5 am, along with a large portion of sonoma county and our homes are currently under threat of perishing. we have three cars instead of the planned single car. we asked being that we are fire evacuees in a declared state of emergency, if we could be given a discount for parking or some help. we were told they don't have control over parking and could self park around the corner got $47 each. all of our valuables and belongings were stuffed into our cars. the only reason i'm giving 2 stars is because the bellboys outside were the only staff who showed some humanity to our situation and were very helpful unpacking our cars and getting our stuff to the room. the desk was extremely cold and unhelpful. it's quite shocking that given the current situation, the hotel desk really could care less about our predicament.

this has been one of my favorite places for many years until now. having made a reservation almost a month ago my family and i arrived at 11pm to find that the hotel was sold out and the only rooms left were a single queen or a handicapped accessible room with no tub and two queens. pretty sure the hotel gave my room to someone who arrived earlier in the evening. didn't get the room i booked and the snarker gentlemen at the front desk let it be known that my family's comfort and interest in staying here again was not his concern. super bummed. was really looking forward to being here but we won't be coming back. room 220

the best thing about this place is the location. i loved that it was in the old del monte cannery, cool detail. the lobby had much nicer style and decor than the rooms. the room looked was a disneyland cruise ship, cheesy nautical. our room was large but the use of space was terrible leaving a large useless area in the center of the room. the bathroom was small, the couch awkwardly faced a blank wall and the desk was touching the bed when there was all this unused space. the tv didn't have movie channels, in fact it had fewer channels than most hotels. granted, we were only in our room to basically sleep but this hotel seriously lacked the amenities that one expects with the rates and additional fees argonaut charges. aside from the housekeeping cleaning everything spotless, there's nothing praise worthy for the staff. going in and out of the hotel, we saw the doormen most frequently and there was only one occasion when they acknowledged us. the rest of the times we passed by them while they stood there doing nothing and helping no one. on day 2, we were walking behind a woman who fell in front of them before entering the hotel and they just watched and chuckled. during my stay, this hotel was publicly advertising breakfast for two with the purchase of a room. all we got was a $10 coupon. i inquired with the front desk about the false advertising and they said the coupon can be used for breakfast. there's nothing on the breakfast menu for $5 or even $10, what a bunch of liars.
we just loved this hotel. great service and location and was quiet. the only disappointment was service during breakfast in the restaurant.

once again we had an incredible stay at your hotel! not only are the staff wonderful and accommodating but the overall experience was stellar. the beds are incredibly comfortable and the linens incredibly soft. the interior design is absolutely beautiful i love this hotel. it is one of my favorites in the nation!
our hotel options are a bit limited when traveling with our dog. we decided on the argonaut and i'm so glad we did.

kinda cheesy and overdone with the jules verne theme. plus, you would think a brick building would have thicker walls. the woman in the room next door just sneezed, and i wouldn't swear to it, but i think i got a spray from it. and what's with staff ringing doorbell but not waiting for an answer before bathing in? it happened twice, and we were there less than 24 hours. change of review. the company they contact with for parking is awful. for $75, our car should not be held hostage.

not a bad hotel but not a great hotel. but a decent hotel for the price and the location. i didn't want to spend 1k a night at the fairmont nearby so choices in our price comfort range was slim pickings. it seems like the better choice hotels are in the financial district but that's too far from where my daughter lives in sf. yes the king bed rooms are super narrow, yes the walls are a bit thin, yes there's no fan in the bathroom. but it's clean, the front desk and house cleaners are friendly and efficient and the bed is comfortable enough. this hotel definitely does its job and i will return when i have to stay in the area again.
stayed here for two nights on a weekday. awesome hotel, good people, great location. checking in was cool, matthew checked us in. nice guy and was easy process.

do not stay here! beyond what all the other reviews say about thin walls, lazy wifi, the staff is horrible. the cleaners stole my jewelry and when i called to talk to a manager they just kept redirecting me to the housekeeping staff who lied to me and kept me on hold forever. there are soooooo many better places to stay in sf that have honest staff working for them.

great stay at the wharf. rooms with a nautical theme, great food and cozy lobby with a fireplace to relax. front doormen and staff very friendly. concierge matthew was excellent to work with and provided many great recommendations throughout our weekend stay. hotel rooms are quite noisy with screaming kids and slamming doors. bathrooms could use an update and thorough cleaning. location is good with many restaurant options, shopping, bike rentals and the cable car.

this hotel is horrible. they charged me in full for my reservation and will not let me cancel. when my wife called to change the reservation, the reservations manager hung up on her! this hotel is mismanaged and has unethical business practice. we will be reporting them to the better business bureau. be aware. do not book here if you don't want to be out the money!

if i could give a zero star i would. booked less than 24 hours ago and realized that the dates of our stay were wrong. called the hotel and they are refusing to refund my credit card for the cost of over $700, even though the charge is so new it is still pending. they even refuse to modify the dates for us. they need to understand that customer service is paramount in the success of a business.

buyer beware! the accommodations are nice but we booked our room at the same time as our traveling companions via the same method. we paid a premium for a regular room with a view and our friends chose not to. upon arrival, our friends received a free upgrade to a premium room with the same view as ours so they ended up with a nicer room with the same view for about $500 less than our room for a 3 night stay. we were offered no free upgrades or discounts. very uneven and unfair practice! be very cautious!

wow, so nice from the valet to front steak. our pup was loved and played with by all. such a fun location right in the heart of tourist central. it's been a million years since i've been in san francisco but i felt instantly at home

"boutique hotel" sure has become a superfluous title thrown around these days... it's really just a way to jack up the pricing for literally everything, with little support to back it up when there's a problem. i won't spend too much time reiterating what others have said: thin walls, so you hear what's going on around you, the "prison yard" esque view of the inside rooms (good one, reviewer), the toilet paper holder beyond reach of the toilet (at least my room did have an extra roll on the back of the toilet), a bed that's rock hard but pillows that are so soft they really can't be called pillows because your head shouldn't be allowed to meld with the mattress when using pillows, etc. upon check-in, the front desk agent gave me a key to the mini bar in case i wanted to refrigerate any of my own stuff. when i got into my room, i noticed it was already unlocked. i flagged this with the desk because i have not consumed anything and will not be paying for it if they try and tell me i have upon checkout. $100/night "hold" for incidentals is ludicrous. as if i'm going to run out of here with the $49 umbrella, $26 small bottle of wine, $14 stuffed plush seal, and the $3.25 two ounce bag of cheetos and not pay for any of it. this is why you keep the card on file, you don't preemptively run a charge for each night. my room has a mirror facing the bed. any designer worth their salt should tell you this is bad feng shui, whether you prescribe to that line of thinking or not, it's just bad practice for sleeping arrangements. sex room/dungeon, okay sure, but just sleeping not so much. my biggest gripe comes from a tech standpoint. i'm in town for a conference, thus need reliable wifi to do work. my first day in, i successfully purchase the $14.95/day upgrade to connect up to three devices - and all worked smoothly. by the time i returned to hotel next day, upgrade expired so i attempted to purchase another. my laptop browser would not automatically open the webpage to allow this. now, being a tech savvy person, i know how to troubleshoot the basics. forget the wifi and try again, clear my browser cache, see if the page auto-loads in another browser, restart the computer. funnily enough, i was able to purchase the upgrade on my phone, but still couldn't get my laptop to open the damn page. so, of course i call front desk to ask for the website that should be loading so i can load it manually. if the way the site recognizes you is to enter your room number and last name, *it should be accessible manually*. front desk person was nice enough, but clueless. she put me on hold to talk to someone else who told me to try all the things above again. thanks but no thanks. tried everything 10+ times already. nada. as i type this i'm still on the slow-as-molasses free wifi that says you get 5mb speeds, but i've never broken 2.6mb the entire time. thankfully it's just fast enough to put in this critical review. management: get your staff educated on the website to enter for manual connection to the paid wifi. this is an option, as i've done so at other hotels. i probably won't be staying here again, but i can't be the only person this has happened to and felt it worth noting for others in town for work and not tourism.

despite its location in the heart of a tourist trap, it was rather pleasant. this was mainly to do with the lack of tourists in early april. i suspect that during high season the experience would be like sitting on top of an ant hill. the only major problem was that each day when i ordered an omelette from the restaurant the wrong breakfast item arrived.

i cant rave about this place enough, the team / staff is extremely on it, they really know how to host a successful event. laura, beth, andrea, juan, dennis the whole team really knows what 5 star service means. they followed through all the way to the very end of our event. the food was great, all of our guest were extremely satisfied with there guestrooms, and the location of this hotel. its in a clean area of sf with tons a great places to eat and shop. i would highly recommend this venue if you are hosting an event.
the staff at the argonaut always go above and beyond. matthew at the front desk always has great recommendations and a great attitude. great hotel. highly recommend!
hidden fee, expensive valet. noisy air conditioning, no fan in bathroom. made mistake on the bill.

the hotel itself is nice. the room was clean, great views. the doormen were always friendly and helpful. the only reason it's getting 3 stars is because of the price. i was aware of the $38/night resort fee or whatever, plus taxes, but i was never informed of the price to park. even when they took the car at check in no one said it would be $65/night. it also wasn't in my itinerary with the price breakdown that was emailed in advance. while i understand city parking isn't cheap, it would've been nice to know ahead of time so i could've looked at other parking options. because of all of the extra fees i likely won't stay again. the $245/night ends up being like $800 for two nights. the front desk gave a lot of attitude at check out and acted like it was my fault because i chose the bay view room package instead of the parking package that i didn't even see. the restaurant is also overpriced and the food is mediocre.

service was good enough. the rooms are small, but it is hard to find spacious rooms in san francisco. the parking when we arrived was terrible. the front entrance only has space for 3 or 4 cars and it was completely full on arrival. it was a bit stressful to check-in due to the parking. the water pressure in the shower was terrible. would not stay again because of the water pressure alone.

amazing location and a beautiful hotel. we are in san francisco for a major convention and couldn't have founded a better hotel. everyone on staff was amazing and attentive. they executed with precision. we recommend that you have breakfast at the mermaid restaurant in the hotel. the first day we went looking for a breakfast spot thinking that we might want to try something different than the hotel but it turns out their breakfast was pretty amazing!

absolutely love this hotel. this is our third time staying here. it's great location being in fisherman's wharf and the cable cars are across the street. from the moment we valet our car we are treated with kindness. the rooms are very nice and the hotel itself is absolutely spotless. oh and the in-room dining is a huge 5 star.

stayed here for a super fun extended girls weekend for a 50th birthday and it was absolutely the best place we could have chosen for the tourist things we all wanted to do. it is wonderfully located on the wharf, right down from a trolly pick up location and the famous buena vista and ghirardelli square-but also next to a double deck bus vendor (always changing) that makes the entire downtown loop-including chinatown, little italy, and macy's square. our room was pretty, clean, and roomy and i'd highly recommend the cost for the experience you'll get.

this is not related to the hotel - i was at this charming hotel for a conference and had then unfortunate circumstance of speaking to an individual (matthew) who was very rude, condescending and unpleasant to interact with. i am an event coordinator by trade and i was considering holding an event here and i may reconsider if having to deal with him.

the hotel is great. concierge and valet staff are phenomenal and really make this a top rate hotel. the lobby is beautiful and the rooms are decent sized (for san francisco). i recommend that you make time to use the free bicycle vouchers and other amenities as it adds to the experience and value. parking is expensive - which is to be expected due to the location.

my family of four stayed between christmas and new years. the room was clean, beds were comfortable, and staff were helpful. however, the lobby area and lobby bathrooms were generally ignored by the staff. the bathrooms were in poor shape, and without paper towels or hand soap. in the lobby, trash and empty glasses were not picked up, and games for children were broken and had missing pieces.

their price is $25 higher per night than they advertise. this "milk the customer attitude" permeates the experience. when you challenge them on this they have many clearly rehearsed excuses. "that it is priceline's problem," "that all hotels still do this" which as all of us who travel a lot know is simply not true any more - it has been years since this last happened to me. when you ask why they don't just include their "bait and switch" fees in their advertised price you get a look like you are from another planet. knowing that i was being taken advantage of really ruined the experience for me. i did the honest thing and, before checking out told them it was my policy to warn others of deceptive marketing practices with one star reviews. they took advantage anyway.

my sister and i stayed here for the weekend and i told my boyfriend that when he and i come back to san francisco that we would have to stay here again. to be honest, the room wasn't the greatest. the whole ambiance of the hotel was comforting; it had a rustic nautical theme, and the decor was really cute. the hotel room just could have been nicer, like they could do a little updating. however, it was pretty clean so i'm not complaining there, i just wish they offered hand soap at this hotel! it's the only hotel i've ever been to that doesn't provide any hand soap. the best thing about this hotel though, is the location. i love being on the wharf so close to everything. it can still take a little while to get where you want to go, even on the wharf, but if you don't mind a 30 minute or so walk then it's not a big deal. i personally like to walk and enjoy being able to explore the neighborhood. one thing that does bother me about san francisco that i'm not sure whether or not gets enough attention (and i've noticed this even in the tourist parts of the city) is the homelessness issue. it saddens me to see all of the homeless people that are around the city. i woke up twice in the morning on my last day here to homeless people outside of our window. it's a pretty pricey place (san francisco), and it doesn't seem like the neighborhoods (nor the people) are being taken care of. it's easy to blame homelessness on drugs, laziness, etc., but in a city that's so expensive ($2500+ to rent a studio) and has more than enough money to do something about the issue, it saddens me. the city is also pretty messy, there is trash everywhere, so i loved that this hotel seemed to be so clean, because i'm not sure i'd feel comfortable staying anywhere else! i do recommend visiting san francisco and giving this hotel a try. this hotel will make your trip because of the convenience of the location.
great hotel! location, service and family friendly approach was perfect!

this was a very nice hotel perfectly located near the water. from the entrance you can see alcatraz. close to a lot of attractions. also, their restaurant was very very good. all the staff were polite and engaging. would definitely consider staying the next time we are in san francisco.

do not stay here! $74 for less than 12 hours of parking along with $238 for a room. horrible customer service, took 2 hours to get the valet to even take and park our car and on top of it nobody asked if we needed help or anything. on top of that we had to unload our bags and carry them up to our room ourselves! so disgusted with this place.. take my advice stay at the marriott it's only a block further down with pull up valet service and better service all around. also the manager told us they'd do "something" for us for all the crap they put us through and at check out they said, "sorry, it wasn't our fault we were slammed last night". worst hotel experience i've ever had in my life! horrible!

all you can ask for. nice staff, luxuriously appointed and guaranteed sweet dreams. i'm a 20 year local, basically grew up here and enjoy the wharf and all it gas to offer. well i should just the tourist enjoy such an incredible cultural offering. i could write a separate post on all the hidden gems of history in this area but this post is for the hotel. don't worry and get obsessed about a room with a view as it really doesn't matter your room will be awesome even if the view is to the wall next door i don't care because it is super comfortable quiet and you want to be roaming around outside anyhow. however if you are not a local pay the extra money to get the view why not go ahead and do it. it's fun to hang out in the lobby get hydrated on lemon water and play all the games sitting by the fire and people watching!

from the minute we pulled up we felt welcome at this terrific boutique hotel. we love the nautical theme and the authentic decor. this is my new favorite hotel in san francisco. it's close enough to the wharf for all the excitement, yet at the same time it feels private. the blue mermaid has great food and we just had a delicious dinner. i will absolutely be back.
