today this late afternoon my husband and i went for a bite to eat at the argonaut hotel and had the pleasure of being served by holly. you're talking about sweet and personable, she's top notch. she believes in making her customers happy and it's genuine. she's not doing it for a nice tip, she just believes in pleasing her customers. beautiful personality, beautiful smile, hard worker and quick on her feet. as we sat there waiting to order, i watched her taking care of her customers and reassuring us she would be right with us. she's quick like step curry. she moves as though she's on a basketball court scoring not 3 points but 5 at each table. she loves her job and her customers too and you can definitely tell she enjoys what she does. i think they should make her the manager of all servers. she should train others to do well too. they'll learn so much from her especially knowing how to serve customers. she reminded us of servers we've seen at the ritz carlton. we hope they realize how blessed they are to have you for an employee.

now this is one of my favorite hotels ever the argonaut it's really beautiful area that it's in is just spectacular you're right in the center of fishing reels worth ghirardelli square is right next to you guys there's a lot of beautiful things that you can do in that area will you will not be bored it's beautiful once again you're right in the center of fisherman's worth you can walk anywhere you want they're if it's a beautiful weather day you can rent yourself a bike or even just walk down wherever you want to walk the food around there is just really nice really good people the staff everybody knows what they're doing then starts if i can give them 10 stars i will be definitely coming back there next time i'm in the area

i do not understand why this hotel is so highly rated. the location was ok and the room clean, but the window was halfway ground level, so all we could see were people't feet. also, i am not convinced about their key room security system. i got back from an excursion, used the key to enter the room and was very surprised to bumped into a men using the toilet. then i realized that i accidentally entered the room next to mine. my room's key opened another room. i went to the reception desk to tell them just as they were getting off the phone with the man who's room i entered. they investigated, and the conclusion was that "i probably did not enter the other room" because their security system did not show that my key was used on the other room. despite the other person confirming my story, they decided it did not happen. i have no confidence in their security system, am not impresses with their patronizing customer service and no intention to return.

loved this hotel. there was a doorman so no one in lobby that shouldn't be. very clean, big rooms, great hotel restaurant, etc. considering it was in the wharf it was quite at night. for sure tourists area but safe and you can walk everywhere
my bucket list hotel. thank you my daughter for my early birthday hotel stay. always wanted to stay here but it was too pricey for me

the hotel as a whole was great. the bellmen were awesome and accommodating, they were always friendly and helpful! i didn't interact much with the front desk, however they were great with our limited interaction. i was very unimpressed with the blue mermaid. i only patronized the blue mermaid for cocktails and was served the wrong drink, the bartender seemed annoyed to be servicing anyone. housekeeping was amazing and did an incredible job. the bed and pillows on the other had were sub-par. bed was as hard as a rock and pillows were basically useless.

stay away from this place, the concept of being polite escapes this property. cars left for valet are not moved causing congestion in the front when trying to load or unload. the doorman did not appreciate said comments and at the time of my visit got a bit upset. this included taking pictures of my license plate.
we stay here every time. you should too. great people and clean stylish rooms, it's the best by the water for fun.

this is a wonderful hotel. it is an expedia vip hotel and was lucky enough as a gold expedia member to get a free room upgrade! very happy. big clean rooms, lots of space, fully stocked snacks and bar. nice size washroom. extremely good location near ghiradelli square and pier 39. the guest services were really nice. beautiful hotel had world cup games in the lobby and free water in the lobby as well. connected to blue mermaid which i'll review later. overall a great experience and would stay here again.

awesome hotel, awesome location, great service. totally worth every penny spent to stay at this location. my family and i were pleasantly surprised at how close everything is located within walking distance of this hotel. ghiradeli square is two minutes away, the trolley is 45 seconds away, the harbor is two minutes away and shops and restaurants are within less than 30 seconds away including my favorite, in and out burgers.

for a 4-diamond hotel property i expected more. rate was ridiculously expensive, but fails to deliver on many standard items that go a long way in terms of guest experience. there is a 'resort fee' charged, but be aware that this isn't a true resort (no pool) and provides little/no actual amenities. also, if you want sweeping city views this property does not provide them. my room faced an adjacent building and i was told that a 'partial view' of the water would be an additional $75/night! disappointing that there was no attempt to compromise on the upgrade, especially considering i was staying 8 nights. in fact, nothing was complimentary here. complimentary water should be provided in rooms, instead there's a $4 charge. fees to access computers in business center?! who does that in 2018? not very accommodating. also, i experienced bed bug bites on my 5th night at the hotel, so that should be remedied immediately. i found features in the bathroom to rather dated, and the bathroom light continued to flicker on and off during stay (room 409). room service and food was prompt and rather tasty, however $10 food credit should be able to be used for room service as well as dining in the restaurant. after all, the guest is already paying for it. in the end, i felt nickel and dimed to death for everything here. that's not how i want to spend my vacation. i'm not confident i would choose the argonaut on another trip to san francisco.
great place, good for kids too. free wine at 5:00 everyday, close proximity to lots of history and wharf activities. hotel very clean and very courteous and helpful staff.

while it's a good location it is not worth the extra cost a mere one block down from a major chain competitor. the inside no view room at almost $300 where we have listened to a child cry for almost an hour and the amenities of robes were not provided and the extra resort cost is definitely not worth it for a short stay. additionally, we had to pay 45.00 for non valet parking which would have been included with the competitors room and they included breakfast but not here. save your money and book one block up.

this hotel is very overpriced in my opinion. i didn't see anything that qualified it as a 4-star hotel. the only thing that justifies a somewhat high rate is the location which is pretty awesome. one of the cable car turnarounds is right next door and it's an easy walk to ghiradelli, fisherman's wharf and pier 39. we were there during july 4th and could literally walk 50 yards from the hotel to watch the fireworks. if not for a deal through travelocity i would've never paid the daily rate. then it turned out that on top of the rate through travelocity, we had to pay a daily facilities fee ($25 + tax per day) that covers the use of the wifi, the coffee in the room, the fitness room, the use of bicycles for two hours a day, etc. has to be the first time i've ever seen an extra charge for wifi and coffee. who does that? the beds seemed ok but my son and i both had backaches every morning for some reason. i've seen other reviews complain the thin walls. we did listen to a little kid screaming one morning but otherwise it wasn't an issue for us. the window did crank open a little which was cool. the one staff member at the desk that i dealt with the most didn't seem to know what she was talking about when it came to questions about the public transportation. we had to figure it out for ourselves. other than the location, i can't recommend staying there.

cute and eclectic hotel across the street from hyde park in the restored brick cannery built in the early 1900s. vintage nautical theme as the name suggests with some odd modern add-ons. weird, artsy wall paper in all the rooms. the nice wooden deck lounge chairs and port hole mirrors made the lobby feel like a ship. the bed is super comfy - not too hard - not too soft. and so quiet! we had a room facing the (very plain) interior courtyard and never heard a door shut or another voice the whole night. lovely bathroom with soft, plush, thirsty towels. feels touristy but all the staff were very friendly and helpful. when we checked in the lady gave us a voucher for 2 drinks in the on-site restaurant and $10 off food.
loved it and would definitely go back! clean rooms, comfortable beds, nice staff, and great location.

this is probably one of my favorite hotels because of the location. it is close to plenty of shops and restaurants especially the ghirardelli square. it was also very quite for it being a family hotel. i enjoyed the design and layout. i highly recommend this place if you're wanting to be ocean front and a short walk from most tourist things. however, if you're looking for bars and clubs to walk to, this place might be a bit to far. you will need to uber to the nightlife due to the many hills in the area. lastly, it's a pretty pricey hotel but definitely worth it in my opinion.

lovely hotel with tasteful sailor inspired interior. the location close to the piers was perfect for us. when booking we got excellent service at the front desk from ms mari carmen, who also made sure that our needs were taken care of upon arrival. we did not have time to lunch nor dine at the hotel, and therefore we shall not be able review the restaurant.

worst service ever! we were ignored at the hotel bar (the blue mermaid) and then when we asked to be seated, the waitress told us that the same thing would occur if we sat at a normal seat since they were busy. me and my boyfriend have been wanting to stay here for quite some time since our initial visit to san francisco, but we will never stay here again. we had probably the worst room in the hotel.
beautiful hotel, very clean, excellent location, delicious restaurant.

this was a great spot to stay and be close to cable car, food and souvenir shops. we had a memorable stay! the rooms have a great nautical theme. interior details were so pretty. beds were super comfy! expect to pay a lot if you want to park your car here.
this is a great hotel the bar was nice, parking is pricy $ 75 per day just park.
they had extra fees at the end that were not made clear at the booking. and overall was too nautical of theme. just kinda a weird vibe, but at least it was clean.

this place is all about location but if you arn't a tourist there isn't much for you here. i was in town for work & luckily only had to stay one night. bed was ok but there was only one source of light in room so i had to get out of bed to turn off light and fumble back in the dark. paper thin walls and blond long hairs in the shower made for a not so private experience. also very limited breakfast option (sad room with complimentary coffee in a lonesome thermos), a slightly wider selection of coffee and some pastries in the down stairs cafe.

this boutique hotel sits at the end of jefferson street. perfect location next to a beautiful green space park, adjacent to the cable car turnaround, the famous buena vista irish coffee bar, and ghirardelli square. pay a little more for the bayside view, it's well worth it to wake up to the sound of seagulls, the sunrise reflecting off the golden gate bridge and the view of the bay!

couldn't have been happier with our choice in hotel! the beds were so comfy that it was almost difficult to get up and leave them in the mornings. as much as we love san fran, we also didn't mind hanging out in the room before bed because the nautical theme is adorable, the rooms are spacey, and we had a fun view of the cable cars. the hotel pays attention to detail, and i loved the little pet area near the entrance even though we didn't bring a fur baby. great service and location, too, of course!

upon checking out i was advised that my receipt would be emailed to me. that never happened. so i called the hotel and you are transferred to a recording that hangs up and does not accept your message. this happened 3 different days. i will never stay at this hotel again.

we had a great stay at the argonaut. came for husbands birthday and we greeted with a nice card, wine and snacks from the hotel staff. such a sweet gesture and perfect way to kick off the trip. staff was friendly and helpful. our room was a king with a bay view. we had stunning views of the golden gate bridge. can also see the ghirardelli's sign and the cable car station. the room was huge and very clean. the location is was perfect for us. it's at the very end of the pier so you walk all the way up and see everything. lots of shops and restaurants near by. also there's an avis car rental a few blocks away which was perfect as we needed a car to go to napa for just one day. and they let you park in there lot for no charge. hotel charges $75 for parking. there's a great breakfast spot a few blocks away, 8am cafe, worth it. the cable car station is just across the street. over all, would love to stay here again.

i have previously stayed here and had a good experience. but this time, not a good experience. we got back after the room after a long day and wanted to relax & watch a movie. but couldn't get the volume turned up to a level we could hear it after paying $30 for the movie. called front desk and they sent up technical support. they said there was nothing they could do about it. so no movie for us! really disappointing! went to bed early with no movie or tv. very poor customer service and not a care that we were unhappy. i have never stayed at a hotel where i can't hear the tv. thought i was paying for a high end classy place but i don't feel that way at all! i would not recommend it!

i do not understand why this hotel has such high ratings. the beds were very firm and not great. the pillows were insanely soft and weird to have with the firm mattress. i asked about whether they had other mattresses and was told no, but they'd call me back to discuss solutions. no one ever called back. we were there for 4 days for my husband to convalesce from some minor surgery so the uncomfortable beds were a pretty significant inconvenience. we didn't need housekeeping for a couple of days but asked for fresh towels. that also did not happen. i really didn't feel the hotel staff had any concerns for us as guests. definitely not a high quality customer service situation, sadly. definitely not worthy of over $1,000 for our 4 day stay. my other major complaint is that the windows have wooden shutters which don't fully close and yet there are lights all around the outside. this meant the room was never completely dark and i found it hard to get to sleep. a minor complaint is that the volume of the tv kept fading in and out irregularly. it wasn't too frequent but the general lack of responsiveness from the hotel staff didn't inspire me to believe they'd fix it promptly- if ever so i didn't bother to request service. there was no market or grocery store terribly close. trader joe's was about a 15 minute walk away so not bad, but not ideal. the restaurants nearby were a mixed bag, but it's a very touristy area so i didn't have high hopes. we could hear yelling in the street on a daily basis and given that the 4th floor we were on was the highest, i imagine all the rooms can hear street sounds too. i wouldn't return here ever nor would i ever recommend it to anyone either.

stayed here a few weeks ago and loved it! very nice and comfortable rooms. beds were very comfortable. excellent location right at fisherman's wharf and within walking distance of so many shops, restaurants and activities. great staff! got a package with parking included and valet brings your car right up. i highly recommend staying here! you will love it!

the location is great, but the rooms are really small and unless you get a view room, don't stay here because you end up looking across the patio into a neighboring room. the musty smell reminds me of mold. lastly, any hotel that has pump shampoo and conditioner in the bathrooms should be avoided. it's super cheap and creepy. who know how long and what's in those containers. sound proofing between rooms is lacking as well.
this is a great hotel. i love the look and the people. the ambiance is great and fits the area. the staff is very nice and helpful. i would recommend this place to everyone. good job!

this is a darling hotel in a great location. it gets two stars for all of the outrageous/outlandish extra charges ($81 for parking, fees for using gym facilities that we didn't use $28). we booked using hotels tonight where they charged us the $28 and then were charged again by the hotel, as well as errors they charged for an upgrade for two nights when we were only there one night. trying to figure out all this mess and double dipping was a huge bummer! check your credit charge statements when you leave.

what a great location. rooms were really nice. i loved the octopus wallpaper and the whole nautical theme. it's definitely worth the extra bucks to stay here. the door men are really nice. one of them had my daughters super pumped on the treasure chest that awaited them in the lobby. great way to start off. my kids were all smiles the whole trip. after walking around seeing the places i avoided i patted my self on the back. i got a lot of your the best dad ever. which is always nice. there's always a lot of decisions when traveling with kids. i am glade i made the one to stay here.

it was my brother's birthday and the hotel did try to make it special by leaving a note with a complimentary bottle of wine; however the note stated the wrong name. they simply just took the person who booked the hotel and used their last name when that is not my brother's last name. it was a little uncomfortable as that is not his last name. perhaps they could have reached out to the person who notified them of the birthday and asked what his first name was or even his nickname. nonetheless, they tried. i will give them that!

this is our second time staying at the argonaut. the first was about 6 years ago and the service and amenities have improved. we have a bay view suite. the bed is comfortable and there were many types of pillows to choose from. the hotel is in a great location. walking distance to some of the most iconic places in the city.

stayed at the argonaut again for thanksgiving weekend 2015. under new ownership now. the room was a little worn. carpet and bathroom tile needed replacement. they no longer have the complimentary wine hour which was great not just for the free wine, but i always enjoyed chatting with people from other places. the staff wasn't quite as attentive as before the turnover. otherwise, it is still a nice hotel in a great location and reasonably priced for what you get in that area.

restaurants all around, ghirardelli 5 minute walk away, inandout burger joint 2 minutes walk. fishermen's wharf right here next to the hotel. great running path and bike path as soon as i walk out the door. i will definitely come back to this lovely hotel.

favorite among favorites. location perfect for grazing the wharf. service is top-notch and the blue mermaid next door is a great meet up place. happy family memories here. really appreciate the effort to retain the brick architectural charm of years past.

i was so excited to stay here, as i had heard great things about this hotel from my manager. i was very much disappointed. i only stayed here one night. thank goodness because the worst thing about this hotel are the paper thin walls. i had a family on one side of me that were very loud and obnoxious. i was able to hear everything they talked about. then on the other side of me was a party going on. needless to say i did not get a great nights sleep. perhaps i was just unlucky in my nearby roommates but regardless i still think the thin walls would be an issue with anybody, no true privacy. the staff at the front desk were nice which is the reason for the 2 stars, but other than that i feel there are better hotels in the area. also, they nickel and dime you for everything. you can have the small in room bottle of wine for $26, purchase the stuffed sea lion on the bed for $22, a liter of water for $6, etc. nothing is complementary. to top it off, i tried to order room service in the morning and when i called i was told my room was vacant and they couldn't deliver to my room. come to find out someone on the morning crew had accidentally checked me out of my room during the night. so when i went to checkout i was told i had already done so. next time i'm in town i will not be staying here. i should have stayed at the hotel i was at before switching to this one. very disappointed.
cozy hotel at fisherman's warf. it's close to all the tourism and in walking distance to the ghirardelli.

i had a comfortable stay in the hotel. prime location. i am celebrating my honeymoon and the hotel staff was more than willing to accommodate us. the hotel was well maintained and had fun nautical decor. i feel the parking was a bit steep. i definitely recommend this hotel to anybody staying in the san fransico fisherman wharf area.
i loved the location of the hotel! perfect to reach anywhere in less than 15 minutes walking. the decor is so refreshing and fun!
best hotel on the pier, hands down. we had a deluxe king looking over the park and golden gate bridge. friendly staff and beautiful building. excellent upscale boutique hotel. will be back.
great hospitality, rooms are very nice, beds are comfortable. i would stay there again!

stayed here twice during november and december and thoroughly enjoyed my stay! lady at the front desk was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. loved the christmas music in the lobby and the beautiful fireplace, rooms were clean and had a lovely nautical theme! location was not too bad, close to the water and tourist shops, and not too far from the alcatraz tour dock. the doorman was very friendly and shared with us about living in philadelphia compared to california which was nice to hear about life in the usa as an australian. would definitely love to come back and stay at the argonaut again.

i have so many wonderful things to say about the argonaut! i stayed at this hotel for 6 nights on business, and i went away with a truly positive experience. years back, i saw the argonaut while on another trip to san francisco, and i always wanted to stay there. something about it just caught my eye. so, when i saw that it had a rate my employer would cover on my recent business trip, i was ready! i tell this tale because i went to the argonaut with high hopes - and they did not let me down. i was not in an upgraded room with a view, but my room was terrific. it was meticulously clean, well-appointed, and very comfortable. my king sized bed offered me a great sleep. the only downer is that the walls did seem a bit thin, and i could hear the neighbors if it was totally silent. fortunately for me, i need to sleep with a fan or white noise of some type, so it was no issue. the staff was also really friendly and accommodating. i wish i could remember everyone that impressed me, but i remember john, frank, matthew, and peter as providing excellent service. best of all? you cannot beat this location! fisherman's wharf is a wonderful location for tourists, and it was just across the street from a beautiful public park, the terminus of one of the cable car lines, and ghirardelli square. there was a huge selection of restaurants nearby, a starbucks around the corner (but you do have a coffee maker in your room), and there were several bus lines within easy walking distance to get all around the city. i have stayed in a lot of locations in san francisco, but this was hands down my favorite.

did a ton of research around fisherman's wharf for a good hotel. the pictures don't lie this hotel is fantastic! the perfect location and the staff is wonderful. we had the standard king room the first night then moved into the king suite with the biggest jacuzzi tub ever for the next two. they moved all our luggage for us as well. everything was clean (which is the most important thing to me) and well stocked. the only negative is the shower - very poor water pressure and shower head stinks! the water pressure in the tub is very strong so it must just be the substandard shower head. however this was a minor inconvenience and we loved our rooms. the theme goes so perfectly with the area and we will definitely stay here again!

after a reservation snafu, stefan (the manager) offered to do more research on the situation and provide resolution. if this top notch customer service is any indication of the guest experience, then we're off to a good start!!

my boyfriend and i had a great stay here. the nautical theme was fun. the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. the room was fairly large and most important, clean! the room was quite too. the wine bar is nice. we ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant, blue mermaid. the food and service at the restaurant was good. my compliant, is the bed wasn't too comfortable. spending the kind of money to stay there, you would think they would have better mattresses. all in all we had a great time and i would stay there again.

if you are having a wedding of under 100 people, we had the ceremony outside in their courtyard and then cocktail hour and reception in the maritime room. i can't say enough positive things about the wedding coordinator chante, who did an amazing job. she was so incredibly helpful and the rest of the staff was amazing. the food was incredible, venue gorgeous! the food tasted exactly like the food tasting and everyone was so happy with their meals. the venue is just beautiful, get married here! i loved every second of it! our family also loved the rooms and had a very pleasant stay. their restaurant also has delicious food. it's also pet friendly, which allowed us to bring our two pomeranians with us. we will come back for our anniversaries for years to come.

eh, we have mixed feelings about argonaut. it's a cute hotel in a superb location but, unfortunately, some things were lacking. we were going to on our mini honeymoon and wanted to stay somewhere pleasant and romantic. based on good reviews, we thought argonaut would be an appropriate choice. we booked online and i called to mention that it was our honeymoon and asked whether it was possible for them to do something nice for us. perhaps a room with a pleasant view? i don't know, sometimes hotels do nice things for their guests on special occasions. well, the lady on the phone couldn't care less about our honeymoon. she responded that we had to pay more for a room with a view. ok, that makes sense, but perhaps she could sound less annoyed with our request? or at least she could try looking into what was available and let us know? so, we arrive at the hotel and find a bottle of wine with a greeting card - very nice of them, thank you, argonaut! however, the room is absolutely tiny and shares a thin wall with the room next door. so thin that we could hear every word of a phone conversation next door. our neighbor wasn't even loud. that wall was paper thin. we immediately regretted our choice. certainly not honeymoon-appropriate. the view was terrible as well. our windows were facing other hotel windows into the courtyard. i guess we did have to pay extra for something bigger, better, and more private, perhaps somewhere a bit more accommodating to our special request.
very friendly staff, and the room is clean. great location, near the wharf. parking is a pain. you're best to valet park it, and not worry about it until the next day.

had a nice break from the craziness of downtown. fish tacos was pretty decent, west coast style. family had salad and something else that i dont remember. everyone was happy with their food. hostess and waitstaff was pleasant and professional.

my husband and i stayed at this beautiful hotel for our 40th wedding anniversary on july 20th through the 26th. i can't say enough about this beautiful hotel. the views were amazing and the staff, well what can i say. they made sure our 40th was a beautiful one, had the sweetest notes, wine and snacks included in our stay. i am recommending this hotel to all our family and friends. i can promise you when we come back there will be no other place we would want to stay than the beautiful, top notch argonaut hotel. thank you again!

wonderful stay! great location! so convenient to everything in the city yet you feel a bit removed from the tourist scene once you step inside. our room was quiet and had a decent view of the courtyard in the cannery. the beds were comfortable and everything was so clean! my only complaint is that the pressure from the shower head is very weak. i figured we were in ca and there was still a drought so i got used to the shower pressure. we enjoyed breakfast at the blue mermaid- service was good there as well. kinda expensive but you have to remember you are in the middle of the tourist area. the hotel gives you a $10 voucher to eat daily there. the cheapest thing on the menu for breakfast is a bagel for $6. coffee is $5. the cost of the hotel was worth the pleasant three night stay in sf. word of advice if you want to save $ during the trip would be to take the muni. the f trolley goes along embarcadero and the 30 stockton goes straight into the heart of chinatown. the 30 bus experience was like an amusement park ride.... (crazy city bus driver trying to keep up with her bus schedule.... ). sf has a great transit system. you get to feel like a local and it's a way better deal than the tourist trap cable car.... $7 versus $2.75. the muni even gives you extra minutes to ride back. on one of our trips we got a return ride included after 4 hours after our initial departure. sweet deal! another money saving tip is to rent a car from sfo and drop it off by closing to the rental agency nearby. we rented from avis and paid only $16 to rent an suv. we arrived early in the morning and drove down to palo alto and returned the car a block away from the hotel by 5pm. parking and driving in the city is so not worth your time or money.

this place is right in the middle of everything! it's such a cute hotel! my husband and i celebrated our 1 year of marriage. we receive a wine bottle, snacks and a cute welcoming note from argonaut hotel. the only thing i didn't like was how expensive parking was. 59 per night!! adds up once you check out! which they did tell me about. besides that, this place is awesome!

ahoy! what a great stay! clean, themed rooms. excellent front desk and bell staff. greeted like royalty ever time i came in and the whole check in was a breeze. great location with everything walkable and would stay again!!

my husband and i stayed here for our honeymoon before going to hawaii. we arrive and we were told our room was not ready yet. we had to leave our bags at the front desk while we went to explore the town. i would have liked to go to the room to freshen up first. we were told we were going to be given a great room since it was our honeymoon. well it didn't really seem like anything was special about it. the one lamp didn't work and the tv didn't work at first, we had to play with it to get it to work. yeah great room. the room was smaller than i was expecting. the bathroom is so small you can barely move. the only nice thing is we got a small bottle of champagne. i did like the nautical decor and the happy hour. but definately not worth the $400 more a night cost we paid for a small room. i don't even think our room in hawaii was that much. and the worst part about our trip is that we never received a gift package that a friend dropped off to the hotel. i didn't notice her email until i returned home and my husband tried contacting the hotel. no one knew anything about it and could do anything, we didn't even get an apology either. i guess it either got lost and there was no communication at the hotel or some employee must have stolen it. highly dissapointed.
a very beautiful hotel located in famous fishermans wharf. the blue mermaid restaurant has delicious chowder in a sourdough bread bowl you must try.

this is an adorable hotel. it's is very close to the water..the theme of the room was sailor/sea.. very charming with expose brick wall and wood beam post in the bedroom and bathroom. the room was a bit small but clean and comfortable. the staff are very friendly and helpful.

not sure why this hotel got 4.5 stars. their beds are tiny queens. two adults can barely sleep comfortably on them. also cots cost extra where most hotels are happy to supply one especially if their beds are tiny. location and interior design are the only good things about this place.

great stay! they were overbooked when we arrived and offered to put is in a huge 900 sq ft room for the first night. since we had a lot of stuff and really did not want to move they figured it out and put us in our standard room as expected. the employees were awesome and so understanding. the room itself we had was a 2 queen and it was spacious and clean. service was impeccable and everything in the room was comfy, making for a great stay. he location is perfect as it puts you close to many great restaurants and is right near shopping and cable cars. i cannot imagine a better hotel for our stay
awesome hotel conveniently located in the fisherman's wharf area! love the staff and the nautical themed rooms! perfect place to stay in san francisco!

the location of this cannery turned boutique hotel couldn't be in a better location if fishermans wharf is your destination. we had a fabulous 2 days exploring all the wharf had to offer. pros of this hotel are the location on jefferson st,the attentive staff, interesting architecture including exposed brick walls and original wood, and nice sized rooms. cons are the awful pancake flat pillows, no extra blankets, very dirty behind bed and nightstand, worn carpets, and no blackout curtains. for the price i'd like to see more attention to details like good pillows and cleanliness. but i would stay here again based on location.

ive found my new replacement to the fairmont hotel. this hotel was unbelievable. i didn't come here to be a tourist of fishermans wharf. i just had always wanted to check out this hotel and i was finally able to. we booked the king suite. one of the most beautiful, comfortable suites ive ever stayed in. better than any suite ive had at the fairmont chain. it over looked a corner of the wharf, which we opened the window up most of the time to the enchanting bay air. the suite had a huge living room with a door that closed to the bedroom that was also giant. the bathroom was also expansive. the bathtub was incredible. its huge. a family of four could comfortably sit in it and actually swim. i couldn't stay out of it. i got in in the middle of the night and i got in as soon as i woke up. i couldn't get enough of this bathtub. i lounged around in my complimentary robe every second i could. the bed was very comfortable. i loved the bedding set. everything was just perfect. going back to the fairmont comparison, this giant suite was $200 cheaper than a regular room at the fairmont. can you believe that?! its so worth it if you can do it. the hotel is wonderful. service is fast and efficient. there are obviously lots of things within walking distance. we walked down by the beach, we walked and got brunch the next day. this hotel has become my happy place every time i reminisce about my stay.

i have stayed in many san franciscan hotels but i think the argonaut may be my favorite. i have always been intrigued and when a good deal presented itself i bit. i was so excited for months and once we arrived it was better than i dreamed. before we walked into the hotel, the doorman was loading our stuff onto a cart and welcoming us. we were very early and didn't expect our room to be ready but marilyn? checked us in and found us a wonderful room with an amazing view. such a small action made such a difference in our vacation because we were able to get settled and enjoy our hotel that much longer, thanks to her. she was super sweet and i can tell she rolls out the red carpet for everyone she helps. the rooms are huge and even have doorbells! the service by all staff members was exceptional and felt like a family environment. the doormen and bell hops seems to genuinely enjoy being at work. we loved the lobby with its fireplace and with complementary citrus infused water. the location is fantastic in touristy fisherman's wharf. if tourist traps aren't your thing, that's ok, the cable car or bus stop is close by and can quickly whisk you away to less visited areas of town, as we prefer to do. one of my favorite things to do when visiting is ride the cable cars at night for stunning views of the city and shorter lines. it was so nice to be staying close to the line. i will most likely stay here again.

an expensive hotel. it's right smack in the middle of the tourist area called fisherman's wharf. checking in was a breeze. they do give you your room key(s) and then another actual physical key. the front desk was explaining it so fast that i missed what it was for. it's not for the safe. it's actually for cabinet to access the fridge. for the price i paid, i expected some sort of view. my view was of the roof of the 1st floor where the air conditioning units are. wonderful! better off elsewhere.
hubby surprised me with a get away here for our anniversary. very conveniently located and service is wonderful. pricey but hey it's san francisco. bed is super comfy and the coffee is delicious.
this is a nice hotel and we really enjoyed the doorman. he made us laugh every time we saw him. this is a great location that is centrally located to most of the attractions that we wanted to visit.

did a lot of research on best hotels to stay in san francisco prior to our visit. picked argonaut based on great reviews.hotel is conveniently located at the end of fisherman's wharf. unique nautical decor. the beds were very comfortable and rooms quiet. the staff was very helpful and friendly. i would give it a five star but we found the bathrooms a bit small for our liking and the closets need lighting. we will definitely stay here again on our next visit.
great location and clean room. friendly staff anytime we asked for anything. our room faced hyde street with a view of the golden gate bridge.

the location for this hotel can't be better! it was just walking distance to pier 39 and being able to just walk a few steps out your hotel and see alcatraz in the distance was surreal. management at this hotel take there job seriously and make it a point to make sure that guests are well taken care of and have a good experience. i just recently went to this hotel and will be going back as soon as possible. just want to thank guysell and the staff there for making our trip and our first time in san francisco memorable.

loved this hotel! from the moment we pulled up we were treated like royalty. they found out we were on our honeymoon so the bellhop had wine brought up to our room. they also upgraded us to a room with a great view of the golden gate bridge. they were so sweet and accommodating they made our stay that much better. every time i think of san francisco i'll think of the pleasant experience i had at the argonaut. the blue mermaid was absolutely delicious also which the hotel gave us drink vouchers for. i couldn't be happier.

we decided to go to hawaii for our honeymoon and my wife planned her dream vacation. we thought it would be a long commute from the philadelphia area, so we should cut our flight in half and stop by san francisco for a few days before we reach hawaii. i took it upon myself to surprise my wife and found what i thought would be a great hotel, the argonaut, near the wharf. when we arrived, our room wasn't ready and the front desk clerk was extremely friendly. she assured us that they had a perfect room for us on the top floor as requested and it would just be a bit longer. we decided to walk around the city for a bit and when we got back to the hotel our "room" was finally ready. we were given keys to the third floor though. i tried to inquire why, but they assured me that was the room they had for us. waiting in our room was a nice bottle of champagne and candy from ghirardelli. there was a card wishing us a happy honeymoon, but on the back of the card was a three digit number starting with 4, so i'm assuming that was the room we were supposed to have. the room looked similar to the photos of the room we wanted, so who really cared? we were on our honeymoon. in the room, a lamp didn't work and the television wasn't plugged in. we had the light fixed quickly and i plugged the television in myself. the hotel had a nice happy hour, where we could grab some free beer and wine. most of the staff were incredibly friendly until after we checked out and i had to contact them. my wife knows the daughter of a woman at her work and she lives in the san francisco area. this woman personally dropped off a gift basket/wedding gift at the hotel. we didn't find this out until we were in hawaii and the woman asked if we received the gift. i still had the card with the other room number, so i contacted the hotel to see if they had the gift and possibly delivered it to our original room. the hotel told me that they didn't have the gift and they were pretty cold to me. i emailed and tried contacting them again to get a hold of another person who could possibly help me and no one could. the manager tried to cover it up by saying they weren't sure why we were moved, but they wouldn't have delivered anything if we weren't in the room. as i mentioned in my final email to them: although our stay wasn't bad, we are put in the position where we have to decide if a close friend, who asked us if we got the gift she personally delivered to the hotel to surprise us with, lied to us or if someone at the hotel kept the gift for themselves. update: our stay was prior to the argonaut being taken over by a new ownership group. i have been contacted by a representative from the new company and he has assured me that there are a lot of new employees. i have no way of knowing if the employees we had issues with are still there or not. i have been assured that our experience would be better the next time, but we still have no desire to return. i have also been told that the happy hour that we enjoyed is no longer available. when i inquired what replaced that, i was basically told to experience it for myself and to contact them for the best rates. that's not a great selling point to me, so i'm not sure if there is anything that special there other than the great location.

my husband and i celebrated our anniversary here. from check in to check out, we loved everything about this hotel. every single member of the staff we had any contact with was friendly and helpful. our room was comfortable and cozy. the fisherman's wharf area is a sentimental favorite of ours so this hotel is perfectly located. we were within walking distance of everything we wanted to do and see on this quick visit. we're already making plans to come back and are looking forward to another stay in this lovely hotel.

we were disappointed this time staying here, we stay here a couple times a year. first, requested room close to elevators, i recently had knee surgery and needed something close, got room down the hall not close to elevator. when checking out, requested to stay 1 hour later, was denied. not great with customer service. one would think a repeat customer of several years, they would honor customer loyalty, they didn't. and we stayed during the week, so it wasn't peak times or weekend. very disappointed.

stayed here recently on the recommendation of a friend, and so happy that we did! we splurged on a bay view queen room that looked out on the trolley turnaround and the sf bay and golden gate bridge. the room was clean, spacious, comfortable, and quiet. i loved that we could go downstairs for a full breakfast in the restaurant (good breakfasts) and then just walk to everything from the hotel--over to fort mason, down fisherman's wharf, down the embarcadero to the ferry building. splendid!. barring that, it's so easy to take an uber and avoid driving and parking. staff was very friendly, including the concierge who booked us at green's in 5 minutes and drew us a map of the walk to get there. i can't wait to visit again and stay at the argonaut! it's pricey, but worth it!

my husband and i love this hotel we got engaged at this hotel about 2 years ago so we can't see ourselves staying anywhere else. we just stayed here again his weekend and it was what we remembered from our fond memories. from the outside service to the front desk, the service is impeccable. they are all very friendly, accommodating and professional. my husband spoils me so we stay in the suite with the hot tub and love love love it! the room is extremely nice and we feel right at home when we come here. the best part is is the hotel is located within walking distance to fisherman's wharf which we love. i highly recommend staying here.

my wife and i stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and we couldnt have had a better time. the hotel staff for polite and friendly and always willing to help with anything. the rooms were very clean and comfortable. the location cannot be beaten and we had a great view of the bay from our room. i would recommend this place to anyone who wants to visit san francisco.

super happy with our stay here!! after getting checked in they offered to upgrade us to a room with a view. the location and views are absolutely gorgeous! we are literally steps from the beach and steps from fisherman wharf. the hotel itself had a nautical feel decor. the rooms are spacious and the staff was amazing. overall i would stay here again!

this time we reserved our room through expedia and couldn't have been happier. price was reasonable. we had a deluxe king room with a view of ghirardelli square, the cable cars and a peek of the bay. don't waste your money on the overpriced view rooms (unless you can get a good price) this was perfect! room 238 was big, clean and comfortable! everyone was super friendly and nice and again the location is fabulous! will definitely be going back! too much fun!

stayed here for my first trip to san francisco because of location and reviews. very pleased with the choice! the staff was welcoming and friendly--especially marilyn at the front desk who gave us great suggestions for site seeing and restaurants. the location is right in the heart of fisherman's wharf and the building is historical. i would return without hesitation!

this is a nice boutique hotel with excellent access to fisherman's wharf. it's overpriced and the rooms are a little too small and uncomfortable. i'm glad we stayed here once, but i don't think we'll be back unless we can find a really low rate. not a bad experience overall.

kitschy but cool nautical theme. nice lobby space with a fireplace and several seating areas for hanging out or playing games. rooms are spacious and some have exposed brick and beams. reasonable but not cheap. right in the heart of the tourist attractions along fisherman's wharf so plenty to do within walking distance.

so i've stayed here a number of times. it's a nice hotel but i'm 2 starring it because of the pretentious bs. i've booked rooms from their website and from discount sites. the regular rooms are great. they keep what i can only assume are rooms for chumps who rent on third party websites. here's my experience today. i'm driving into the city from work so i can catch a flight tomorrow. i check their website and the discount sites. discount sites are 50$ cheaper. out of courtesy because i like the hotel, i call them direct and see if they will honor the rate i found on every other third party site. the lady who answers checks her third party rates and claims she doesn't see the same and declines to match. i triple checked to make sure all of the sites had the same. she makes no counter offer for what she allegedly sees. so i say thank you and book thru a third party. this is the second time i've done this and they have done this. the hotel has no idea who i am. i arrive and a new guy checks me in. he's gracious polite and efficient. i head to the room. yup they shoved me all the way in the back, and it's a long slog from the elevators. which would be ok if the room weren't a deliberately under-furnished pos. the other rooms have a lovely couch and desk arrangement. i have the same sized room with a desk and a single tiny sad dirty little chair. there is a giant gap on the wall where the couch should be. and the bathroom has hair in it. plus the bath mat is scummy with mold. so tell me management? how sad is it that you actually keep rooms that you refused to put the normal furniture in and don't maintain as well just for third party bookings? i know the hotel isn't full tonight. i checked the vacancy level. when these guys have their a game on it's nice but they actually train their desk staff to lie. you will actually have a better stay at a hampton or a holiday inn.

this hotel is ahhhhmazing! we stayed for 3 nights and didn't want to leave. the staff starting from the gentleman in a uniform were all so pleasantly helpful and sincere. the location is wonderful. my husband and i walked to the alcatraz ferry, pier 39, cable cars and gheredelli square. the walls are paper thin that will be my only complaint. our next door neighbor liked to leave his tv on all day and all night. they came back to their hotel room with 2 other people (no biggie) at 2am and their conversation which was not loud but sounded like they were standing at the end of my bed. i knew i could count on the staff to address the concern with a phone call away but i decided to not bother. the food, hospitality and decor is top notch and will always be my go to place in the fishermans warf area.

as our tickets to san francisco were nearing, i urged my boyfriend to book at the argonaut for our fun trip in the city. when it comes to location, this place to rocks! i think fisherman's wharf is the ultimate place to stay in the city! this way, you can be close to attractions like alcatraz, pier 39, and epic views of the golden gate bridge. growing up, my dad would always book at the argonaut. our stays at this venue are particularly nostalgic for me because some of my favorite family memories were spent here. i remember being infatuated with the aquatic style decor and outfits worn by staff. as a child, this place was wonderland! returning as a now, 23-year-old, i saw the hotel much differently. it is still spectacular but for the price, it didn't exactly meet the mark for me. now the style of the hotel looked a little bit tired and in need of a revamp. the staff seemed less cheery than i remembered too, in fact, they all seemed a bit disgruntled. it was a hard pill for me to swallow that the hotel was not as magical as i had remembered! this is not to say that this isn't a fabulous hotel! i just believe it is a bit tired in its theme and lacking in effort.

i've been coming to the argonaut for years, in fact i got married here! they have always been super friendly and accommodating. they love our dogs and always give them treats! the front desk always makes sure i get the room we love. the hotel itself is located in an old canning factory. it's gorgeous and they gave it a sophisticated nautical feel. plus, it's always spotless. rates have always been very reasonable. it changed hands recently and now noble house runs it. it's exactly the same, maybe even slightly better! book a room here. you will be thrilled!

this was one of the best hotel experiences i have ever had! upon arriving in mid afternoon in the hustle and bustle of fisherman's wharf, we were a bit flustered with traffic and where to park. when we pulled out in front of the hotel, the staff instantly warmly greeted us and gave us directions on where to park. although they do offer valet parking for $50 per night, we opted to self park behind the hotel (that is not affiliated with the hotel). they grabbed our luggage for us while we parked which helped us from lugging all our heavy baggage across the street. check-in was easy, and we were amazed by our nautical themed room. it was very spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated. we were stunned that every room even had their own doorbell! the lobby was also cozy with a fireplace, plenty of sitting room, and had an attached restaurant. although we did not eat at the restaurant, the menu looked appetizing and it was nice to know it was a place we could go to for a snack if needed. we loved this hotel not only for the ambience, but also because it is in the best location in fisherman's wharf. unfortunately, the location is probably why it was on the pricer end. it is located right on the main street across from the piers between ghirardelli square and all the wharf's shops/restaurants, so you have easy access to eating and entertainment without taking transportation. we were sad to leave this hotel, but we will be back!

the argonaut has beautiful architecture and stylish decor. the beds are firm but comfortable. at first i was disappointed about our lack of view, but quickly realized we had a much quieter room than one on the street. there is even a doorbell to our room, which i've never seen before, though minus one star for the bright blue light it shone into the room all night. i think it was a great idea that the refrigerator with snacks for purchase has a lock, in case any youngsters get left in a room alone for a spell. it is a quick walk to the water and the maritime museum across the street is a highlight. the staff were very friendly and helpful. we enjoyed our breakfast from the blue mermaid located right beside the hotel. i appreciated the use of refillable soap dispensers rather than wasteful single use ones. i would definitely come here again.

reservations were easy to get. room looked recently remodeled. very cool nautical theme. room was very clean. staff was very friendly and genuinely interested in our satisfaction. beware, parking in the area is very expensive, and the hotel is no exception. the hotel charges parking by the day, $50 per day, but you are allowed to take your car and drop it off as much as you like without additional charge. we left our car at the hotel for the entire duration of the trip. we walked, took uber, and got tickets for the "hop on hop off" tour. i'm sure we saved money that way. everywhere we went, parking looked scarce, and driving seems very stressful. the best part of the hotel is the location. so much to do within 1 mile of the hotel, it can even seem overwhelming. but throughout the entire trip, we did not see a hotel in a better location compared to argonaut hotel. on our next visit, we will be returning to this hotel.

actually was quite disappointed. after reading the hotel reviews, i was confident i'd made a wise choice in making my reservation at the argonaut. arrived at the hotel at approximately 10:30 pm and there was no assistance with luggage, nor any luggage carts for self use. there is no reception area with any available coffee or tea. even holiday inns make coffe and tea available. room was small but clean. washcloth had holes in it making for another poor impression. the first morning we went to the blue mermaid for breakfast. the restaurant had very few patrons yet service was slow. food was delivered to the table cold. had no interest in dining there again after that experience. the evening prior to our departure, i stood at the concierge desk while the woman went about her business without so much as an acknowledgment that i was there. i have to admit the reason i'd return is because of its location. within reasonable walking distance to all the piers and shopping and any water excursions. trams are approx 3 blocks from hotel. if you don't expect much in the way if service then i highly recommend the argonaut, however i will be looking for another hotel in the fishermans wharf area for my next visit to this fabulous city.

boutique hotel with extremely clean rooms and classy, unique decor. i stayed here for a weekend away with my husband and we loved that our room looked out on the bay and the cable car turnaround. our room furnishings were perfectly comfortable and very unique with a brick wall on one side of the room, very quiet. super slow service at the concierge desk and the concierge was absent much of the time we were there. the free bikes to borrow were especially appealing! personally, i don't love fisherman's wharf but this hotel is at the far end of the madness, next to a very pretty park and a short, flat distance to some interesting bars and the ferry building. i would stay here again.

loved this hotel and it had been updated when we visited in summer 2016. lovely room, but beware the room service. it is slow and forgetful. we would stay again, though due to its location, style, museum, and looks.

absolutely wonderful fantastic hotel! great location! this was my first trip to san francisco, but my husband has been a few times for conferences and he said he always walked by this hotel and wanted to stay here. so we did! we got a room with a view of the bridge and alcatraz island. so beautiful! the area was busy with lots of vacationers. not a lot of kids at the hotel, mostly couples. we asked the concierge desk to help us a couple of times. once to rent a car so we could drive to muir woods, sausalito & golden gate park; and she gave us great info for a day we walked around to coit tower...such as don't miss the food market at the ferry building. and a second time for transportation back to the airport. we reserved a towncar and it was only a few dollars more than uber but less hassle. we took the cable car to union square one day and ate at sears diner and after some shopping, went to china town and ate lunch and bought some tea. then walked to coit tower and down the filbert steps to levi park and walked back along the piers. another day we took bikes down to fort point. took lots of pictures, the fort has beautiful architecture and an interesting history. then we rode across the golden gate bridge to sausalito and ate lunch and ice cream and then biked back across the bridge in the fog (very cold and it was july!) and went to the palace of fine arts before returning the bikes. (there was a ferry from sausalito but the line was so long, we chose to ride back) we did go tour alcatraz island (get your tickets online as early as u can!) and hung out at pier 39 afterwards. this hotel is close to the cable car station, ghirardelli square, great restaurants, museums, bike rental shops, alcatraz pier, shopping, pier 39, lombard street...well almost everything. we ate at the blue mermaid a few times for breakfast and once for dinner. all our food was good especially the chowder flight.

we stayed here while on the first half of our honeymoon. the hotel was great, clean, convenient. the staff even left a surprise bottle of champagne to congratulate us on our honeymoon, which was really kind. the only thing that bothered us was that we felt the concierge (we met with two separate staff members) were less than helpful. they seemed to give us quick answers and acted rushed. you can imagine that a couple who are visiting san francisco for the first time might have a lot of questions about what to do and how to get there. we felt uncomfortable asking all our questions there.
although the location is supremely ideal, the valet parking is a long wait, and is overall not a good price for what you get.

just arrived, and so far it's great! the staff is was extremely helpful from the bellman/doorman, front desk, a great choice in a perfect location. the concierge gave us a great place to eat in north beach, and it was excellent. it was also kid friendly, a good mix of guests!
beautifully decorated and great location. tip: don't stay on bottom two floors they can be loud with sidewalk at window level.
cute little boutique. awesome service. room was clean and smell fresh. reasonable price for a great view of the bay.

the argonaut is a beautiful hotel in a great location in san francisco. the staff is amazing and couldn't be more accommodating. the room oversaw the action packed jefferson street and we had a wonderful view of alcatraz island. the room was spotless. the cleaning staff did a great job. we enjoyed the restaurant downstairs, the blue mermaid. we'll stay at the argonaut when we come visit again! thanks!

this was our second visit to the argonaut we had an amazing stay in january 2013 and had been eagerly awaiting our return visit whilst the room location and staff remain fantastic the changeover from a kimpton hotel to noble house has stripped away those little extras that made the hotel so welcoming and took it into the great category no longer is there hot chocolate available in the lobby on a cold afternoon and no evening wine reception which made the lobby such a social environment the childrens treasure hunt and babysit a goldfish programs have also been ceased the room and beds are comfortable even for a family of 4 with plenty of luggage however this trip we suffered the problem of thin walls one night with a crying baby on one side and two yapping dogs on the other other nights were no problem so probably just luck of the draw that particular night we enjoyed our stay mainly due to the staff and location but hope noble house consider reinstating some of those special touches in the future

very nice and comfortable property great beds and pillows no fan in the bathroom so mirror fogs when you take a shower the toiletries are large bottles that you pump it would be nice to have individual ones beware they charge a ridiculous resort fee and the only amenity is a workout room that we never used

we had planned many months ago to stay at fishermans wharf because we wanted easy access to fishermans wharf for our daily walks we switched to the argonaut at the last minute when ta reviewers alerted us to the fact that our previously booked hyatt at fishermans wharf was undergoing noisy disruptive renovations we are very glad we made the change we knew it would be more expensive but this was a special trip for us as we were celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary there is much to admire about this hotel the front desk staff were very welcoming and knowledgeable when we checked in in fact all the employees we met in the halls at the front door and everywhere were unusually friendly and pleasant when we arrived in our room we found a lovely congratulatory note from marc with a complimentary bottle of good wine very nice touch our room was small but adequate and we loved its excellent view of the wharf the waterfront and alcatraz we were pleased we had paid extra for a bay view room and recommend room 446 to you we also enjoyed two different breakfasts at the hotels blue mermaid restaurant and service by christa but were too busy to use the free chowder coupons they gave us three problems 1 this was the worst business center we have ever been in and we regularly use them in hotels all over the world they charged 795 for 15 minutes usage and most of that time was spent waiting for slower than oldfashioned dialup service and reading unwanted popup ads not at all worthy of a firstclass hotel like the argonaut in fairness we must say that they took one of those charges off our bill when we complained 2 the shampoo conditioner and liquid soap all are so high on the shower wall that they are not reachable by anyone preferring a bath 3 there is only one chair in the room making it difficult to dress watch tv read and chat if you are a couple

although the hotel itself is nicely done and the rooms are big much bigger than we thought the value for money is at the lower end also the lobby and bar area are somewhat not inviting its really more a place to sleep but not hang around in the evening and for this the price is too high then one rather choses a nice hotel in the business district for the same money

the hotel is in a former manufacturing facility they have preserved some of the 4x4 beams and ibeams etc and try to integrate with the decor however the nautical theme is tacky and poorly down rooms c just about enough space for a king bed and your luggage a bit rundown staff d surly and unhelpful location b+ in the heart of waterfront along the piers

we stayed here primarily to be close to the wharf and cruise ship terminal areas since we knew wed be doing a great deal of walking we chose a suite with a jacuzzi tub the room was enormous a spacious living area that had a large dining room table couch and chairs as well as a large bedroom area one of our favorite features of the room was that it was a corner unit and we had a lot of windows we could open to get some fresh air the tub was a bit difficult to get in and out of but a welcome respite at the end of our long days the staff were very knowledgeable and helpful any time we had questions or sought restaurantbar recommendations overall we had a fantastic stay and will most likely consider staying here again in the future

great staff amenities the lobby is cool the rooms offer nice decor with red brick walls and a large bed we had a view overlooking the bay street and the room was quiet with the traffic below would recommend to others to stay

first stop on our honeymoon was san francisco the argonaut hotel is situated perfectly for sightseeing in the city rooms were tidy and of okay size no honeymoon champagne thoughboo although theres an hour of free wine and beer in the hotel lobby loved the theming would stay again

my partner and i visited argonaut while we were in california in september 2016 we arrived the hotel late afternoon with our hired car the valet service was excellent quick and efficient they took care our luggages and sent them straight to the room the checkin was seamlessly quick and we got offer an upgrade to a suite and we took it it was the best choice ever the room was spacious clean and beautiful the naval style design with excellent fabric and a warm mixture of colours made you feel like home my favourite parts of the suite were the bathroom and the view from the suite the suite has a walk in shower and a huge bathtub with the view of fisherman wharf from our suite we can see alcatraz and golden gate bridge it was breathtaking the concierge lady was extremely helpful she helped us to get a table in a local well known restaurant gary danko which apparently the reservation for a table can be demanding as it always fully booked we were very pleased with that if i have to pick on the downside of the hotel i would say the price and the noise insulation you can clearly hear the conversation and people walking down the hallway from your bed i would recommend argonaut hotel to any travellers that visit san francisco for the first time or a frequent travellers that been many times well done

booked the hotel several months ago as part of a 6 week usa trip the rooms and all public areas were kept really clean and all the cleaning staff always had a smile for you the other staff were all very pleasant but there seemed to be some resentment about handling your own bags which i had not come across in the 20 or 25 or so other hotels i had stayed in during our 9 state trip i asked to use a trolley which again have been available in all the other hotels but was told they are only for the bell boys use i dont mind paying for a service but i dont being pushed towards it im sure the management are going to come up with some excuse like health and safety rather than it being a way for staff to make up their low wages the other thing i was not aware of is that it is a pet friendly hotel which in our case meant being woken up 3 morning in a row by the people in the next rooms dog barking the resturant was ok as was the bar but quite costly certainly a great location for the wharf area but that said this was my first time back in 20 years and its not the clean historic place it used to be

we stayed as a family in july 2022 what can i say right next door to the cable car a short walk from ghirardellis close to fishermans wharf and alcatraz is literally the first thing you see as you walk out of the lobby extremely comfortable great service gorgeous styling i come from the uk and very much hope ill get to stay here again one day

charged double for room once they have got advance payment then they carched same amount from creditcard and caused costs for telefon calls with austrian bank raiffeisen and our travel agency to refund the ammount carparking charged usd 8050 overnight whithout informing the guest before check in this is not acceptable even in bellagio las vegas tehy charged only usd 30

we were welcomed to the argonaut the moment we stepped out of the cab until the moment we left it was our 45 wedding anniversary so the young lady at the desk gave us an upgrade and had a bottle of wine delivered to our room the room was clean charming and most comfortable

fantastic hotel in the best possible location pier 39 alcatraz tours restaurantseverything you want to see is within easy walking distance of the argonauts front door inside the rooms are well appointed clean and the beds are super comfortable very quiet at night wifi worked perfectly recommended for those who are willing to spend a little more to be within walking range of everything

i dont understand the positive reviews my room was full of mold and mildew the furniture was worn way beyond shabby chic there were holes in the carpets and there were stains on the bed skirt no soundproofing i could hear coughing talking and worse i dont often write reviews but i feel compelled to warn others especially because i love sf and hate that some tourists will leave embittered by their experience at this hotel

my girlfriend and i stayed here a week and had a nice comfortable and relaxing stay every night staff was prompt and excellent and so was housekeeping will definitely come back to this hotel next visit

from my pov after a few stays best hotel for that area even if you are not anymore into fishermans wharf you are close to cable car end point which goes directly to city centerunion square very authentic very nice

we chose the argonaut from the lonely planet guidebook for a twonight stay in san francisco to break the trip from the uk back home to nz it had friendly helpful knowledgeable staff is in a great location and features guest rooms of high quality i wouldnt hesitate to recommend it

staff were friendly if they knew you were a guest my partner smokes and went outside to do so and was promptly told to move until they realized he was a guest dogs allowed and i did not like their doings in the foyer rooms were very nice though the coffee making machine in the bathroom location was great for what we wanted

great location lovely hotel right by all the tourist area the rooms are very light in the morning very expensive breakfast should be included for the price we wouldnt recommend it go to holiday inn express they give you breakfast the only thing this hotel gives away is a glass of water no pool no gym

from the moment that we checked in to our sad departure didnt want to leave the staff was exceptional our room was perfect spacious clean comfortable and quiet restaurant nice lobby area had room to sit by the fireplace play chess and board games or read a book loved that we could open our window in our room and hear the sounds of fishermans wharf we were serenaded every evening by a very talented sax musician i would highly recommend to all to book this hotel for their next trip to san francisco excellent location

a perfectly located hotel for visitors looking to spend time in the city of san francisco just across the street from hyde street pier near fishermans wharf ghirardelli square buena vista caf piers 39 to the hyde street pier the cable car pickup and cable car museum if you are a walker chinatown is not too far away but remember that the streets in san francisco are hilly so you will get a great hamstring workout walking up those hills and a great quadriceps workout walking down the service at the hotel was really wonderful with the doormen eager to greet help and find you transportation if need be we were glad we did not rent a car as parking is difficult to find and expensive too but really not necessary due to easy walking share ride shuttles cable cars bart subway taxis uber lyft and even some pedicabs the fun nauticalthemed dcor rich in blues creams reds and whites with exposed brick wide planked floors and interesting marine and boating accessories the room and lobby did not disappoint as they looked even better than in the pictures posted online we even noticed how the wallpaper in our 4th floor room had been hung matched the pattern perfectly and we could not even find the seams clean linens covered comfortable highseated beds in the lobby cozy chairs flank a warm fireplace and a fruitinfused water dispenser invited thirsty guests paula our favorite concierge knew the where hows and whats of the city the wellequipped workout facility on the second floor got very little use from us due to all the walking we did in the city dogs were seen but not heard nor smelled a wine bar attached to one side of the hotel invited us in for happy hour and adjoining the other side the free maritime museum part of the national park encourages visitors to learn about pacific coast maritime history although the blue mermaid restaurant tempted our taste buds we elected to explore the myriad of restaurants and food booths at the docks we reserved our 4th floor room about three months in advance and although the cost for one roomtwo people for three nights ran about 1100 including tax but we discovered that that prices for most places in san francisco were that or more expensive remember to ask for veterans aaa or other discounts when booking the only drawback we had was that we requested a room with a view as advertised but when we arrived the only room they offered was a room with a view of another building with a small courtyardunless we wanted to upgrade for 150night it made no difference as we enjoyed all the other amenities the closeness of the activities and the service provided tripdvisor will send information on deals to your email if you sign up i would definitely stay here again

hotel is dated and kind of dingy bc of it room was on ground floor with no space btwn active tourist street nice to be close to water but it was way too hokey for our taste i recommend finding a newer hotel

the hotel is in a beautiful and very coinvent location however when we arrived our room was dirty there was dust on everything almonds on the floor the usb device was filthy dusty and sticky the concierge sent us the wrong way on the bus which ruined one entire day for us the bartender was excellent and provided us with great restaurant recommendations

this is a boutique hotel the building has a rich historyworth checking out the free tour given by park ranger was very informative everyone was quite friendly and helpful the hotel is situated across the street from fishermans wharf and an easy walk to pier 39 and many restaurants our room faced a courtyard full of windows to the next hallway of roomswouldnt do that againwe thought it would be quieterturns out that we were incorrect our room was well appointed albeit very narrow i had a huge problem with my asthma in this roomwhich means either mold or dust its an old hotel so it could have been either we didnt spend much time in the room anywaybut if you have allergies beware

i stayed at this hotel 12 nights if you are looking for a unique boutique tourist hotel in the middle of the fishermans wharf this is a fantastic choice the positives are that it has an incredible location and is easy walking distance to everything touristy near fishermans wharf the decor is completely nautical but is tastefully done the rooms are also very unique and finished well the restaurant and full bar are good choices the only downsides are that you will generally pay the prices associated with a highend luxury hotel and if you are a business traveler the location is far from most businesses but still an easy uber ride away overall i would highly recommend this hotel

stayed 4 nights at this lovely hotel we had booked in at the hilton but transferred here and it was a very good decision lovely privately run hotel great staff comfy rooms and a brilliant location to explore fishermans wharf couldnt recommend it highly enough

the hotel was only for one night we had a meeting to attend the next morning and didnt want to have to drive super early we arrived late and the original room had quite the party going on next door after a quick consult with one of the staff members we were moved the new room was amazing this hotel is smack in the middle of some of the best sights in sf you have the wharf alcatraz the gg bridge and ghiradellis we had a lovely time and definitely added this place to our list of hotels that well use in the future
great hotel right across from the wharf district walk to si many restaurants hop on bus start and cable car all 1 block away views to alcatraz friendly staff and very nice rooms would stay here again

great location to see some of the best tourist spots in san francisco easy access to the trolley and other public transportation to get around the staff is friendly and accommodating definitely try out their restaurant food is quite tasty

the best hotel in fishermans heart area excellent customer service by both management and staff tenzin and steven at the front desk were wonderful all staff were wonderful the rooms are inviting and clean location is awesome the hotel goes above and beyond to ensure guest satisfaction blue mermaid chowder house has the best chowder in the city thank you for a memorable stay we will for sure return again and recommend it to everyone for both business and leisure

i chose the argonaut for a friday night stay when i picked my girlfriend up from the airport and planned to make my proposal for marriage the staff went above and beyond to make our stay special and we were able to be upgraded to a wonderful room view on the top floor the hotel is in an awesome location so theres a ton of stuff to see and do all within easy walking distance we had a fantastic experience and were both grateful for the friendly staff and beautiful room well done and thank you all
