extremely thin walls where i could hear the conversation next door perfectly the staff was nice overall a bit expensive for what you get in terms of finishes and views my window looked directly into another room staff was nice

fantastic location fantastic decor we loved our stay in one of the suites the linens beds are super comfy service was great we cant wait to return we loved the national parks mmuseum hyde pier crab walk away and much much more

this is our go to hotel in san fransico hands down some of the best service from valet bell staff and front desk this hotel hires great service minded staff alway friendly and welcoming the hotel is located in the perfect spot for us as we travel with our dog and dont have to walk him to far for a park your in the city but less foot traffic and riffraff the rooms are spacious and the beds are so comfy it can be hard to get up in the morning we always opt for a room with a view also included in your stay is their wine and beer reception free anchor steam yes please i have stayed at hotels all over san francisco and always return to the argonaut cant wait to return

we returned to this hotel to celebrate our anniversary and were not disappointed the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful the hotel is clean and well kept up the location in relation to tourist attractions is perfectmost things are walkable or there is access to public transportation we ate in the restaurant twice once for dinner and once for breakfast dinner was very dimly lit and loud breakfast was brighter and quieter the food was good we cant wait to return for another visit

we loved the argonaut hotel the location cant be beat we walked down to pier 39 and to the alcatraz tour dock the views of the bay are amazing the staff was very sweet and surprised us on our birthday trip the rooms were clean and very spacious we would definitely stay here again

i loved this hotel the location was amazing right by the beach with easy access to everywhere the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly the food was lovely also i loved wine hour and our room was gorgeous i could have slept in the bed forever free wifi a huge bonus in san fran was also really good the only downside was the really expensive parking but everything else was amazing i am normally pretty critical of hotels but this one really ticked all the boxes

you just cannot go wrong with this hotel location and the quiet little maritime museum at the foreground of their lobby is a must see for san fransisco enthusiasts great staff wonderful maritime themed lobby and rooms good grub at the blue mermaid linked to the hotel definitely will miss the wine receptions but all in all a must stay in the city

we usually stay closer to union square but decided on a change of direction everyone at the hotel was very helpful the room was great we looked out over the courtyard which was probably the quieter side i imagine the sides that faced the street were much louder we never heard any street trafficthe only available king room when i made our reservation was a handicapped room but i so no problem with it the only minor complaint was not much counter space in the bathroom plus it is just across the street from buena vista so i definately got my irish coffee fix

we thoroughly enjoyed staying at the hotel save for the slightly cheesy decor service so sotherefore its really all about the location down on the waterfront dont eat in house try to venture further out and about to enjoy the location

what a great place this is right in the middle of things down in fishermans wharf the rooms were set out in a sailor kind of theme which was great they were always kept so tidy also they had a wine an beer hour every afternoon at 5 i think an that was great to just relax an have some free drinks an taste some of there amazing clam chowder the restaurant there is exceptional i dined there twice in my 3 night stay the location is good with views of the bridge right outside it would definitely stay here again

we have stayed here on several trips to san francisco love the proximity to fishermans wharf and the cable cars lovely evening social hour in the lobby valet parking historic building national park maritime museum in the lobby and actual museum ships on display just across the street from the hotel great service unique rooms

this hotel did not disappoint we ended our spring break vacation 1st stop napa with a two night stay in a king one bedroom suite at the argonaut and it was lovely from the valet to the front desk guest service was wonderful they offered us fiji water and guest wellness kits with face masks sanitizer wipes and spray hand sanitizer upon arrival the one bedroom suite was described on the website as approximately 600 sq ft but it seemed much bigger perhaps we were upgrade it had a comfortable living room with pull out sofa bed which we used for our kids and a nice dining table perfect for a family the suite had exposed brick walls giant wood beams and beautiful white wood window shutters the nautical theme was tastefully done to our surprise they sent up a complimentary bottle of wine and welcome note on our first night the hotel is in a perfect location on the quieter end of the wharf but close enough to walk to pier 39 and ghirardelli square lots to do and plenty of food options and souvenir stores the bay company across the street has quality clothing and souvenirs with great customer service highly recommend the argonaut

great hotel in wonderful location at fishermans wharf nice spacious rooms with bridgealcatraz views good tv free wifi courteous attentive staff free winebeer reception for 1 hour each day was a welcome bonus

this is a great place for getting the feel of san francisco there is a need doggie welcome in the foyer the furnishings by the fireplace are comfortable a welcoming happy hour is fun my room was furnished with a maritime motif the window opened a rarity with most hotels the blue mermaid next door has a great breakfast menu housekeeping is only soso but you cant have everything there is one strange workerstephen the bellman does little besides cavorting around the sidewalk not much help in getting cabs

we stayed for 6 nights in a corner suite on the top floorthe suite was very large with a fantastic bathroom the bed was comfortable and the sofa bed was better than average the room along with the whole hotel was spotlessly clean and very professionally run all of the staff were great and the concierge zakhida was very helpful before my arrival in sorting out a really good itinerary of trips the view from the room was of alcatraz and the gg bridge we enjoyed breakfast most mornings and had one dinner in the restaurant all were very good as were the staff free water is available and there is availability of coffee in the rooms we asked for a kettle and tea bags and these were provided the only negative for me was that someone used the street as a race track each night to rev their motorbike luckily it didnt go on beyond about 11pm but did go on all late afternoon and evening which was very annoying obviously not the hotels fault and beyond their control there are lots of restaurants and cafes close by as well as shops and transport we enjoyed our stay and would like to thank the staff for their hard work and can recommend the argonaut as a great place to stay

we loved our stay at the argonaut where so many iconic san francisco attractions were right outside our door we indulged in the blue mermaid restaurant twice for convenience and quality but more economic options were also in easy walking distance the concierge was most helpful in assisting us to make the right choices for our stay and see the things we most wanted to see

arguably the best location in san francisco end of the cable car line minutes walk to the alcatraz port pier 39 lombard street and a fantastic views of the bay nautical themed rooms were well designed and gave a homely feel with all of the above taken into account the best thing about the hotel is the happy hour which is in fact free beer and wine tasting it turns the bustling foyer into a mecca of wine and beer connoisseurs who share their tourists experiences highly recommend staying here and will be revisiting san francisco

i rate the argonaut as average as i thought that the hotel is ok starting with the pros in that check in was smooth with the staff being polite they provide 10 vouchers to the blue mermaid for each of the days you stay upon entering my room which was a standard room decor is nice while accommodations were clean and tidy rooms arent large which is fine for those that are alone no so much for families the walls in the rooms are thin i hear everything people coughing to the movement of the bed in the room next door this part for me made it a poor experience overall the argonaut is a good hotel id stay again given its price and proximity to a number of things to do in the area

stayed in early oct including the fleet weekend although booked a year ago was given a room on 2nd floor as was told that higher floors given to those only here for a day or two and we could move to a higher floor tomorrow why not just preallocate rooms as a lot easier price very high and aligned to top hotels in london eg the ritz but dont feel you get same level of quality love the sustainability of hotel but toiletries dont feel local nor do the have any aroma of citrus or tea tree feel like they have been in bottle too long why not just put enough in for the stay and keep it fresh also on sustainability why not put free water in rooms charging 5 for evian how is evian in a sf hotel room sustainable i know fresh water in lobby but that in a small jug in each room would have been a bit of a wow rooms are so comfortable and very clean had pillows changed and a little issue with shower was fixed with no fuss the hotel has such friendly charming staff they cant do enough for you just be honest and polite and they are the same back including those who park the cars was the one chance to blow me away with quality as not likely to be back in the bay area for a number of years but sadly it missed the chance it is an amazing location for quality of its staff match the price but sadly not the quality of the hotel

we stay at the argonaut every year during fleet week in a great location located near fishermans wharf and ghirardelli square the staff is always helpful and attentive we look forward to our next trip to sf and the argonaut

the argonaut was perfect for my husband and i it was our first time in san francisco and the location and atmosphere were great it takes about 10 minutes to walk to pier 39 but its a great walk with bay views its also close to ghirardelli square and there are tons of restaurants right outside the hotel doors well definitely be back one day

this hotel with its great nautical decor is in a perfect location opposite fishermans wharf despite being on the tourist strip it would have been remarkably quiet at night if only the family in the room next to us didnt have their tv blaring all night till 3am when we finally called guest services and asked that they do something about it it required a second call to get anything done and finally it was quiet despite the lack of sleep we would return

beautiful rooms and very welcoming concierge and checkin they also appear to be dogfriendly the hotel is located central to all the essential piers and walking distance from buena vistas renowned irish ciffees

great location near fishermans wharf with a view of golden gate bridge from our window the hotels restaurant the blue mermaid is excellent with good food and very helpful and efficient staff we found reception to be brusque though offering no guidance about the area and no water when we arrived though other guests received bottles from other reception staff water in the room is priced at 8 for a litre bottle also there is no actual living breathing onsite concierge except on one day a week fridays we were told i find that extraordinary for a hotel in this price range

between location value room size and service this was one of family of fives favorite hotel stays in comparison to jw marriott four seasons hotel del coronado and similar hotels we stayed in a one bedroom bay view suite at the end of march even with a king bed queen sofabed and a rollaway we had more than enough space no one was tripping over suitcases or felt like they couldnt move around it was like an ideal first apartment just without a kitchen what we loved besides the space location right between ghiradelli square and fishermans wharf you can walk or take public transportation to all the major tourist or business spots in the city beautiful view of the bay plenty of restaurant options nearby right next to the cable car stop concierge bernadette paula and michael were so knowledgeable and helpful and hooked us up with great ideas and discounts they also arranged our airport transfer for our arrival with five of us plus luggage it was more economical for us to take a private van service they arranged for a go lorries van to meet us 85 total bikes the hotel has 14 total passes per day for two hour complimentary bike rental at blazing saddles just up the hill on hyde street you do need to line up early in the morning to get them but its worth it with the hotels location you can get right on the bike path and ride out to the golden gate bridge lobby the lobby was warm and inviting with a fireplace plenty of seating and table games service everyone we encountered was so helpful and friendly marvin the bellman stood out in particular the only downside about the location is that you get some noise from the bars nearby if youre traveling with small kids who need to get to bed early ask for a room on the hyde street corner the side closer to ghiradelli sq tip for families even though youll want to ride the cable car for the experience take the streetcar around the city for 10 total our family rode all over getting on off several times with free transfers the argonaut was the first of four hotels we stayed at during our trip through california from sf to coronado and by far our favorite of this vacation we would love to come back and highly recommend it

hotel was fine concierge gave terrible recommendations nicest guy but bad advice front desk not so helpful location was great near fishermans wharf room was adequate sized and clean restaurant was fine
hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly great location centrally located to many restaurants ghirardelli square hop on hop off tour bus and cable cars definitely would stay there again

the argonaut hotel is perfectly located for many of the sites within walking distance across the street is the cable car turn around and it is within walking distance to pier 39 and all the shops and restaurants in between bikes are available for guests to use at no charge and it is close enough to the golden gate bridge to ride across the staff especially brook who works in the concierge department could not of been more helpful she was able to pull a rabbit out of the hat and get us tickets for the sold out trip to alcatraz the rooms are clean and roomy we stayed in the standard king and although it was nice when i got a peek in the deluxe king rooms i wished i had spent more and booked one of them nice brick details in the room and it was larger we had breakfast in the hotel restaurant most mornings called the blue mermaid chowder house the food was good and comparable in price to other breakfast places in the area i would definitely stay at the argonaut again on our next trip to san francisco

great location close to fishermans wharf and trolley station staff very friendly and the room was very nice bar and restaurant has a lot of local flavor we totally enjoyed our stay and recommend the argonaut as probably the best place to stay at fishermans wharf

we wanted a quick weekend getaway we chose the argonaut for the location and were pleased with all that it had to offer definitely would stay there again all of the staff that we encountered were super friendly and helpful room service was super accommodating

very much enjoyed our stay in this hotel in great part due to the wonderful view over alcatraz and the bay its location was just perfect for us being at the quieter end of fishermans wharf but within easy walking to restaurants cable cars and the golden gate bridge is only a flat 4 mile walk away we did walk back from union square one day which was fairly flat through china town although this maybe too far for some the rooms were lovely and the staff very helpful wed definitely stay here again be aware this is no longer a kimpton hotel so the free afternoon wine is no longer provided

great hotel on wharf quiet friendly beautiful historically designed building close to cool sites for the whole family schooner museums minigolf trolly ghirardelli chocolates clean quaint hotel with class

this was our second stay and we are so glad we were able to come back special thanks to marc he is just amazing and made our stay something to remember our room was with a bay view and its worth it very interesting watching the street come alive in the morning the room was fantastic super comfortable bed and just the right temperature the bathroom is lovely i took the time to have a bath this stay and it was really nice to be able to sit back and relax we had breakfast at the blue mermaid chowder house bar which was delicious and filling just what we needed with excellent service the front of house staff were all lovely too the hotel location was ideal for us it was easy to get around to the sites we were visiting and is only a short bus ride the f bus from town for shopping again the gym was working well and clean this hotel is just plain amazing and we cant wait to come back again next year

loved staying here the location is fantastic the rooms are very comfortable with all conveniences and the history of the building cant be beat there are lots of surcharges on the bill though these cover the extras like a tour of the historic site bike rental and and andjust make sure you are informed up front

yes this was on my bucket list because it is located in the cannery near fishermans wharf the building is about a century old or so loved the nautical theme we stayed in a inner room which was very quiet the room was spacious and very clean the beds were comfortable also there are robes and a yoga matt it is located in a quieter part of fishermans wharf next to the maritime park the only downside was the windows did not open in our room and i felt the room air was very dry just know the staff does not seem to be able to multi task for example we were in the elevator with the bellhop who let the door shut on us and ignore us because he was so into a conversation with another couple about which entertainers they both knew he did not even push the button for the floor we were all going too also the front desk ignores you when they are on the phone they do not even smile to acknowledge that you are there

the rooms are great youre looking out at the golden gate bridge and alcatraz while being able to walk to fishermans wharf pier 39 buena vista irish coffeehouse the hyde street trolley car turnaround and the blue mermaid restaurant which is really great and on the premises i love going for fleet week 4th of july new years anniversary and my birthday i fully recommend the argonaut youll be back

great location at fishermans wharf with views of the harbour and easy to walk to local restaurants pleasant room attentive staff and convenient onsite restaurant hotel is a converted warehouse so quirky

it is the staff that make this hotel they were really friendly and bent over backwards to help us my husband had a broken ankle and was on crutches the staff could not have done more to make our stay comfortable they upgraded us to an accessible room and also gave us a later check out time so we could prepare for our journey home the doormen were lovely and greeted us like old friends every time we returned to the hotel especially the fantastic donovan who insisted on wheeling my husband all the way to our room while regaling us with some great stories he is a gifted storyteller and a really nice man thank you donovan also a special mention for brooke on the concierge desk for some outstanding restaurant recommendations verbena and amarena nice touches in the hotel including free wifi if you join the kimpton reward scheme and a happy hour with free drinks every day to be fair the hotel decor could do with a bit of an upgrade as it is looking a bit dated and tired now not up to the standard of one of the kimpton hotels we have stayed in in new york however i would recommend this hotel because of the staff also very convenient for boat trips and the powell hyde cable car but bear in mind that fishermans wharf is quite touristy so may not suit everyone as a location

location of this a hotel is excellent rooms are very small but decorated very tastefully our room was in the basement and window was at floor level facing directly into street so not very private we needed to keep shutters closed at all times

we stayed in this hotel because the zoe nee tuscan did not honor our reservation that was made in january 2017 and confirmed two weeks before our arrival it was actually a blessing we really like the argonaut and it is now our go to hotel in san francisco it is very friendly clean and convenient

having made the decision to stay at fishermans wharf on this trip to san francisco we decided to stay at the argonaut based on tripadvisor recommendations we were very happy with our stay great service great room wonderful bed plenty of room close to everything it was perfect for our stay and while not cheap nothing is in san fran we will definitely stay there again

came to san francisco for my daughters august wedding she selected the hotel and i looked it up on the website before visiting im not including any of my photos of the room or lobby because the website very accurately portrays all the details my suggestion is to go to the argonaut hotel site and all the photos will delight you the hotel has exposed brick on the wall in the rooms which makes it very charming and large slat window shutters also very charming the windows from my room gave a nice view of the courtyard around the hotel it was fun to open my 4th story window and look down at the people walking by enjoying san francisco my room was very comfortable i had two queen size beds each night id fall asleep immediately the bed is that comfortable the bathroom is roomy and very clean it has amenities that assure youll want for nothing a hairdryer is hung in a bag by the shower i missed it the first day very subtle the way this hotel places things for the guests use in the closet there is an iron ironing board a safe for valuables and something that came in so handy one day a good sized umbrella downstairs is the blue mermaid restaurant on the morning of the wedding i ordered room service for breakfast i was surprised and pleased at how quickly my order was filled it arrived within 15 minutes and it was delicious my room had a coffeemaker with coffee packets that made hot delicious coffee there is a large comfortable lobby area to sit and relax or wait for familyfriends iced water is available and a fireplace that is very cozy to sit next to every single staff member was genuinely friendly and niceone day i sat for a while in the lobby and they were consistently happy and pleasant to everyone they encountered and although its a very busy hotel there is never a rushed feeling from the staff the doormen are very helpful and so polite in a very welcoming way since this was my daughters wedding i was constantly looking for tissues for my happy tearsand while waiting for the wedding shuttle i had used all of my own the doorman had a box at his station and was so happy to give me some and chat with me to calm me down this hotel has clearly thought of everything a guest might need i recommend this hotel for your san francisco vacation being right on fishermans wharf is a perfect spot food a pleasant park to walk about a trolley stop and shops are nearby i had an excellent time my daughter had suggested i stay an extra couple of days after the wedding to relax and im so glad i did im not a huge tourist sightseeing person and this location allowed me to enjoy san francisco in a quiet way just walking and eating and enjoying my favorite pasttme people watching for those who do enjoy sightseeing this is a perfect hotel to be your base enjoy

we loved our stay from the moment we stepped in the door the history of this building is unbelievable and we were treated wonderfully our room was a bay view suite that was beautiful the exposed brick is the way to go you can see the golden gate bridge from your room as well as alcatraz you are around everything on fishermans wharf so fun

we had an awesome experience at the argonaut hotel i cant think of one negative aspect of our four day visit therewould love to return to not only san francisco but also the argonaut if possible book a room with the view of alcatraz you would not regret that decision

we stayed there over four nights in august and really enjoyed the hotel the two beds in our room were very comfortable and still left us with plenty of room to move around the decor was pleasant and fun it was reasonably quiet considering the area it is very centrally located and there is going to be a certain amount of chaos going on outside arrange for a higher floor if you can the attached restaurant and patio is very nice and we ate there twice on check in you will be given a 10 credit for the restaurantbar which is a nice touch they have a bike rental for free as well i believe staff were pleasant and accommodating

while san francisco is deteriorating by the minute this hotel is an oasis ky was our front desk manager he was instrumental in our trip being a success the hotel is beautifully appointed and kid friendly but with adult options everywhere the room service is fast put your sign out before 2am and it will arrive when you asked ky showed my son the treasure box which was such a treat as we checked out he also helped tremendously with our room the food at the blue mermaid is fantastic and the hotel gives you a 10 per night credit you must charge to the room and it does not work with room service the views of hyde park and ghiradelli square are fantastic ask for the hyde park room view the powell hyde turn around is literally next door get there by 8am and there are no lines the famous ghiradelli chocolate factory is up one block there are three incredible ships to tour 15 for adults free for kids under 15 right across the street the old fashioned trolley lines are two blocks down on a budget go to in out burger a half a block away lombard street up 5 blocks the pier and all it has to offer is right down the street you simply cant go wrong with this hotel its the third time ive stayed there safe convenient quiet and expensive and worth it ky thank you

i love that this hotel is close to everywhere i want to be ghiradelli square cable cars go cart rentals fishermans wharf pier 39 are all walking distance i love the exposed brick in the rooms it was built on the site of the old historic cannery the bluemermaid restaurant has the best crab corn chowder you must have a bowl the staff has always been superior the rooms clean im a clean freak and quiet my fave is the king suite with the jacuzzi bath tub because after walking all day youll need it im not a wine drinker but there is a wine and cheese hour every evening some rooms have a view of alcatraz and the golden gate bridge

fabulous location clean and neat hotel i would stay here again beware of extra charges resort fee and 85 for parking with parking tax instead of feeling like they nickel and dime you i wish the extra charges were included in the nightly rate as a total

we received great rates and an upgrade for what i still consider some of the best designed hotels in the west they are not pseudo luxury but good quality fun and the attention to detail is still great i love the overthetop nautical themed decor the building itself is in a refurbished historical building and alone it is a satisfying place to be with exposed brick and old beams the warf location is still a bit tacky and not to my taste but it is near the water walkable to the park and other points if interest i think this area is slowly changing for the better easy access for jogging along the water front and close to a trolly pick up spot the bed was comfy and the location is quiet the shower is not amazing but i rarely find amazing bathroom in cities without paying a premium price it was clean and nice enough though we received a ten dollar voucher for the restaurantabout equal to 34 of one persons breakfast all in all a really solid choice for the city

we decided to spend our anniversary in san francisco so why not try the argonaut hotel first time here and most certainly not the last great service fantastic rooms with comfortable decor and very spacious we only stayed one night due to our schedules but that didnt matter well worth it highly encourage this hotel as its close to everything and if you want to get to the piers hop on the trolly just one block away and your there in 5 min

spent 4 days 3 nights in this modern well furnished hotel situated along the north shore it is located in the tourist belt with many shops and eateries the rooms were modern clean and had two large queen beds the staff were kind to give my family of 6 adjoining rooms although they were the furthest from the lift lobby they were also next to the street behind the hotel and often we would here people talking and cars zooming by in the middle of the night the toilet was large and fitted with modern toiletries the shower was powerful and provided a nice hot shower which was nice when coming in from the cold winter the only but significant shortfall was the lack or parking facilities a valet service was available at us60 day i managed to get round this by parking at the street side lots for free but this takes good timing and a bit of effort to find a lot near the hotel so unless you have to dont drive to this hotel

there is something special when i entered the argonaut the fireplace is roaring the tree is lit and the staff goes above and beyond to make sure you stay is wonderful our room overlooked alcatraz and the restaurant offers a wide variety of food and drink even for a vegetarian like me the location is perfect right across from the docks or a hike up to lombard street will get your blood moving plenty of places in the area to eat shop or enjoy the sites it feels a bit like home now when we visit

first class staysecond time staying there always in great condition hotel is wonderful clean and in a great location they even sent me a birthday surpriseeasy in and out if you have a car but you will be charge for parking

after a long flight from the uk the argonaut hotel is exactly what was required the staff are courteous the rooms spacious and well appointed most importantly the beds are super comfortable aside from that the location is ideal for fishermans wharf trips to alcatraz ghiradelli square and the start for a bike ride across the golden gate bride to sausalito i would highly recommend this hotel

excellent experience location was perfect providing easy access to fishermans wharf cable car ghirardelli square cruise boats room was beautifully decorated and very quiet providing a very nice few days oh yeah even the weather cooperated sunny 70s

we booked trip at argonaut hotel the pictures online look better than the real thing carpets were dirty noisy in halls we called for room service at 8pm and was transferred to front desk front deck told us in room dining would call back never did we ended up going out and looking for restaurant that night we were very disappointed overall took advice from doorman about eating at another local place for breakfast ended up getting sick from omlette we will not be staying at argonaut again room was small they had some lounge type chair by window not enough room for it
service location room with a view food happy hour overall ambiencestaff from doorman to checkin concierge housekeeping bartender chris bellmanall professional friendly and focused on customer service

we stayed here for 3 nights in june the room was large with a huge comfy bed and a chaise longue nice bathroom iron ironing board coffee machine what did make us laugh was the leopard print robes in the wardrobe only in san fransisco the hotel was in a great location on fishermans wharf the tram cable car terminus is right next to the hotel which was great as we got there early one morning before the crowds arrived there is a good bike hire shop a few doors away too which is ideal if you want to cycle across the golden gate bridge which we did the hotel has a happy hour every day between 56pm with free yes free drinks sangria white or red wine or beer so we took full advantage of that before going out as san fran being a city is not cheap to drink we enjoyed our stay here wouldnt hesitate to stay here again

recently stayed at the argonaut for four nights we found everything that has been stated in previous reviews are correct it is right at the golden gate end of fishermans wharf the tram terminus is right outside so handy to catch one of the old cable cars as is the buena vista cafe old and with loads of character and good for breakfasts lunch or dinner as for the argonaut itself it is an old canning factory and has kept all its character all staff from reception to concierge doormen to barwaitress staff are friendly helpful and simply good a special mention for donovan on the door great character we walked into the city centre probably took about 50 minutes but easy to do but being san francisco its hilly but the best way to explore the streets if we went back to sf it would be the argonaut every time

this marks my second stay here thats right second stay in 4 months at the one hotel in san francisco is it a cheap hotel not in the least bit is it worth every dollar you have spent on it you bet no other hotel compares to the friendliness of the staff special shoutout to marilyn and mari carmen on the front desk and matt the concierge who were three of the happiest bubbliest chill professional and friendly people i have ever come across in my life the dancing and singing in the lobby the chicness of the bar the nautical theme what a way to hotel spotlessly clean beautiful views of alcatraz and they upgraded my cheap as chips hotwire booking to a gorgeous 4th floor room which was gigantic and the view was incredible i didnt want to set foot outside thank you again to the triple m threat you have made my year and i will be making this the only hotel i stay at and recommend to my fellow aussie travellers worth every frickin penny close to everything a stones throw from ghirardelli square and the tram stops you cannot do better position wise

great hotel lovely rooms with loads of character and the staff were so helpful we arrived late and when i gave our name they said theyd been wondering when wed be turning up nice touch a fab location first visit but hopefully not the last

stayed for 8 days with no issues the staff are friendly and well trained the location is excellent as there is a blend of locals and tourists in the area creating a nice vibe great restaurant attached and lots of options close by everything feels like its in walking distance the interior design of the rooms is excellent and very welcoming very clean and up to date great team great environment

we spent three nights at the argonaut our first experience in san francisco great location on fishermans wharf easy walking distance to attractions building is a renovated warehouse owned by the national parks a lot of character the room was a nice size clean and well appointed the staff was very friendly and helpful really enjoyed our stay alcatraz is a must visit the cable car is a block from the hotel visit the cable car museum muir woods is awe inspiring

love the location of the hotel strategically located by the end of fisherman wharf west side within walking distance to pier 39 and famous restaurants like gary danko scoma buena vista cafe the room itself is decent spacious living room and a huge bathroom there is also a free happy hour from 56pm where they serve free wine beer at the lobby cons there is no hook near the shower to hang your towel hate the ac whenever it kicks on i can hardly hear the tv if you are in the living room pillows are flatlike 180 degrees flat there are many other hotels around this area im not sure if i will stay here the next time i am back

hotel is beautiful staff over the top everyone friendly food decent right around the corner from everything 10 minutes to wharf on foot theresa at conciererge was very helpful and gave us great tips on where to go
plus location and very helpful stuff minus horrible showers when i serve in the army my shower conditions was better we also have problem with air condition and toilet not good enough for the value

the place was clean spacious and near water it was a very relaxing experience its not too easy to get to the place by public transportation but bay wheels bikes worked well you can take polk st which has a separated bike lane for most of the way from the downtown area

we loved this location close to everything and restaurants nearby were fabulous room was a great layout and had plenty of room bed very comfortable food in restaurant for breakfast was good appreciate being treated so well

this hotel was our first stop in a 3 week road trip around the west coast of america and we were couldnt have been more pleased with the location being on fishermans warth we were only a short walk away from pier 39 alcatraz ferry departures lombard street and some fantastic restaurants once the morning fog cleared you got a nice view of alcatraz and there was a small beach not far away for a nice morning stroll the room itself was spacious for the 4 of us with two large double beds which were suitable for me and my brother to share one without arguing at all friendly staff willing to help and point in the right direction and offering recommendations for areas to eat in future i would look to stay again because of its wonderful location and comfy rooms

i booked the hotel for a holiday for my wifes 40th birthday having read the reviews and it more than matched expectations the staff could not be faulted and were friendly helpful and very welcoming the room was far more spacious than i had imagined it might be and it was exactly as per their website although the tiger and zebra print dressing gowns were a bizarre but hilarious addition location wise it was perfect whilst on fishermans wharf it wasnt in the midst of the main area so fairly quiet and with it being fleet week we had a great spot to see the air displays it was also right next to the hydepowell cable car turnaround although queue early as it takes a while to board and only a 510mins walk to masonpowell cable car turnaround which is slightly quieter and easier to board because it is right at the foot of hyde and near the hyde cable car turnaround it features on a fair few pictures and guide book covers also if you want to visit alcatrez its only a 10minute walk to the departure pier and 5 mins walk to boudin bakery and pier 39 while the view from our room was a courtyard it didnt really effect our experience and was very quiet the staff aware we were staying for a birthday left a bottle of champagne in our room upon arrival which was a fantastic touch free wifi which was very fast and reliable was also a benefit

stayed here 5 nights great location for all things near fishermans wharf hotel is pricey but location is perfect concierge services were also excellent hotel restaurant is also quite good would stay here again

the argonaut hotel is one of those small boutique hotels that truly delivers the staff is incredibly accommodating and friendly the main lobby is inviting and a great place to chill while waiting for a lyft or dinner reservation as a family of four we were incredibly comfortable in our 4person 2queen bed room with a cool view of the trolley car turn station and the golden gate bridge we stayed from christmas until new years eve steps away from lots of tourist spots we loved the walkability of this location highly recommend for couples or families

four star good location close by the piers within walking distance to eateries along the strip street cars run frequent stops to downtown union square for shopping november is the best time for visit with more deals and tranquillity

room was very large even with 2 queen beds great location and good restaurant with outdoor seating all of the staff members that we engaged with were super friendly and helpful i would definitely consider this hotel on my next trip

excellent service tenzien was the bestbeautiful property cleaning service was great food and service was great in restaurantgreat location took cable car to cable car museum and spent time in presidio checked out museum in lobby great location

charming san francisco vibe hotel in walking distance to everything at the wharf great customer service and great food will stay again when we go to sf beds were comfortable great view of alcatraz from our window and great restaurant attached highly recommend

from start to finish chose to stay here due to a great deal as we usually do not stay at the wharf great priceor was it easy reservation wonderful service at the get go bell man john was a great guy and took good care of us car was parked 80 a night pretty usual for the city but that is still pretty steep even for sf check in a breeze our dog was welcomed and even had his name on the board as a vip guest they truly doted over him beautiful property at the end of the wharf in the old cannery building it was nice to have the grassy area below ghirardelli square and above the aquatic club to walk the dog during togo times our room was very small but well appropriated clean full sized bath tub and nice linens no view only a wall we had the loudest air conditioner ever we would have turned it off but there was not a window to open and it was very stuffy without air now back to the price which also included sf lodging taxes entertainment fees and of course the dog depositwe managed to rack up an 850 bill for our two nights in a very small room now to add to this every area of sf was wide open in the evening except the wharf everything including the hotel restaurant and the buena vista across the way was shut down promptly at nine every other district told us the curfew hours were liftedsono clue so much for a night cap

the hotel is very nice historical building was restyled keeping some element of the old building the living room is very beautiful the room is spacious with beautiful furniture the hotel is clean silent the personnel very nice and gentle the position is strategical negative thing parking cost 75 usd a day but everywhere is the same however with a bit of patience outside can be managed using the meeter with almost 28 usd a day the restaurant marmaid offers a large menu and for breakfast also they made lots of stuff and amazing cappuccino the hotel offer a daily coupon of 10 usd to be used to the restaurant weather for breakfast or lunch or dinner we highly recommend this place

had a great stay and would absolutely recommend this place based on location the rooms are a little tight but the view and location are totally worth it lots of things in walking distance and being able to walk out in the morning to see and hear the bay was amazing

had a great stay at the argonaut the staff were very helpful with queries about the area the location of the hotel is perfect rooms were spotless i would stay here again when coming back to san francisco

we booked this hotel based on trip adviser reviews they proved to be very accurate the hotel is centrally placed on fishermans wharf next to the cable car terminal and ideally placed for all forms of public transport the rooms are well themed spacious and clean there is free wifi with good bandwidth the staff are very friendly and attentive happy hour each work day between 5 and 6 pm provided for cheap drinks and 1 oysters food is of good quality and reasonably priced this is where well stay next time were in town

wonderful hotel located in the perfect location to explore san franciscos north shore fishermans wharf pier 39 ghirardelli square hyde st trolley and alcatraz small hotel that is a converted 1800s cannery with exposed wood beams and original brick walls in their rooms would highly recommend getting a room with a view of the harbor with their corner suites having great views of the golden gate bridge and alcatraz limited amenities but on site restaurant and bar but with so many restaurantsbars within walking distance this posed little downside for us

spent a few nights in this hotel at the beginning of may we had a room on the 3rd floor facing the bay and alcatraz island the hotel is very well located if you wish to visit fishermans wharf alcatraz lombard street and the ferry building the house used in the filming of mrs doubtfire is also not very far away in steiner street if the silver screen holds your interest there are many other movie locations not far away also the hyde street cable car terminal which gets you downtownis just around the corner from the hotel as are some fine restaurants for breakfast the hotel internally is well appointed with a nautical theme throughout the rooms are spacious bed is comfortable and everything works but it is difficult to see how the rate even booked through expedia can be fully justified with little luxury or whoa factor on show presumably it just comes down to the location as there very little else other than a sheratonin the immediate area so if you are visiting the areas above the argonaut has to be your choice if not i wouldnt be rushing to make a booking

weve been to san fran many times over the years and the argonaut is by far the nicest most comfortable and convenient place weve stayed the nautical theme decor was delightful the room was spotlessly clean and all the staff we interacted with were terrific highly recommended

we really enjoyed our time at the argonaut the location is perfect with its breathtaking views the hotel is clean and comfortable their staff is what made it spectacular we are not fancy or wealthy but their staff made us feel like vip guests

the nautical theme throughout the hotel is fun and pleasing to the eye off of the luxurios lobby is a hall type room with pictures and interesting information of the history of the building in which the argonaut is in right across the street is the bay and just up the street in walking distance is pier 39 and the sf aquarium the staff are very friendly and knowledgable about the area and current events

the argonaut hotel is a rustic form of elegance in the frame of the old cannery area the noble house people have created a truly elegant and beautiful hotel experience the rooms are spacious and well appointed the staff is caring and attentive to every detail room service is exceptional only parking is an expensive hassle but we have learned how to travel san fran without renting a car walk a lot uber some public transportation and stay at the argonaut

we loved the location right at fishermans wharf the cable car turn around is across the street many cool restaurants within walking distance good restaurant downstairs we were pleased the service was excellent and the rooms were clean

this hotel was lovely and very well managed they accommodated our early checkin to make our visit to san francisco enjoyable we enjoyed the easy of walking to local restaurants wharf amenities and the alcatraz ferry

had a wonderful stay and would definitely recommend to family and friends the location cannot be beat the restaurant was very good the concierges were most helpful the guys out front are an asset as they are so welcoming and helpful
excelent hotel acomodations locations i recomend u to rent a bike and enjoy san francisco also the restaurante of the hotel was really good ruben and marcus were really kind i hope u enjoy as us

stayed with my family for 2 nights in november 2021 rooms were comfortable my really late checkin was smooth the bellboy offered complimentary new masks hotel offers parking breakfast was nice convenient location at fishermans wharf a stones throw from ghirardelli square a cable car station bike rentals the cannery mall and various car rental companies would recommend this for families who want to be close to the wharf area or want to enjoy a beautiful golden gate view without breaking the bank

we arrived dropped our luggage and rushed off to make a planned visit to alcatraz but on return to check in our baggage was missing after some advice and suggestions from us they found the luggage and offered us compensation after some negotiation which was fine having stayed at a noble house resort in key west our expectations were high but fell short of the same experience hotel is good but nothing special to match the high price for half the price you can go one or two blocks back to other chain hotels which i am sure would be more or less the same as the argonaut the bar shuts early last orders at 10 and terrace heating switched off then also which was not too great for 2 couples on vacation parking expensive with a car park one block back half the price overall disappointed with value for money as there was nothing special about the service or hotel

spacious rooms thoughtful and attentive staff the location is superb especially for explorers the maritime museum is directly adjacent hyde street pier is right across the street as is the cable car and ghirardelli square be sure to try the blue mermaid restaurant on site the service is friendly and allpro the food is fresh and delicious it is one of the most pleasant and convenient hotel stays for sightseeing in sf the lobby is inviting and particularly wellsuited to hanging out on a classic sf foggy day as the fireplace is cozy there are a number of games available to check out at the front desk and if you have kids be sure to ask about the wellthought out scavenger hunt prize at the end if you want everything at your fingertips and a comfortable stay while in sfthis is your place

thoroughly enjoyed this hotel we had a room overlooking the bay great views all staff within the hotel were amazing room lovely and clean bed was very comfortable recommend bay views room was quiet considering how busy it is outside pillows were good too

great location excellent service and very clean walking distance to pier 39 ghirdelli shops and restaurants its my 2nd time and we really enjoyed our stay will surely come back again highly recommended

i was supposed to meet a friend in san fran but it fell through so i was solo for a week but had a great time friendly staff and people great bars and restaurants in and around the wharf perfect location for experiencing the city i really enjoyed my stay

do not got to the restaurant of the hotel service is not good and choice limited fitness center clean decoration of hotel rooms lobby is nice location is perfect to visit most of the city easy to take the cable car nearby

the argonaut is great for a tourist trip to sf many areas within walking distance the rooms are regular size set up similar to most standard hotels long and narrow not a true boutique hotel more of a themed family hotel hotel seems to be on the senior motor coach route i was expecting a more polished boutique all that said service was good and room was clean

we spent 4 nights at the argonaut apart from a good 15 minute wait to check in everything was pleasant about our stay nice large comfortable room that was very quite we were at the back of the hotel there is a coffee machine in the room but being english we like a cup of tea when we wake up no problem dial down and the bring you a pot of hot water no charge breakfast in the blue mermaid was very substantial you didnt need lunch the location was about a 10 minute walk from pier 39 and about 15 to 20 minutes from the pier that goes to alcatraz a couple of streets away was the first stop for the hop on and hop off city bus tours

i only stayed for one night but i wish i could have stayed longer location is perfect walking distance to fishermans wharf pier 39 and ghirardelli square also right next to trolley stop so you can get around the whole city hotel is very cute and modern inside decorated like a nautical ship theme throughout staff was very friendly and welcoming

loved this hotel from the location the decoration the comfy bed to the great food in its connecting restaurant lovely friendly staff especially the concierge who book just about everything for you this hotel is really up to date even having usb ports in the bedrooms instead of you taking loads of adapters brilliant

we wanted to stay close to fishermans wharf and this was the ideal location we upgraded to a bay view room and everything was great downsides would be a room on the park side of the hotel through a weekend revelers enjoyed the bars well into early morning 3am hours so sleep was interrupted the only other thing was during our stay the bar and restaurant were closed for renovations but with plenty of choices in the area this wasnt a problem

this hotel is located in an excellent location for exploring the fishermans wharf area with pier 39 roughly minutes leisurely walk away lombard street is a 15 minute very steep walk away we stayed during fleet week so the whole area including the hotel was very busy but this didnt phase the staff at all rooms are large and spacious and like the rest of the hotel of a nautical theme beds are comfortable and surprisingly high of the ground no sensor mini bar and fridge which makes a nice change fridge even has enough space to keep your own food and drink in it the restaurant attached to hotel also serves some really good food as well as showing sports only negative is there is only two lifts which can result in fairly long waits when busy even though there are only 4 floors in nutshell we had a great stay and would happily stay again

a stylish interior with a rustic bar restaurant which was comfortable and relaxing the rooms were huge and bed very comfortable the staff were very friendly and niothing to much the hotel is situated in a superb position to pier 39 a must stay say hello to the front of desk people and the bell boys treated us like royalty

pleasant hotel and nice restaurant my hair syler went missing from room and staff more or less took no actionthis was a disappointing responsespacious rooms and well equipped good quality room and well serviced

i have so many wonderful things to say about the argonaut i stayed at this hotel for 6 nights on business and i went away with a truly positive experience years back i saw the argonaut while on another trip to san francisco and i always wanted to stay there something about it just caught my eye so when i saw that it had a rate my employer would cover on my recent business trip i was ready i tell this tale because i went to the argonaut with high hopes and they did not let me down i was not in an upgraded room with a view but my room was terrific it was meticulously clean wellappointed and very comfortable my king sized bed offered me a great sleep the only downer is that the walls did seem a bit thin and i could hear the neighbors if it was totally silent fortunately for me i need to sleep with a fan or white noise of some type so it was no issue the staff was also really friendly and accommodating i wish i could remember everyone that impressed me but i remember john frank matthew and peter as providing excellent service best of all you cannot beat this location fishermans wharf is a wonderful location for tourists and it was just across the street from a beautiful public park the terminus of one of the cable car lines and ghirardelli square there was a huge selection of restaurants nearby a starbucks around the corner but you do have a coffee maker in your room and there were several bus lines within easy walking distance to get all around the city i have stayed in a lot of locations in san francisco but this was hands down my favorite

this place is a great place the location is so convenient right at fishermans wharf you just walk up the hill to the end of the trolley line you are also just a few blocks from ghiradelli square the staff was so efficient and the space in our room was so comfortable we were on the fourth floor with a nice view of the park beside us even though you are in a really busy part of the city i feel like our room was pretty quiet we did hear the bridge horn some in the night check in and check out was so smooth would definitely stay there again

the hotel has a very nice feel with it being in an old building the staff are warm and helpful and the doorman greeting you everyday was a nice thing to start the day off with the location is brilliant as it is just around the corner from a cable car main station uber drivers find the location with ease beds were very very comfortable and thats coming from a picky person food wasnt the best and so we ate out every night bar one overall its a great place to stay when youre visiting san francisco

kudos to the argonaut and its entire staff we stayed here on a two day whirlwind tour of san francisco with our daughter who arranged the trip the hotel is located on jefferson street and is conveniently located to fishermans wharf it is easy walking distance to pier 39 the alcatraz ferry ghirardelli square cable car terminus not to mention the many restaurants and shops the argonaut is a nautical themed hotel with a bar restaurant comfy rooms and a complimentary happy hour from 46 for registered guests during weekdays our room had a small window that looked out to a park and the bath very acceptable we would recommend this hotel and stay again the valet parking fee was high at 50 plus tax for each night thus the reason for the 4 star

we loved this hotel room was the smallest we had stayed in during our trip around california but the is quiet and comfortable loved all the decor and steven the bellhop gave us an unforgettable welcome we didnt particularly like fishermans wharf too commercial but it is vey handy for alcatraz and getting the trolleys and bike tours

this is how strongly i feel i need to review this hotel im not even home im the passenger in the car driving on the motorway back to birmingham but need to express how absolutely stunning and special this hotel is right from the moment you enter the hotel you are made to feel like royalty staff are polite and knowledgeable the room was another level huge bed and im so glad i choose to book the bay view king room as our view was over hyde pier and alcatraz as this was a special trip for my boyfriends 30th i did send a quick email to the hotel asking for a fab view only if possible and my god did they deliver not only that we also revived a hand written note and a bottle of wine for his birthday what fabulous service the location was perfect close enough that everything was within a 510min walk 5min pier 39 10min pier 33 for alcatraz pick up the shops were delightful tram station was half a block away and the hop on hop off bus was also 1 block away we did the 3 day your including muir woods must do day trip also a couple of doors down from the hotel is bike rental which was lovely we went along the marina sandy beach and to the golden gate bridge i have no doubt in my mind that we will return to san francisco and would stay no where else but at the argonaut

if your travel goals include being treated like royalty book a stay at the argonaut hotel from the moment of arrival to the sad moment of departure you will feel beyond special waking up every day to a water view which included alcatraz the bay and the bay bridge really connected me to the city plus a sailboat regatta of over 100 boats on a saturday morning is hard to beat

this was our second visit to san francisco and we chose this hotel because of its location and views we werent disappointed hotel was very clean and the room was spacious and very comfortable very nice roomy lounge area by reception restaurant offer was a bit limited but there are many others to choose from so this wasnt a problem one of us was glutenfree so can highly recommend the beach street grill for a great breakfast just a short walk away

the argonaut is located in fishermans wharf but away from the busier tourist area the room was very clean comfortable and nicely decorated the hotel is conveniently located we will definitely stay here again when traveling to san francisco

i stayed here in september 2015 whilst i liked the exterior of the hotel and the entrance arealounge i felt it was very expensive for the room standard the standard rooms overlook not sure that is the right word straight onto the rooms opposite an interior inaccessible courtyard it was kind of like a square prison and if you didnt position the window blinds at the right angle you can see straight into the rooms opposite that said the room was nice and comfortable and clean and i liked the leopard print bathrobes we were in a room which was next to an electrical cupboard of some sort and this made quite a dinit didnt bother us too much but may bother some people we liked the location and the staff were very nice but im not sure id stay here again

we enjoyed our stay at the argonaut the staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms clean and quiet the bed was comfortable but the chairslounge not so much the location was perfect walking distance from fishermans wharf for the money ti was a bit pricy

this is a nice hotel in a great location the room is at small by american standards very long and narrow i guess this is a function of the conversion of an existing building but nicely decorated and mine did have a view of the bridge i feel it is overpriced and very much trading on the location the soundproofing is ok you can hear other people

we spent a long weekend in san francisco and from prior stays in the area we knew we wanted to stay here and we were not disappointed two staff members that truly understand service are troy and donovan what a pleasure to be welcomed to the hotel by these gentlemen our room was not ready when we arrived did not expect it to be since we got there off an early flight into sfothey stored our bags and helped us rent bikes from the firm down the street the hotel itself is quite nice and the location is central to everything in the area we would stay here again

just spent a great few days at this hotel rooms were lovely bed huge comfy staff friendly helpful the blue mermaid restaurant bar was great for food drinks in the evening especially after a day of walking would definitely recommend it

stayed there during the rsa conference its far away from the moscone center but you are at the terminus of the cable car sole problem of cable car is departure is a bit random the hotel itself is really beautiful rooms are very large went for the king deluxe bed was perfect and i really loved the deco when you enter the room a nice welcome pack will be waiting for you it does give a nice feeling considering that i was in center most of the day i didnt had much chance to try the breakfast buffet so i cant review it but for the rest all was perfect

we were looking for a hotel that was well placed to enjoy san francisco without renting a car and wanted something fairly nice as we were staying several days this location was amazing in between ghirardelli square and the wharf on a safe fun corner right beside the end of the cable car route the staff were all extremely friendly and helpful both before our trip communicating with me via email as we planned the trip and while we were staying there the room wasnt huge but given the location it was roomier than i expected and the decor was clean fun maritime themed and the whole facility was welcoming and pleasant highly recommend

we are staying here at the moment and must say its a lovely hotel the staff are really friendly and helpful and the room is fantastic very clean a good size and well maintained the room is serviced daily if requested would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in san francisco fisherman wharf area

this hotel located in the fishermans wharf is nicely decorated reminding of ships and nautical experiences this goes from the lobby all the way to your room the staff is very friendly and do make good suggestions the attached restaurant also has a lot to offer with respect to seafood and chowders walking in the surroundings makes you feel like the european and american styles do converge in that area

the best thing about this hotel is the location down by the water within minutes you have a view of the golden gate bridge access to the cable cars or fishermans wharf and lots of amenities nice theming throughout the whole of the hotel with the nautical touches and we were always warmly welcomed through the door didnt rate it 5 stars as in our room there was usually lots of corridor noise the lighting in the room wasnt great on an evening just lots of lamps that you have to go round turning onoff and i didnt find it to be all that particularly comfortable overall we had a great stay and so dont take my review too negatively but to say what we had paid and the added value which is charged for plus the 100 per night holding charge all these things put a little less shine on the stay here

your facility is outstanding your staff is very friendly and well trained in hospitality we vey much appreciated you holding our bags saturday afternoon after we checked out while we were waiting to catch the red eye at the airport

excellent property cant say enough service was flawless and the beds are amazing i had such a great experience with the staff very helpful and great recommendations i will be telling everyone i know about this place

absolutely loved that this hotel is a building with history and has been restored with this in mind staff very friendly and welcoming room was actually like the pictures very clean and comfortable facilities good main thing for us was the location as couldnt have been any better on a corner with cable cars bike hire and historical chocolate shop in one direction historical dock and beach area in the other fishamens wharf just down the road and if you are prepared to walk for a while can easliy do things like chinatown lombard street and the other docks

best hotel by the water and friendly staff great dining experience at blue mermaid restaurant kids friendly hotel with lobby activities and gamesblue mermaid restaurant has an outstanding patio and seating

my husband and i stayed here on our visit to san francisco we were greeted warmly by the bellhop when we first arrived checkin was a breeze and our room was ready early located at fishermans wharf and a block from ghirardelli square

stayed at the hotel just before fleet week so it was very busy we were upgraded which was nice and the room was very comfortable with a street view we had asked for a quiet room but there was a constant fan noise in the room all night after we turned the air con off which we complained about we were told that it was the same in most of the other rooms nearby and after looking at moving to a smaller room we decided to put up with it however what surprised me is that the receptionist never asked if we managed to sleep etc not great customer service if you are staying there avoid room 306 or take ear plugs on a positive the hotel was well maintained and the staff were pleasant especially chloe who despite loosing her voice was very helpful

the argonaut hotel is at fishermans wharf next door to the cable car terminus the restaurants and shops are right outside the door our room overlooked the golden gate bridge and the cable car turnaround our room was very comfortable and large we enjoyed the wine bar downstairs and the blue mermaid bar the staff at reception are helpful and welcoming a great memorable stay

stayed here for four nights in early july 24 to celebrate my sons birthday and 4th july fishermans wharf is a great place to explore lots of shops ranging from touristy to decent goods there are also some excellent restaurants such as fog harbor the hotel was in a great central location and you could walk to many places from here we walked to the golden gate bridge a little over 35 miles which was tough going as it was a hot day but a lovely walk nonetheless the rooms are comfy and spacious facilities like the bar and fitness room are pretty good too food and drink prices are a bit on the high side but its decent quality all in all a very good stay

we stay here every anniversary and have a great tome love the location i would say you should stay here they do make you feel special and that you do matter the only thing is they should smile when they answer the phone but in person they are terrific they always do a special touch for us when we go every time so i so appreciate it

the room was huge clean and comfortable the bathrobes provided were fabulous i ordered one as a gift after i got home the location is perfect steps away from many attractions on fishermans wharf across the street from the cable cars close to lots of things the staff is very helpful and friendly

what a gem located in the fishermans warf area of san francisco it is close enough to be close to the touristy ward but far enough to be peaceful and relaxing we stayed here during the fleet week which we had never heard about when we were making reservations in early october the front desk staff concierge are awesome so helpful and really went the extra mile to make sure we had a great trip all of the employees seemed to really like their coworkers and enjoy their jobs and it really shows and made a difference we stayed in a deluxe king room i was disappointed because the bayview rooms were sold out but was pleasantly surprised to find that after checking if any bayview rooms had come available during checkin my deluxe nonbay view room had a small view of the bay it was obstructed but i still got that view i was looking for the room was an average size and very clean bathrooms were very well equipped love the bigelow toiletries beds were comfy and came with a variety of pillows which i really appreciated lots of cool extras like yoga mats in the room and animalprint robes i wont lie the reason why i chose this hotel over a couple of others in the warf was it offered complimentary wine beer every night in the lobby judge me i dont care this is san francisco and everything is expensive the lobby was slightly cramped it was packed but everyone seemed to really be enjoying themselves and letting loose a little bit what a great way to meet other travelers i also thought it was pretty neat that no one was on their phones during the wine tastings for a society that is so plugged in it was nice seeing everyone interacting with people right in front of them not a screen we met some really interesting people this way and appreciated the lady serving the wine and her knowledge of the area this hotel loves pets it was cool seeing so many dogs in the hotel i didnt travel with my animals but from my understanding this is free the restaurant the blue mermaid has awesome clam chowder also get the mrs doubtfire recommended by my server its a delightful cocktail last but not least be sure to join the kimpton karma rewards program before you book your room this allows you to get free wifi for your entire stay as well as a free 10 bar credit or 10 minibar credit at all of their hotels for every stay although the hotel isnt centrally located in san fran i love the location it is very close to the powellhyde cable car and is in the quieter section of the fishermans warf also very close to ghiradelli square

i stayed for 3 nights and the property met all expectations it is a high quality property with clean rooms and great service i would stay here again but be mindful that if you are going for business you will have to budget at least 15mins to get to the financial district or union square

great room really nice hotel botique type great location facing the ocean next door to cable car roundtable well located for sightseeing view of the golden gate shopping great restaurants in walking distance close to giardelli chocolate store

i have stayed here a total of 4 times and loved each and every stay the rooms are clean fresh sheets close to everything lovely and helpful staff the building itself is full of history and the museum near the front loby is amazing if your into maritime history i loved it worth the price

i do not know why you charge an extra after i paid you all through expedia people at the front desk told me that with the extra payment they make me i can use bicecles but i do not like that also a motor bike but they anly had four and they were busy

from the moment we walked through the doors we felt welcome the staff was professional and the property was top notch in quality and value you truly cant beat the location just steps from ghirardelli square and fishermans wharf its a great option if you dont want to have to rent a car highly recommend

best location in sf in my opinion room was spacious with everything you need right on fishermans wharf a five minute walk to the end of the cable car line and within walking distance to pier 39 and pier 33 alcatraz the only reason this review is not getting five stars is the lack of a bar if you want a drink in the hotel you sit at the bar of the adjoining restaurant other than that a big thumbs up

we stayed here for our last night in the city the room is spacious and very comfortable the staff is exceptional and always willing to please it was pouring down with rain and they gave us an umbrella to use while walking around they have a nice little happy hour each evening and at christmastime it was beautifully decorated the front desk and valet staff went out of their way to address all our needs its always a treat to stay here and they have the coolest robes to wear

i spent 2 nights at the argonaut hotel at fishermans wharf in san francisco its an excellent hotel with en excellent very nice staff at a location which is hard to beat it has an excellent restaurant the mermaid the rooms are clean and the whole atmosphere is very nice i will come again

this hotel is amazing and in a wonderful location on fishermans wharf from the moment you are greeted at the front door to the time you check out all the staff are so friendly helpful and eager to ensure your stay is enjoyable the rooms are well appointed and furnished with all the amenities needed they also have a wine happy hour for guests where you can enjoy a complimentary glass of wine and mingle with other guests it is also a pet friendly hotel which i loved having left my pets in australia i was able to pat the occasional well behaved pooch

we just returned from a week long trip to san francisco we were fortunate to stay at two excellent hotels one of which was the argonaut there is much to like about this hotel its grand appearance the top flight staff the spacious rooms the fantastic lively lobby and helpful concierge and desk staff really great location if you want to take explore the golden gate bridge via bicycle its a short ride they also have urbe scooters for guests to use my kids loved tooling around the neighborhood on them the desk staff was also nice enough to hang onto our bags for an entire day after we checked out plus they let us hang around the lobby until our uber arrived both gestures were above what many hotels can muster rooms are a bit pricey but they are very wellappointed and super clean the only thing we didnt like has nothing to do with the hotel specifically but we stayed in the union square neighborhood for three days prior to our move down to the argonaut and found that neighborhood much more to our liking than fishermans wharf which is very kitschytacky beautiful harbor views from the argonaut alleviate the kitsch somewhat but venturing out can be a challenge despite that we would stay here again in a heartbeat well done to all at the argonaut

hotel is great for the location and being able to walk to the areas surrounding the hotel fishermans wharf pier 39 etc stay is comfortable and rooms are immaculate staff is friendly and willing to help with anything you need in my opinion valet and parking were a little expensive but i understand parking is at a minimum in san fran so it is what it is try the in house restaurant amazing food and chowder

slt21 thank you so much for taking time out of your day to give us a review the team is excited to had made your stay truly memorable the argonaut is in the middle of all local attractions on the waterfront ghirardelli square is a block away from the hotel the cable car turn is next to us both the aquatic park and hyde street pier is across the street when you are done site seeing stop by the blue mermaid for a cup of our award winning chowder or enjoy a glass of wine in front of a fire pit on our patio we hope to see you visit us again in the near future

i loved the nautical theme hotel is in a great location near the peirs the chocolate company is right next to the hotel great resturant blue mermaid in hotel near public transit easily accessible by car

good location bright and clean a bit impersonal i guess there are always people staying here for just a brief time they were polite but not keen to think outside the box it would have been nice to have milk provided with the teacoffee in room so when i went to ask for some at 745 this morning i was told that i had to wait until the restaurant opened at 8 the restaurant and bar close at 10 too no flexibility with small requests a bit intransigent we were 8 hours ahead mentally and it would have been nice to know that facilities like milk etc were available int he night should we have wanted them even better put it in the room there is a fridge after all the concierge was lovely when it came to making phone calls regarding our trips but i got the feeling that for the behindthedesk staff engaging the guests is not a high priority there is no drive for excellence which is a shame would i stay again yes probably forewarned is forearmed and i would plan accordingly but i would probably look for a friendlier place out of choice it felt just like having a nice bedroom and i was looking for a bit more than this

our favorite place in san francisco away from the really crowded downtown area but easy to get to just about anywhere in town it is like staying at a destination resort right on the waterfront and a nice walk all the way down to the embarcadero district while enjoying all of the sites along the way what a great place great and very friendly staff and nice accommodations with a free evening wine bar a great lobby to meet and visit other guests and it is pet friendly we have taken our 95lbs goldendoodle wilson there many times he is quite a hit with folks the staff makes every effort to make our stay special and always enjoyable
