we had a comfortable and pretty bay view room looking out to alcatraz i wish we would have spent a little time in the lovely cozy lobby next time the location of the hotel is very convenient for a walk to the piers ghiradelli square and the turn about for the hyde powell trolley line every staff member that we encountered at the argonaut were pleasant helpful offering to answer questions and this really enhanced our stay highly recommend

my son and i were 1st time visitors to sf and found this hotel to be the perfect option for us because of its proximity to the ggb pier 39 a major tourist hub and pier 33 where the alcatraz cruise departs the argonaut is the best option for those who need to be close to the main tourist attractions we rented bikes from blazing saddles around the corner and biked over and back the ggb we did a vantigo tour of sf in a vw bus which departed 2 blocks down the street snd we did dylans tour to muir woods with lunch is sausalito which departed from marina park again across the street we loved the convenience but we also appreciated the friendly staff supercomfy beds and linens plenty of drawer and closet space easytouse safe and spacious accommodations

this looks like an organized fraud and you have to look at your credit card bill after checking out the employee at front desk suggested that we empty the mini bar everything was there in plain sight right next to the tvso that we can use the fridge before checking out we putted everything back in plus 2 extras beers that i did not drink check out went fine well guess what my crdit card was then charged for the entire mini bar 82us they finally reimbursed me other than thatit is clean but very very small rooms public parking 200 meters away for 40 day

fabulous hotel and set the bar very high for the rest of our usa trip loved the nautical theme and rooms were fabulous the outside and of the building is very impressive too great location and staff were helpful and friendly

i attended an international conference in san francisco in december and booked my accommodation very late i would usually have stayed much closer to the central business district or the convention centre eg intercontinental but all of these hotels were already full i was very impressed by the service at the argonaut from the time i arrived until i checked out five nights later the room had quite a quirky nautical theme and was decorated and furnished to a high quality with a really comfortable bed the exposed brickwork at one end of the room was an unusual feature and really suited the dcor the breakfast in the blue mermaid restaurant was average i only ate there on one morning the location is great if you want to be in the centre of the action at fishermans wharf in close proximity to the golden gate bridge alcatraz etc for business it is not quite so convenient i had a number of early morning meetings in other more central hotels eg le meridien and had to get a taxi there and back a small fare 10 usd which seemed to irritate the drivers i would consider staying at the argonaut again if i was travelling for leisure with my family but probably not when i return to san francisco on business due to it being a bit further out than i would like

we stayed for 6 nights and it was wonderful it is an old factory turned into a hotel so it has that charm very clean room beds were very comfortable bathroom had a tubshower combo shower good water pressure one sink vanity but the top is very large so everyone has room for their toiletries towels were above average in plushness closet had lots of hangers and a safe night table had two drawers and dresser had two large drawers other area of dresser taken up by a dry and refrigerated mini bar in room coffee maker large tv on swivel with more channel offerings than most hotels ac worked really well housekeeping was very good doormen always good natured and eager to assist concierge arranged one day car rental for us for only 40 for the day nice lobby with board games to entertain the kids and some adults fantastic location right on the wharf with so many restaurants bars and shops just a short walk away buses and trolley right at the end of the block hotel has a bar and restaurant but we never drank or dined there for us it was a perfect place to stay

really liked this hotel room was well done clean and had great touches and decor it was not cookie cutter and didnt feel like every other note staff is great overall location is good but does get busy on weekends with tourists out along jeffereson st and the end of the cable car line it was a bright spot in our trip to sf

location cleanliness staff all great for being on the wharf i had some doubt on safety at night both nights we were out late tons of people and families still out homeless are there but they were more entertaining than anything singing dancing playing instruments if you have a pet the location was nice as its directly next door to the maritime park beach is right there along with ghiridelli square and the buena vista for some irish coffees lobby was comfortable to hang out in in the evening nice fireplace we brought our fur baby she was welcomed by all

the staff are awesome at this hotel we stayed for a quick two night vacation for my husbands birthday staff were very polite and attentive they even left a package for my husband in the room we loved being able walk to fishermans wharf and were right next to ghirardelli square room was clean and the mini bar is stocked with awesome goodies just in case definitely will stay again

we really liked the ambience of this hotel its location is perfect the room was clean and tidy this is a premium style hotel in a a good location so everything costs a bit more and the resort fee is a bone of contention the 10 a day voucher in the bar was the only bit used but we knew this prior to arrival and accepted it would of been nice to have a fridge in the room for personal use charging an extra 15 for an extra fridge is a cheek as the one supplied was for the mini bar the staff were always attentive friendly and very helpful just a note for other travellers when booking the hop on hop off bus take the two day option one day isnt enough

we have been to san francisco several times but this was out first stay at the argonaut but it will definitely not be our last it is a lovely hotel in the ideal spot if you want to be in the fishermans wharf area the staff were tremendous we had asked for a room that overlooked the park and we were not disappointed the concierge service is brilliant and a little tip for you if you intend hiring bikes from blazing saddles a few doors down which we would also recommend the argonaut has 8 complimentary bike vouchers each day with them it is a first come first served basis in the morning but we got them both times we asked it isnt the cheapest hotel in the area but you get what you pay for we paid 400 a night for a room that gave us a view of where the cable cars turn round in the park which is what we wanted there can be a bit of noise early in the morning outside so if you like to sleep with your window open just be prepared to be woken up every now and again but it didnt stop us getting a good nights sleep

good bits the location the view from our room of the bay and alcatraz the complimentary bottled water at reception bad bits not good value for money our suite was very expensive and the rest of the hotel did not live up to expectations service was non existent we took our own bags to our room no assistance was offered every time we tried to call guest services we got an ai bot that was utterly useless and infuriating the restaurant was average with surly service and very expensive our one and only experience with the concierge on our first morning was so poor we relied on google from there on in she ignored the questions we asked and tried to upsell us on things we werent interested in the one piece of info we did get out of her turned out to be incorrect the hotel is in a beautiful old building but alas feels soulless in the communal areas and there is no sense of a hub staff werent rude but neither were they friendly there was little proactivity there was a lot of chatting amongst themselves while guests stood around waiting for attention overall our stay was not terrible but neither was it great and for the money we spent it wasnt good value so we could not recommend it we were not asked about our stay at checkout i was send a satisfaction questionnaire after leaving which i filled out honestly but the hotel has not followed up about any of our feedback it just felt like they didnt care very much a real shame

close to everything loved the location and surroundings great service by the valet and hotel staff wonderful food at the attached restaurant would have liked a bigger view of the marina window was small

my husband and i arrived monday afternoon john and andreas were simply fantastic always willing to take the time to see how we were and helping with suggestions to any questions we had our room had a fantastic view and the champagne and happy honeymoon was such a grand touch loved this stay and will be really sad to say goodbye saturday morning and the rooms are cleanvery very important

very comfortable rooms friendly staff great location in the heart of fishermans wharf there is a ben and jerrys two doors down which you get discount in staying in the argonaut hotel meaning it smells lovely as you walk back and you get to have lovely icecream every day the attached restaurant is expensive id recommend boudins for breakfast instead

spent three nights here and it was a convenient spot for the family easy access to nice restaurants fast food and tourist attractions including a cable car stop next door staff were friendly and free happy hour was a nice treat

overall a great experience with this hotel it is at the west end of jefferson street which is the hotspot at fishermans wharf you will be in walking distance of the piers bus tours and the cable cars many restaurants and other activities front desk was very helpful in arranging a car for our transport back to sfo bellmen housekeeping and all other staff were very pleasant and professional this was an excellent experience in san francisco

arriving after a long flight from the uk we found the hotel easily and were welcomed into this lovely and friendly hotel we were originally given a room on the 4th floor 408 but there was a loud noise from some air conditioning units and immediately on requesting a different room was given one no questions no quibbles and very friendly explaining the noise issue these 4th floor rooms with noise are referenced in other reviews too hotel is a great location right next to the cable car terminus on the edge of fishermans wharf and also next to a park and beach so you arent in the middle of and taking ages to escape some of the worst excesses of the fishermans wharf tourist trap its also nice to see fishermans wharf early in the day when there are few tourists about our room 267 was large clean and beds very comfortable happy hour between 56 every night served complimentary wine and beer a great idea after our long days out in sf as a family of 4 we originally booked a double queen room with view for 3 days but then found that it was 200 cheaper for the same type room without a view the windows are quite small this was a good decisionand since we were out most of the day loads of other restuarants and breakfast places nearby so would recommend eating outside the hotel and you can ride the cable cars either earlier or later when its quieter valet parking whilst expensive was a breeze and be assured that is a godsend in sf all in all a great hotel great service great location would we stay there again definitely

once youre inside it gets less frenetic than on the street but the decor is cheesy blue nautical on the whole a pretty good hotel nice wooden beams the little museum next door is delightful breakfast was ordinary and very expensive stay here if you want to be right in the thick of it

ive stayed in many sf hotels and picked this one for the location for this trip although the rooms with supposed views had a glimpse of the bay at an angle in the distance front of house staff were friendly and concierge helpful no information on hotel or the city to be found in the rooms room itself was nice furnishings a bit shabby though bathroom very dated and small for the room size adjoining restaurant is ok but limited and not great choice overall the hotel was fine for what i had wanted but not sure id return

we went here last minute due to a failed airbnb experience it was the last night of our honeymoon and so the woman checking us in very kindly upgraded us to a huge suite we were so pleased the suite was gorgeous with lots of nice touches like animal print robes and a big jacuzzi bath we didnt have much of a view but we werent too bothered about that seeing as we got the free upgrade the location is brilliant as you can just wander out the front door and within minutes you are at fishermans wharf and pier 39 with views to alcatraz and the golden gate bridge the hotel itself is actually quite funky and there are complimentary guest drinks beer and wine in the lobby each day at 530 we didnt eat in the restaurant so i cant comment on that however we did get breakfast room service which was quite pricey but nice for a treat the staff are what really make this hotel a great experience from the reception desk to the bell hop they all went out of their way to be super friendly and helpful

we stayed here for a night between our international flights recently we arrived at 830 way before check in and the hotel were very accommodating in looking after our bags and going out of their way to get a room ready early for us gave us a free coffee voucher for the restaurant and arranged for a table for us to have some breakfast reception staff were very friendly giving great help on local transport and where to go they even called me when our room was ready later that morning room was very nice something different from the usual same old same old hotel rooms great to have an opening window for fresh air something that seems to be very unusual these days location is fantastic right next to the tram stop to get you into the city and union square right on fishermans wharf for all the attractions there completly different atmosphere to our earlier stay in sfo and much more enjoyable all round would recomend to anyone and will stay there again when we return

my wife and i flew from los angeles for a weekend the museum was closed which really was disappointing the weather and hotel were fabulous great trip and all employees were helpful most restaurants and places were open the trolley cars were shut down still the embarcadero was not busy

hotel is located at the hyde and powell turn around close to everything but most importantly its across from the buena vista and their fantastic irish coffees and breakfast besides walking along the embarcadero we walked the opposite direction to the marina district palace of fine arts crissy field ant the golden gate ferry to sausalito just a couple blocks skip scomas and blue mermaid terrible tadich grill gary danko fog city diner yummy

we stayed here in march for a day trip to san francisico and we loved it the nautical theme is charming with the location pros called for an early checkin hotel was accommodating umbrella in room helpful for the rain great mini bar selection fabulous location near pier 39 quick uber ride to other parts of the city like the golden gate super helpful concierges great view from our room we could see alcatraz cons none we loved it here definitely would stay again

excellent customer service staff are responsive and knowledgeable spouse is disabled and staff did everything extra to accommodate us the location of the hotel is exciting and scenic i was planning my next stay before even checking out

100 will return to the argonaut my family of four visited the property and everything from arrival to departure was wonderful the bell staff jeremiah and jose was efficient and made arrival on the busy street so easy check in was welcoming and informative tzentin sorry if misspelled was wonderful at the front desk while i didnt speak with him in person ky helped me via phone twice which i appreciated very much jenmy at the restaurant was an all star my family loved the chowders especially the crab our room was clean spacious and we loved all of the subtle hints that we were in a ship port mirror star fish pillow etc the gym had really great machines i should also mention that our two dogs who traveled with us enjoyed their pet bed bowls and treats the location of the hotel right next to aquatic park was perfect for walks and seeing the sunset behind the golden gate the service that the argonaut provides is on point personable memorable after a few disappointing stays at different hotels it was so refreshing to receive such great service and a comfortable safe and clean room to come back to at night

had a great time this hotel argonaut is excellent in a great place great room trendy bars and reception and very very friendly staff we really did enjoy the hotel and this lovely city 1010 for the hotel david

the room was huge and very clean i have never been is such a cool hotel the staff was always happy to help with anything we needed my wife needed a spoon and bowl for her ice cream and the guy with the cool hat brought it up to her the museum was very cool the lounge area was nice to sit and relax before or after a meal at the blue mermaid over all it was an awesome experience

recently stayed for 4 nights at this hotel with family and can honestly say great hotel and perfect location hotel service was good and standard and cleanliness of room perfect if staying in san fran and want to be on the wharf this is a perfect hotel

really enjoyed our two night stay jeremiah was exceptionally welcoming and was a good man to have out front for those first second third impressions for what we wanted to do as tourists the location was perfect

a wonderful stay in san francisco hotel personnel very friendly and responsif when you book a room state what kind of view you expect rather top than bottom floors were glad that we were able to change arrival dates at very short notice lots of wonderful restaurants just around the corner

crazyinluv we greatly appreciate you taking the time to give us a review and giving us a perfect score the entire team is thrilled to had made your stay most enjoyable and memorable since the argonaut is in the middle of fishermans wharf this makes us an ideal location ghirardelli square is a block away hyde st pier is across the street the cable car turn is next to the hotel and pier 39 is just steps away as a added benefit staying with us we also offer two free hours limited availability bike rental from blazing saddle or if you prefer we have electric urbes 10 credit to use in the blue mermaid per a night and discounts with local business such as ben and jerrys and sees candy which is located behind the hotel please come visit us again shortly all the best keith hotel operations manager

we came early to san francisco as we were on a tour that began here the hotel was very nice and the room adequate it is located right in the heart of all the activities so for us this was its best feature only its excessive price kept it from being a 5 star rating but most of the tourist attractions in this area are vastly overpriced so come prepared we asked for the room rate the tour secured but this was tactfully declined

good receptionist and travel guide in hotel lobby good restaurant attached no noises although in busy area rooms spotless and kept so helpful polite staff at all times very happy to recommend cable car turn around right outside hotel buy day rider for best price

we recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights check in was super easy and the staff were really helpful the room was quiet big king size bed a small sofa and a desk the bathroom was pretty average but nice the tv had loads of channels and the mini bar was packed the location was perfect for us just a short walk to pier 39 or a very short drive to the alcatraz cruise dock was we really couldnt rate the location any higher shops and food right at the door step the blue mermaid restaurant downstairs was really nice too the lobby had plenty of seating and some games to play while youre waiting etc we also were given a free 2 hour bike rental with our booking from the shop next door so we got to see the golden gate nice and close we would definitely stay here again highly recommend

be sure to know which way your room faces you can face the water a nice little courtyard or a lot of rooms simply face in on other rooms with no view at all except your fellow hotel guests the rooms are small but not uncomfortable and if you want to be in the touristy heart of fishermans wharf this is a good place

we stayed here on my birthday while on the way to napa valley the hotels location is perfect being that its right on the waterfront i was traveling with my shiba inu and we had a wonderful time playing at aquatic park adjacent to the hotel there is nothing like a walk at sunrise along the waters edge with the golden gate bridge in the background long before the tourists flock the area we stayed in a beautiful very spacious corner suite with a hot tub i particularly appreciated the maritime theme of the hotel with its hardwood floors and exposed brick walls the building itself is a historic san francisco building the hotel staff was extremely friendly from valet to the front desk my dog was also welcomed by everyone whom we encountered i will gladly stay at this property again when traveling with my dog to san francisco ps parking is very steep at 50 a day and you dont need a car if youre just hanging out in the city

you will definitely love the location and make sure to get a 4th floor room with a view of the bay or golden gate bridge the nautical decor and design of the hotel is great i love the cozy fireplace in the main lobby area with lounge chairs you can sit on during the chilly weather the hotel itself is clean and covid compliant the staff is very nice but can be a bit more engaging the rooms are very clean and made up nicely the bathroom is your basic tubshower combo and cloth curtain i do love the pocket door to the bathroom the sleep however was terrible their beds at least the room we stayed in was a spring mattress which you felt all of them on the thin mattress against the hard base board it was sitting on and made noise every toss and turn you will need to ask the front desk if you want a firmer memory foam pillow instead of the thin feather pillows we found that out on our last night the sleep is the only reason why we would not return but would definitely come back if they upgraded their beds

this hotel by far is the best hotel for a stay in san francisco located near everything corinne provided exceptional customer service and is the sole reason i will be returning she goes above and beyond the rooms are exquisite and the blue mermaid was phenomenal do not hesitate and book this hotel

if youre looking for a great holiday location right in the middle of the tourist trap around fishermans wharf then this is your place the nautical theme is everywhere and probably a great family option convenient access to waterfront and cable car into downtown lots of bike rental places nearby hard to escape the tourists so if you want something a little more chilled out you might want to look elsewhere

i stayed with my family in a one bedroom bayview suite the bedroom was spacious and the living room had generous seating a table and chair for four a desk and still plenty of room for a rollaway bed the sofa also converted to a bed very roomy bathroom with nice toiletries and soft towels the room was not sound proof but the hustle and bustle outside calmed down considerably after dark so sleeping was fine calling it a bay view was a little generous as our view was of buildings that lined the bay but we were on the second floor and i suspect the higher floor probably have better views and the view was interesting so really no complaints there fishermans wharf was a little touristy but the hotel was on its edge and therefore quieter but still in close proximity to everything the location is great for public transportation right at the cable car turnaround a block from the bus stop and two blocks from the street car stop the afternoon happy hour was a nice touch and we got very helpful service from the concierge and front desk house keeping was excellent

staff was very helpful when i asked help on a couple of issues great service from staff room was exceptionally nice and very clean i would stay here again also a very good location the stay also included parking which was great because it is a very busy area for nightclubs and restaurents and some museums

great for any trip in and around sf very nice and safe area and also good for jogging swimming and bicycle tours the city is also within walking distance around 30 minutes breakfast can be eaten in the hotel restaurant if it must be glutenfree the kitchen will take special care

we very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel recently the rooms were everything that was promised they were decorated in a nautical theme without being over the top we really liked the location right near the hyde street pier and hyde powell street car station the nightly wine reception was very enjoyable as we are able to meet many different people from around the world we met a very nice couple from oslo norway and now have a place to visit should we ever go to the scandinavian countries the staff are very friendly and helpful we spoke with the concierge on numerous occasions and received very good information and advice on the area we have stayed at kimpton hotels before and had very nice stays we would highly recommend the argonaut hotel for anyone looking to stay in the fishermans wharf area

decided to stay here for 1 night as we were in transit very warm service nice spacious room with cute decor very apt maritime themed concierge was helpful in arranging for cab to airport for the following day would definitely recommend this place
hotel rooms were nice however very noisy charges for items in room were not reasonable restaurant was terrific and employees were very nice the location was great and walking around was made simple

arrived at the hotel after a long journey the checkin was easy quick painless we were quickly directed to the elevators and up to our room which we were told had a lovely view of the golden gate bridge even though it was not visible at that point the room was bigger than i had expected with the lovely quirky design features it was clean and well appointed it is in a good spot as a base exploring sanfrancisco although the wharf are gets very busy at times we loved sitting on muni pier and watching the sunset over gg bridge the common areas of the hotel are all well decorated clean recommended

the best thing that the argonaut has going for it is the location between ghiradelli square and fishermans wharf its incredibly easy to walk to so many great tourist spots including pier 39 and pier 33 the lobby is lovely with a large fireplace comfy seating and games think upscale connect 4 and tic tac toe our room had a view of the the room across from the courtyard but we were really only there to sleep and we didnt mind also drinks at the fire pit outside at the blue mermaid was a great way to wind down now for the not so great the 25 daily urban resort fee is kind of ridiculous it covers wifi come on and infused water in the lobby which was empty every single time i passed through at least 6 times day next the bathrooms in the rooms are very dated and not laid out exceedingly well the hair dryer hangs on a hook just outside of the shower our shower head made a high pitched squealing noise that we couldnt stop no matter what we tried also prepare for long elevator waits with only 2 slow elevators finally perhaps the most frustrating was the service the representative at check in was flat out rude and also did not disclose the urban facility fee overall there were really great things about the argonaut but really annoying aspects brought the overall experience down great location and if you get a good deal its definitely worth it

though the argonaut is in a touristy area its a great location if youre a runner or want to take advantage of daily bike rides to the golden gate bridge vouchers provided for free bikes first come first serve beautiful views with some challenging but doable uphills for your run or bike ride also the ferry building is a short bike ride away is a great place to go for breakfast or afternoon oysters we switched rooms upon arrival not wanting to face the street and the staff was very accommodating id stay there again

i did not know exactly what to expect from the argonaut online pictures are often shot with misleading flattering lighting and angles this is a really nice clean unusual and well run hotel the decor is inventive as it is both retro and modern at the same time the rooms have a do not disturb make up my room switch and a doorbell great idea my only suggestions are better light blocking on the window treatments a way to divert the hvac vent and a larger mini fridge it was so full of their mini bar drinks that i had to remove them to chill my water bottle and dinner leftovers but thats nitpicking

we stayed here for four nights end of may 2015 it is very conveniently located at fishermans wharf excellent and friendly staff very comfortable and clean roomscomlimentary wifiand free wine between 5 and 6 pm every evening we had a great time

we stayed here with our 2 young children we had a room with 2 queen size beds before our arrival i emailed to ask if a portable cot could be provided the response i received was that our room package did not include a cot i was annoyed as i booked the room online directly with the hotel so the system knew i had young children travelling with us anyway i asked again on check in and the attitude then was very helpful and we did receive a cot there was a coffee machine but no kettle or tea making facilities which i found interesting also we werent advised of the facilities available to us until we checked out we didnt eat any meals here so i cant comment on that however the little snags did not ruin our stay the hotel is great and the location is superb we found the door staff in particular to be very friendly and helpful i do recommend it to families

this is great place to stay on the slightly touristy fishermans wharf but on the edge and perfectly peaceful inside lovely fresh and clean feel to the rooms valet parking guys very efficient and helpful as you pull up out of the holiday traffic not cheap but would really recommend for a short stay in this wonderful city everything close by and you can wander away from the crowds quite easily as well as stroll along to the sea lions in the peace of the morning

we had a very pleasant stay at this hotel the overall ambiance was cozy yet modern the nautical touches were stylish the hotel is very clean and the service was excellent a nice restaurant was on the premises the staff were very pleasant the location was excellent minutes from the beach and fishermans wharf

this hotel is ideal for visiting fishermans wharf and also down town san fran as there is a tram stop 1 minutes walk from the hotel plenty of restaurants around the restaurant attached to the hotel is good but a bit pricey

we stayed here for 3 nights for the first part of our honeymoon check in with travis was friendly and fast we got to our room and realised that it was not the deluxe view room that i had booked i called travis and after a few minutes he realised the mistake and we were moved to a lovely room with a view of the golden gate bridge and cable car turnaround i must all mention that in our original room there was some chocolate a bottle of sparkling wine and a card congratulating us on our marriage very thoughtful our stay was good although the hotel was very busy and noisy due to a hm convention one night we were woken around 2am by the room next door there seemed to be about 10 people in one room carrying on their party it took 3 calls to the front desk to get them silenced the hotel is in the best location and kept very clean and tidy we will consider the argonaut when we return to san francisco a note to the hotel when your guests book through a 3rd party please check their vouchers carefully this is what caused our room mix up and when we returned we also realised that we had a continental breakfast included in our rate but this was never mentioned which is a shame

great hotel in the old cannery in the midst of fishermans wharf rooms are oversized and quiet we were celebrating our anniversary and were surprised by a beautiful welcome gift tray of snacks and wine

we came to san francisco for 3 days with my two teenagers and this was the perfect place to stay super convenient location to everything the hotel was clean and very accessible close to the golden gate bridge trolleys lombard streeteverything for a tourist we would definitely stay here again

we had a room on level 4 with a window overlooking the bay towards alcatraz whilst there is some street noise during the day and early evening we had no issues with sleep during our 5 days service from the staff is exceptional from the moment you pull up at the kerb the rooms are well appointed with everything a traveler needs very comfortable as the hotel is at the hyde st end of the wharf you are far enough away from the really busy tourist spots but only a 10 minute walk to pier 39 as well as a short walk to the hyde st trolley terminus which takes you right past lombard st it might look only 4 blocks away but the uphill walk is very very steep take the trolley and into the shopping district near union square the attached restaurant blue mermaid provides options all day with the breakfast menu a highlight offering full alacarte or just simple sides to make up a meal which was good value highly recommend staying here if you are visiting the sf area

cozy room right at the end of fishermans wharf and next door to one of the trolley turn tables great location for walking everywhere room could have been a bit cleaner but i was only there for one night need to actually use the vacuum was there for a business meeting and they were very accommodating and sleeping was actually quiet considering i was on basementstreet level

great location great service loved the room nice soft beds the door man was more than helpful when we needed a cab very quickly the bikes were so much fun the concierge was helpful and so kind to my teenage daughters they still talk about how well they were treated we walked to ghiradellis the cable car and wharf from the hotel

location was perfect for exploring fishermans wharf staff was very friendly and helpful concierge and doormen had lots of excellent information and help maritime museum next door was excellent and is free a trolley stop is across the street along with a park next to the bay where we sat at night and listened to the waves excellent restaurant blue mermaid inside hotel hotel is at the west end of the area so is convenient yet very quiet room decor was fun and so was the doormans vintage navy uniform the fireplace in the lobby area was a welcome stop after a brisk night of sightseeing

a wonderful hotel one of the best hotels ive ever stayed in small touches make all the difference to the hotel experience situated in a great location its quiet in the evening and felt safe walking around at night staff were helpful professional and friendly we are thinking of coming back to san fransisco and i honestly wouldnt want to stay anywhere else

great spot to stay location is great to everything the hotel staff was great and gave recommendations to several spots this hotel was through a travel agent and was a great choice would stay here again if i can to san francisco

the hotel is located in what was once the del monte cannery it was the first building built entirely of recycled brick from the 1906 san francisco earthquake the hotel has a nautical theme the rooms are not the largest i have ever stayed in but are big compared to some of the other hotels ive stayed at in san francisco the rooms are well decorated and equipped the location is super you are right on the street that parallels the bay right next door almost to ghirardelli square fishermans wharf is about a 10 to 15minute leisurely walk away the downside might be that it is quite an active area being so close to the bay and wharf besides the restaurant in the hotel restaurants abound within walking distance the turnaround for the hyde street cable car is less than a block away i would stay here again be warned this is not a budget hotel my rate was 341 + tax per night however it was not out of the range of other hotels in the area especially considering its location a car is not needed for the most part as all wharf attractions are within walking distance union square can be reached via the hyde street cable car less than a block away the tour i booked actually had a pickup from the hotel

i met my bf in san francisco this hotel is beautiful the argonaut hotel is across the street from the fishermans warf it is near the cable car as well we used uber to navigate around sf you can also rent bikes if thats your thing the hotel is not a far ride from pier 39 a must see the pier larger than it looks the room was very clean and the staff were amazing marvin was a great help with answering questions we had about the area if youre a person who is fond of garlic i would suggest trying the stinking rose all of their dishes are made with garlic even the desserts within walking distance is scomas they had the freshest seafood that ive had in a long time thank u jean marc at scomas i will definitely be back to the argonaut hotel love love love san fran

great location great service nice area to meet in the lobby to wait for friends or just hang before we all went back to our own rooms hotel was very helpful with securing tickets for sights that were sold out

we stayed here as part of our honeymoon the room was nicely furnished and kept clean throughout our stay all the staff were friendly and helpful and couldnt have done enough for us we felt that the hotel is perfectly situated on the edge of fishermans wharf if thats where you want to stay we often went walking running or cycling in the mornings to golden gate bridge and didnt need to herd through the hustle and bustle of the tourist trap that is fishermans wharf the cable cars are right next to the hotel and so is ghirardellis the only things that we were disappointed with were the views there was none at all not even a street plus the noise the walls were paper thin where you could clearly here conversations next door not great on a busy weekend

me and my girlfriend spent the weekend here for my birthday and had a wonderful time all the hotel staff were great most notably indy who was very knowledgeable and lead us to finding some amazing local views and food indy was a true professional with his jolly attitude making our stay very pleasant the beds were comfortable and the hotel was in a great convenient location that we felt safe walking around the views were spectacular and made for a memorable trip their blue mermaid restaurant is definitely worth a stop as well

despite the fact that is ideally located the nautical decor of the rooms give you the coziness every tourist looks for i would definitely stay here again highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for walkable distance to the best attractions san francisco has to offer

the only issue we had was with the air conditioning as soon as we let them know they sent someone right away to get it fixed by the time we came back from shopping it was running great there was never any question or issue with the staff

the room was very spacious and inviting the tub was big enough for 2 and the hotel even included some bath bombs to try out with the spa jets it was an enjoying bath we had a room that over looked alcatraz and golden gate bridge we even saw some seagulls that perched on the building across from us we were minutes from exploring the pier and the chocolate factory overall a great experience

the argon hotel is a great location to be in the middle of all the attractions of sf it is a short walk from pier 39 union square and a short cab to professional sports games the lobby man prince was precise and pleasant in helping us with our luggage and questions would return again

i stayed at the argonaut with my family for two days and it was great the wharf was beautiful not too noisy and very touristy we were greeted by prince who took care of our luggage and explained how the hotel worked he was very nice spoke french for my parents to understand and had a very positive vibe he took us to our room and again was very sweet because of the service and the great rooms id love to come back to this hotel hopefully prince will still be there

we thought this location was amazing close the fishermans wharf ghirardelli buena vista so much in close walking proximity we paid for the water view and were assigned to a room on the 2nd floor which didnt provide much of a view so we asked to be reassigned they happily accommodated our request honestly if youre not on a higher floor the water view price is not worth it in our first room we were able to see about an inch of the water the second room was much better we were very happy with our stay and would likely stay again

the room was beautiful the people working there were all friendly from bell boys to front desk to maids etc and helpful we had a view of the golden gate bridge from our bay view room we needed a few additional items in our room like extra wine glasses robes and coffee cups and they were delivered in no time best of all the rooms was so quiet im a light sleeper so thats important no street noise once the windows were closed and very little hall noise you could barely hear the shower or toilet flush when someone was in the bathroom

this hotel was recommended and booked by our local tagreat choicethe location was excellent and the room facilities were all we needed and morestaff were so friendly and helpfulwhen they heard we were on a trip for our golden wedding they gave us a small gift from the hotel i could recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit the area

very good location and a really nice comfortable room restaurant and bar were excellent we ate breakfast here twice and it was good with a good choice the ciopinno was excellent will definitely stay here again

hotel is in great location right on the wharf we rented a car because we were also visiting family on the other side of the bay but id recommend against it as this is a very busy area with lots of pedestrians the location is in the heart of many attractions including ghirardelli lombard street boats to alcatraz and fishermens wharf i love the kimpton hotels for their quirkiness and this was no different appears to be original brickwork in rooms nice deep tub we rented a king suit and it was plenty big for two adults and child now for the negatives the room was oddly shaped and seemed to have a lot of wasted space it was more like one large l shaped room with the end of the l being nothing but the entry way and a small sitting table it was clean but looks like it is ready for a remodel shower door barely opened and closed needs new paint the restaurant food was not good and the restaurant looked like it needed to be cleaned my other issue was with the concierge we had not booked tickets to alcatraz but my daughter wanted to go i asked the concierge and was told to check back the next day and she may have tickets that morning she walked me down to a guy who i figured later was a ticket broker who sent me to another guy where i paid 90 per person for a bay cruise and alcatraz tickets separate tours but i had no choice the face value for each tour was 30 which i didnt realize until after i had paid so basically i had paid an 270 for tours 2 tours for 3 people i could have paid 180 for since the bay tours werent sold out and i could have gotten those at any time i was really paying double to go to alcatraz im not so bothered that i had to pay more than face value since it was my mistake in not booking in advance but did not like that the concierge did not explain to me ahead of time that she was taking me to a broker she simply told me to follow her as if she had some connection to get tickets had i known ahead of time i might have negotiated if negotiation was not an option the concierge should have explained to me the price ahead of time including that it was a markup and made the deal for me minor issue but it kind of bothered me in sum id recommend this hotel if you want to stay in this area but i wouldnt go out of my way to stay there

great location close to pier 39 fishermans wharf and loads of restaurants what you would expect of a 4 star hotel clean and comfortable and staff friendly and helpful breakfast was good in the hotel restaurant there is a small museum part of the hotel which is worth a quick look and is free

we loved the amiance as soon as we walked in charming great location if you are looking to stay in this area we had a fantastic water view we were offered our choice of a bridge or alcatraz view easy walk to pier 39 ghiradelli square and the buena vista for irish coffee the street cars and the cable cars they gave a credit in the restaraunt and shops the rooms were cute bathrooms very small and the walls were thin but those things are to be expected in a more historic building our only problem was that we couldnt get a luggage rack in the room to put the suitcase on i have some physical limitations at the moment and that was problematic but otherwise we really enjoyed our stay here

heres to another great stay at the argonaut hotel we stayed here for 4 nights in a king suite which fit 5 adults comfortably both the bedroom with a king bed and the livingdining room area are spacious and clean there is a sofa bed in the living room and we requested two rollaway beds for our sons and nephew to sleep on the suite is exactly as described on the website the bathroom was large and had enough counter space to fit all our toiletries the staff from the bell desk valet front desk concierge and housekeeping were so friendly and helpful the hotel is conveniently located next to the cable car turnaround and aquatic park it is within walking distance to ghirardelli square and of course the many shops and eateries on fishermans wharf there is the blue mermaid restaurant in the hotel and we must say the service this time was consistently on point once again our stay was very pleasant and enjoyable will be back again

good location for the bay and piers but some distance from main shopping areassites though these can be reached by adjacent cable car service of taxi uber staff helpful but a little distant comfortable well equipped room can be a little noisy around the hotel expensive food and services

this hotel is perfectly situated for a visit to sfo it is at the quiet end of fishermans wharf next to and part of the national park service property the service is friendly helpful and accessible without being overbearing rooms are adequate in size and well and very comfortably furnished reading lights are good desk is comfortable and adequate to do work maritime themed decor is fresh and comfortable beds and pillows are great we didnt take advantage of it but dogs are welcome

lovely stay at this very neatly appointed hotel decor is nautical theme they offer a cute plush toy sea lion on the beds when you arrive nicely located next to the starting point of the hyde line of cable cars that take you to lombard street and union square also at one end of all the shopping and restaurants near fishermans wharf good food at the restaurant but just across the street are more options and the maritime national historic park is adjacent

we booked this hotel because it was within walking distance of a wedding venue we were attending we booked the argonaut suite and were pleasantly surprised at how large this suite was we had plenty of room for the two of us plus visitors the bathroom was massive there were a lot of windows giving as a 180 degree view of fishermans wharf and ghirardelli squaretrolley area we loved that the wc was behind its own door so that if someone want to utilize the rest of the bathroom while someone needed the wc both could be easily accommodated the shower and sunken tub were separate the tub had a wonderful view of fishermans wharf i just cannot say enough things about this property and its location we checked in around 11pm and it was breeze the front desk and bell desk personal were super friendly and inviting the hotel is conveniently located in fishermans wharf near ghirardelli square you can easily get on the tolley or muni to get around if you dont want to walk or catch a ride from our 5 days here we noticed that all of the staff were super friendly and accommodating should we need to stay in this part of san francisco again we will stay at this property the hotel decor is nautical theme with octopus tentacle wallpaper in the bathroom they even have deck chairs to lounge on in the lobby port holes near the elevators part of a boat in the lobby etc super cute

just a fyi and this may be one you already know this hotel is right by the wharf and is in great walking distances of a lot of cool places and shops however it is very touristy and busy the early morning is the only time there isnt a crowd around this area the inside of the hotel is very nice customer service check in and check out wasnt the best but the nice gentleman that brought up our room service was very polite they hotel is very nice on the inside but we were able to hear our neighbors some we didnt have a view at all so if you want one even of the city make sure to book with a view the beds were very comfortable the bathroom was very nice too and i loved their soap it smelled wonderful they also have battery powered bikes that you can rent and its attached to part of the maritime museum all in all i liked this hotel

we were here 3 nights on a hotwire deal it was a great price for the area i do feel that the cheaper rooms are given in the noisiest areas on friday night it was very loud outside due to crowds in fishermans wharf area thankfully i had earplugs the other two weekend nights were not as bad we were on 4th floor and could also still hear traffic noise beds were comfortable room very clean staff very helpful and efficient we had oversized pickup truck so daily parking was almost 70 with taxes we knew this going in so were not surprised but it does seem very excessive

stayed at the argonaut hotel for the third time the location is outstanding the property is very well kept and the staff is very professional and friendly there is no better place to stay in the fishmans wharf area

we book a standard room and when we came in our room i was very surprised the room is very big and nice there is mini bar which is ful 2 bottles of water for free free wifi stuff on reception are very nice and help always the position is close to the sea perfect u can find a lot of shops for tourists and a lot of restaurants also in the hotel there is a restaurant we didnt eat there but we saw menu and prices are good than behind hotel there is a starbucks where u can have breakfast or there is also breakfast in restaurant at 45 pm in lobby everybody drinking beer and wine nice atmosphere hotel is big room is nice just they have very strange bathrobe it was leopard and giraffe

great location great service concierge was extremely helpful i am handicapped and have mobility issues she recommended tours that were easy for me the tour was amazing we saw things i never would have been able to see without her services close to cable cars too would definitely recommend and would definitely stay here again

unique nautical hotel a great stay in sf near pier 39 however parking is 65 per night ugh we enjoyed the mermaid restaurant and the wine bar on site the staff was very helpful and it is walking distance to many great areas

wonderful hotel near of all the attractions amazing restaurant and the rooms so comfortable pet friendly parking a bit expensive but worth it location is the best we will be back next year property manager was so nice too with an incident that we had
perfect location near pier 39 and all the attractions staff very efficient they printed our boarding passes no problem room quirky and comfortable we would definitely stay here again when we return

love this hotel it is in the perfect location close to the cable car pickup and right on the water staff is very friendly and always willing to help shoutout to the doorman who always asks if we need something great job team argonaut

june 2024 celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary with some very special friends also celebrating 25th anniversary we chose the argonaut for its location close to fishermans wharf the hotel was lovely spacious and clean if a little on the expensive side but we found out that we had picked a time that coincided with a major event locally escape from alcatraz triathlon so the prices were much higher than at other times note to selfcheck for local events next time our room was great very spacious and clean breakfast wasnt included but a limited menu was available in their in house restaurant but we found it expensive blue mermaid ill do a separate review for the meals here we went hunting and out the back of the hotel was an amazing place called 8am brunch 5 minute walk away would go back to sf just for that the wharf itself was very clean and very well looked after but we felt it had a seaside town feel about it with so many souvenir shops there

great location spacious rooms and friendly staff definitely recommend staying at this hotel blue mermaid food was delicious their breakfasts are the best i enjoy my stay and i look forward to coming back

from a canning factory to an upscale hotel this hotel provides all the amenities anyone could ask for from the doorman in uniform to the special pillows on the bed this hotel is an example of turning something old into something new the rooms are large beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are modern the staff is friendly and efficient

this is the place for the air show 4th of july or anything else you might want to do in the heart of the fishermans warf area we are from the bay area we come up to the argonaut once or twice a year and its always a perfect stay

this property had great views and outstanding service nice touch to give a 10 credit for the restaurant splurge and get room with view of golden gate its well worth it they made it easy to add on wine for our arrival and even had a souvenir for purchase in the room my son loved his argonaut sea otter

nice and cool place to spend time in san francisco near fishermans wharf the staff is very helpful in any situation even if they towed my car be careful and take care for colored marks on the street even if they are washed and look like from 100 years ago the high towing costs for my car peter compensated with a good rebate in the restaurant we highly appreciated this complementary gesture thank you peter

very average hotel nothing extraordinary about it would probably never stay again unless it was discounted 50 off not having any type of breakfast service at all except from the restaurant attached was frustrating

san fransisco is best experienced at fishermans wharf right next to historic cable cars is the equally historic unique and beautiful argonaut hotel the front desk and concierge are world class with amazing insight to activities and restaurants in the bay area and beyond staff are incredibly sincere and helpful they upgraded my room free of charge gave us free gifts to celebrate our engagement and even assisted in coordinating parts of it i would not stay anywhere else

just stayed for a long weekend getaway and loved this place the location is great the building is beautiful and the staff was excellent everyone there was friendly and helpful sad to see the current state of fishermans wharf with all the closures but still a wonderful place to visit

the hotel was perfect right next to the cable car and the wharf completely remodeled and clean staff was very friendly and efficient you can walk just about anywhere you need to go valet parking for your car and many restaurants and shops within walking distance we ate at fog harbor fish house and it was great for breakfast we went to caf 8am for breakfast and that was fabulous

i am a fan of the kimpton hotel group and have stayed at other kimptons in sf and across the us i wanted to give the argonaut a try since the rooms looked visually appealing and the reviews were on par with my experiences at other kimptons overall i would actually say that our stay was disappointing for several reasons most on the part of the argonaut the rest on myself disappointing aspects in no specific order the staff i felt it was rather nonexistent aside from the gentlemen working the front door checkin was fine but not overly welcoming this was unusual for a kimpton checkout well even though we stood in line we waited longer since a person just sauntered up to ask questions and the the guest relations representative allowed this to happen my usually experience at a kimpton is you are often greeted warmly throughout your stay and there is a large staff presence in the hotel any other kimpton i have stayed at i would constantly see and be greeted by staff members at all hours of the day this was not the case here the wine hour was packed and seemed to be filled with people who knew about it but were actually not staying at the hotel in fact i often saw people walking away from the hotel with wine glasses this seems like a real liability issue i am not even sure there are people managing the wine hour there was no complimentary or tea or coffee service as you would find at other kimptons in the morning sure there was a coffee maker in the room but in the bathroom and that was uncomfortable at best they probably didnt want to deal with another round of people coming in for the free items logical but not really a kimpton experience the rooms the rooms are visually appealing and spacious but the beds were so hard that we barely slept in hindsight we wish we would have check out and tried another hotel because all of us 3 stayed in one room found we were in pain a week after traveling this is something another guest noted the beds in the double rooms are way too hard i actually prefer a firmer bed but these beds were so hard that one of us actually decided to try sleeping in the arm chair in the room they were that uncomfortable i cant convey how much this impacted our stay and the days after our stay i really felt awful and i am very sorry that i didnt saying anything about it at the time because i paid financially physically and mentally for it cleanliness the room was mostly clean but there were a lot of inconsistencies in the cleaning from day one to day two and three i also found it frustrating that the carpets were not vacuumed daily this seems like basic room service to me i felt there was a disconnect in this area that could be easily managed we left tips daily which were taken but the items we specifically requested more towels floor vacuumed were not provided the restaurant is terrible dont go there are much better places to eat in sf and i highly recommend that you by bypass it at all cost our breakfast was terrible the service was careless and lackadaisical our server actually told us he spaced out while taking our order the food was served cold without any condiments and it was expensive for what you get skip it the location this is my fault i wanted to try something different and get out of downtown but i felt this location was too much on the fringe of everything sure it was within walking distance to many things but they were not things i am that interested in if you want to stay on the wharf note that this is on the fringe of it not the heart of it if you dont want to be in a touristy location with the ding ding ding of the trolley nearby and the hoots and shouts of the duck boats then stay away from this location at all costs it will make you mad while not a big deal the hotel is also fully of families at all hours children were running up and down the halls there are also only two elevators and you often had to wait a short wait not a big deal to get to your room at all hours after thinking about it after the fact i would stay this stay was rather poor if i had to do it all over again i would really consider bringing it up the the management but i checked in on christmas day and i heard them tell someone inquiring about a room that they only had two left i knew it would be fruitless to complain about the beds when there was clearly no comparable room we could be moved to when we left the doorman asked us how our stay was and we mentioned the how terrible the beds were and his response was everyone says that its been a real problem and management is looking into it this actually made everything worse really you know this is a problem but youre just looking into it the really frustrating aspect is that its very hard to find many rooms in the sf area with two queen beds most of the rooms offer only two full beds while this is find for two people its challenging for three adults this was the main reason we selected this hotel because it was important for all of us to be together in the same room during the holidays i wouldnt stay again and i would suggest others look elsewhere when in the area there are many great hotels in sf its perhaps one of the most competitive hotel markets in any city ive traveled to and in dont sell yourself short make sure you select a hotel that really fits what you are looking for in regards to location comfort cleanliness friendliness price and room parameters its possible that this hotel will meet your needs but dont be fooled by all of the positive praise it has received it was just okay

great location if you like the wharf area and we had a suite was very nice lots of room very well decorated and modern lessons learned however when we checked in we had a bay view room had an early check in which was great but there was a street musician playing right outside our room which was loud and we all agree needed to move us hotel did so promptly the problem began that night with the people above us for almost two hour straight there was a continuous thumping or stomping noise i called the front desk and they indicated they would contact them next morning at 730 it began again this went on for two more nights and two mornings i probably called the front desk 6 more times and they continued to apologize and try to get the people to stop i also thought the person above us was checking out sooner lessons learned we probably should have moved the first day secondly i would have liked the hotel to have been more aggressive in some way with the people above and lastly people who are that inconsiderate to other people in hotels should learn that we are all sharing some space here and to be more considerate of others the hotel did offer a small compensation which i really didnt care because it was more important to us to enjoy the very nice suite we had reserved 6 months ago anyway just words of advice if you have issues get them resolved immediately and to what you want

nice big rooms and very comfy beds given its location you get very little noise from the street fishermans wharf is the touristy side of sf theres plenty other places to enjoy to be honest however for the area this is the best in the vicinity

this hotel was recommended by our travel agent so we chose it the location is excellent with stunning views of the bay the bridge and alcatraz the staff were welcoming and friendly and we checked in no problem the room was larger than average with a lovely decor and thats all the good no free water in the room 8 for 1l i didnt even look at the prices for the chocolate and spirits the bathroom was quite small and the shower not the best although the toiletries were nice and plentiful there were children in the room next door and we could hear every cry and howl until they dropped off to sleep so the walls seemed paper thin fortunately they checked out the following day so we had quiet nights the rest of our stay on checking in we had had a long day so decided to eat in the adjoining restaurant blue mermaid a nice building a small menu with a special of a turkish starter main course i was told the chef was turkish so was looking forward to my kebab what a disappointment it was awful one thin pitta bread with some tzatziki and a relish and a plain kebab plonked on the bread no salad no chips no side i shouldve taken a photo it just looked like something you find in a toilet im british so very rarely complain but i refused to eat it and sent it back i was offered an alternative but declined we tried breakfast my wife likes her tea in the morning she was offered jasmine earl grey and camomile no breakfast tea no mint the food was ok but with better places within a 5 min walk i wouldnt choose here checkout was midday an extra 100 to keep the room til 1500 after that full room rate no room to freshen up change and with a night flight this was a little disheartening to park your car was 60 but if you planned on using it would cost an extra 10 a lot of places had similar charges not just this hotel would i recommend this hotel 6040 yes but definitely eat out and sort out your own parking nearby

we had a wonderful experience at the argonaut you could say they went a little overboard with the nautical theme however the furnishings and decor were upscale and they pulled it off the staff was courteous efficient and handled several outoftheordinary issues promptly only one of which was hoteloriented we were given a complimentary upgrade the rooms are spacious and the bedding is extremely comfortable as a matter of fact im getting ready to buy a new mattress and id like to know the brand the argonaut has the lounge area is huge with plenty of seating areas the coziest of which is next to the fireplace the patio is a great place to hang out the heaters and fire providing plenty of warmth on chilly windy days while i hadnt planned on staying in a touristy area we opted for fishermans wharf because we didnt want to rent a car but i have to say for being on the main drag youd never know it once you are inside

we stayed in the argonaut for 2 nights in june the hotel itself is in a beautiful waterfront location at fishermans wharf with every sort of restaurant you could possibly want within walking distance the room was lovely with a nautical theme and we especially enjoyed the animal print bathrobes in room facilities were above average filter coffee minibar exclusive complimentary toiletries usb charging points in room safe cordless telephone large flat scren tv the list goes on

stayed at this hotel on the first leg of our honeymoon and really enjoyed it it was nice and clean when we arrived and we had the end room on the top floor which meant we have a view of golden gate bridge the room layout was slightly narrow but not a deal breaker i found it interesting that they actively welcome pets namely dogs to the hotel by greeting them with the little sign and free dog treats i found out on a tour that the city loves dogs and caters for them in their hotels location was great for easy access to the many eateries on the wharf the only thing i feel that the hotel is missing is a bar area also we had to call down to reception to ask the cleaners to clean our room despite them being near our room from early on

i highly suggest the argonaut hotel it has many unique architectural feathers and is very well kept and the staff is friendly and accommodating the location is perfect right across the street from starbucks

family of four with teenage kids stayed in a corner suite 345 beautiful room views of bridge and alcatraz right in the heart of the action 3 mins walk to fisher mans wharf right outside bottom of cable car bike to bridge and ghiradellis ice cream could not recommend this hotel and room highly enough if you are looking to visit sf as tourists

this was my first visit to argonaut with our office in ghe presidio there really arent any great options nearby so i end up in fishermans wharf usually argonaut is fully booked i must have now tried at least 4 different hotels in the neighborhood and argonaut is nicer with its brick walls and more authentic feel to it

beautiful hotel built in a historical building with excellent service close to pier 39 shops and restaurants we had a nice large king room with a street side view of the waterfront and alcatraz the room was beautifully decorated and quiet parking can be hard to find in the area but using their valet parking was great and we just walked from there or used the trolley service

my husband and i stayed at the argonaut for the first time a few weeks ago location perfect buena vista just up the block ghirardelli square one block away beautiful aquatic park across the street view of golden gate bridge located right at the waters edge at fishermans wharf upper west end the restaurant in the argonaut hotel is wonderful food very fresh and excellent service from beginning to end from stepping out of the taxi from the airport being greeted by john who walked us in with our bags he walked us all the way to the front desk to make sure we were taken care of we felt special then we met eddie lopez at the front desk what an incredible worker he is truly committed to his job handling a busy front desk with ease and with such a great customer service attitude we felt so special he made us feel so welcome we stayed for 5 nights every day we checked in with him he would offer suggestions on where to go etc i have never met a more committed and happy worker i highly recommend the argonaut hotel the room was spotless and modern updated the maid service was excellent as well maid staff very friendly and hard working it just seems like all staff really enjoy their position are 100 committed to a great guest experience the location is the best walking distance to cable car right just up the block we cant wait to return

team is amazing making my stay very special its location is at the quieter end of fishermans wharf the location is perfect for any activity restaurants and the cable cars simply fantastic i would highly recommend this hotel for anyone

we enjoyed very much our stay in the argonaut hotel in san francisco besides the confortable room the excellent position and the delicious cuisine we really appreciated the kindness and the precious advise and help of concierge joana which allowed us to fully enjoy our discovery of san francisco thanks beppe and lilli mazzoni

stunning hotel in a fantastic location fishermans wharf to the right and the hydepowell cable car and ghirardelli chocolate factory to the left staff were friendly and helpful free bike hire to cycle the bay and bridge cant sing the praises enough

we started at 2 hotels during our trip a work event was based at the other hotel if i had the choice i would have stayed at the argonaut the whole time the hotel is in a great spot at the end of fishermans wharf we paid for a bay view room and could see the bay and the golden gate bridge from our room since it is at the end of the wharf its a bit quieter while still being close enough to make everything readily accessible the cable car turntable is right next to the hotel though we didnt realise at first because we didnt hear a sound from it there are also some bicycle rentals just a few doors down id highly recommend grabbing a bike and cycling across the bridge you can get the ferry back to the wharf as for the rooms themselves ours looked very modern and the nautical theme continues throughout the entire hotel we had all the amenities we needed and the staff were all very helpful on leaving we told a member of staff that we were moving over to the grand hyatt for a work event thats a nice hotel very classy he replied in my opinion the argonaut is a much nicer and classier hotel there was not a piece of 70s style wooden panelling in sight and the staff were far more courteous at the argonaut if we come back to sf in future the argonaut will definitely be our first choice

san francisco is a wonderful place to visit hotels in general are expensive so pick wisely so you are not too far away from the main attractions we chose the argonaut a 4 star hotel right on the fishermans wharf this is a perfect position ideal to walk the warf visit local restaurants or go to alcatraz or even jump on a tram we spent five nights at this wonderful hotel there is so much character to this hotel the rooms are of a good size and well furnished and a lovely well price restaurant a nice touch from the hotel was complimentary wine beer or soft drinks for an hour from 5pm another tip is to purchase an onoff bus ticket from the kiosk just along from the hotel negotiate the price definitely recommend this hotel

the argonauts unique looks its bold almost cartoonish maritime theme and easy walker location lured me in for a 2 day solo stay while visiting old friends in sf my stay followed a trip with my husband to wine country so i was still basking in memory of other upscale hotels when i arrived at the argonaut in that light the argonaut selling itself as a luxury hotel at luxury hotel prices was a definite disappointment here is what i did and didnt like about this hotel the good 1 walking location if the crowds drive you mad turn away from fishermans wharf craziness and go left you can take a wonderful walk to the pier up into the marina and as far as you like towards golden gate bridge beautiful 2 fun theming i rather liked the brash decor and im sure it is thrilling for kids visiting with family although that giant boat wheel mirror directly facing the bed was a bit much particularly for a solitary traveler 3 housekeeping hotel and room were very clean when i left requests for certain items a replacement for the broken pen and a robe since one was missing they were delivered and staged nicely the bad 1 price i paid almost 1000 for 2 nights in a room that did not have a luxury setting or approach see below for more details my king deluxe was comfortable but rather shotgun in its narrowness and my only view was of a courtyard where folks drank talked and occasionally howled at the moon really all day and night i have paid far less for much better spaces in similarly desirable locations often a luxury hotel will make up a less than perfect room for you with extra benefits and service but that did not happen here 2 seals minibars and itty bitty bottles of booze show me a luxury hotel where you have to ask for a robe to be delivered how about a room with a small cute madeinchinafor15cents plush seal with argonaut stitched on the side left prominently on the bed and on closer examination with a price tag of 22 the mini bar list said only 14 what a bargain a large minibar that looked like the food concessions at a movie theater minus the helpful glass barrier was just as expensive i couldnt help but wonder how quickly the tab would ring up when a small child entered and grabbed the cute seal giant pack of mms cranberry banana chips etc i didnt have to wonder what an adult would think of the 26 bottles of bad wine i still had a free bottle one of two of good wine our cheaper healdsburg hotel had given us as a courtesy the night before just to be clear ive seen such seals and minibars before at other hotelsmotels but at a true luxury hotel this price point the seal is free to take home to your kid and so are the snacks if not the alcohol management really needs to think this one through set up a snack shack in the lobby if you need too but dont turn my room into a luxury tourista minimart 3 front desk service after exploring muir woods earlier in the day i arrived at checkin in clean jeans a tshirt and black anorak definitely not a street urchin but not direct from tiffanys either the clients in front of me were dressed in business attire and receiving prompt attentive service on my turn the blonde front desk lady looked me over gave me a one minute finger signal and spent 45 minutes answering the phone talking to a coworker and casting glances perhaps to see if the other agent or the totally unoccupied also watching concierge had welcomed andor taken me yet when that failed she handed me over to a new relatively untrained staffer without a further word perhaps if i had been dressed more nicely i would have gotten faster friendlier service or perhaps not either way this does not speak well for service first impressions or the hotel 4 not a driving location i mentioned walking as a benefit driving is much less so when one of my friends tried to pick me up from the hotel it was nigh impossible for her to get there and the parking rates when she did were extraordinary there are so many amazing things to do and see in san francisco frankly this hotel is a much pricer attraction than it is currently worth if you can get a room with a view guarantee maybe it would be better but make sure to tell them to hide the seal and candy bars from your kid first

we were completely blown away by everything at this hotel including our view of alcatraz from out window the staff couldnt have been nicer champagne for my mums birthday and wine and a restaurant voucher after an error during check in the rooms were huge and beautifully decorated as were the common areas the location was very handy for the cable car and all of fishermans wharf

they had some glitches the day we arrived because their computer system had crashed but otherwise a great pretty hotel right on fishermans wharf in an old brick building retrofitted with all new everything

i stayed in the argonaut several times last year and most recently beginning of february 2019 san francisco is a difficult place to find good hotels eg if you compare to nyc or european hotels and in regards to the location size of rooms the argonaut is certainly one of the better ones considering the price unfortunately the service is poor although a returning customer the would not recognize me would ask to do all the paper work again and again if you come back to the hotel in the evenings you will find rubbish from roomservice in the halls and it will not change until the morning also security is not up to date located in a very busy tourist location you see many non residents entering the hotel during the day they can go up to the rooms as they is no security on elevators or video surveillance in the halls feels sometimes a bit scary

beautiful location well designed and well appointed large roomsvery friendly efficient hospitable staffbrilliant base for exploring san franciscogood food and restaurant we hope to return from the uk thank you for helping to make our visit to san francisco so memorable
