a very contemporary yet nostalgic nauticalstyle hotel in a prime location in fishermans wharf near ghirardelli square the argonaut hotel is in a beautiful red brick building which looks like an old wharf warehouse this was our first stop on our coviddelayed honeymoon and it was a lovely hotel to start it off we were originally meant to be staying around union square but the quieter fishermans wharf location was perfect for us the initial impression was good the open fire in the lobby was inviting for such cool weather and receptionists and bell men were friendly and attentive we were upgraded to a room with 2 double beds the room was very spacious and had a great walkin closet i loved the plantation shutters and exposed beams and brickwork very classic in style the hotel acknowledged our honeymoon with a lovely card and bottle of californian red wine thank you so much we stayed here for 3 nights and it was a great stay the only sour note is that since leaving the hotel on 20th may our 300 incidentals charge still hasnt returned to my credit card it is showing as pending almost 4 weeks later the hotel has informed me that the hold had been lifted at checkout and that it was a likely problem with my bank we stayed at 5 hotels on this usa trip using the same card and this is the only one where weve encountered this problem this otherwise wouldve been a 5star review

the argonaut will always have a spot in my heart its not a chain its a friendly local hotel that ahs the vibe of warmth and welcome that i seek i dont want a huge hotel where i am just a number and the argonaut is definitively a quality hotel the location is the best in the wharf staff are awesome food is great and well i always return there

we stayed in this splendid hotel located in the fishermans wharf area for 3 nights by booking two double rooms and we had a very good time the staff is very professional and kind the red brick building which was historically a delmonte warehouse is truly charming and furnished in a nautical style the excellent location a few minutes walk from pier 39 but in the quietest and most decorous area service impeccable laundry and at normal prices expensive parking 65+tax and valet parking however all the car parks in the area are expensive around 50 a day but where you risk finding your car windows broken by thieves san francisco has become dangerous worth the money they ask for and i would stay here again

what a way to celebrate my 50th birthday if you are going to stay in the fishermans wharf area then this hotel is a must we were very warmly greeted and the bedroom was tip top quite luxurious and very comgirtable we opened the blinds and had a perfect view of alcatraz island it couldnt be better the hotel is in a perfect location with cable car into town just round the corner or a nice walk to town as we did a few times the piers and other attractions are close by so never a dull moment no hesitation in recommending

adorable boutique hotel right in the middle of the action of the wharf trolley pick up right outside so close to the action tourist traps restaurants very close by great mini coffeecroissant breakfast rooms are small but well appointed loved the decor and theme helpful staff

you could not ask for a better location the accommodations are phenomenal and the staff very friendly if youre one who loves the usual big chain hotelsresorts this will not disappoint this is now our new goto when staying in san francisco

friendly staffexcellent large room and facilties restaurant partly closed for renovation but plenty of restaurants nearby well placed for all transportferriestour buses etc and taxis plentiful and reasonably priced approx 4050 dollars to airport would also recommend a visit to ghiradellistwo blocks away a must for chocolate lovers and the restaurant mccormick schmicks overlooking the bay both within short walk from hotel trolley ride with terminus for union square around corner would recommend visit to alcatraz but would suggest prebooking essential due to popularity at least one month ahead to be sure of required date and time

easy to get to pulled up outside to be told by the door men that we had to pay extra for them to park the car for us we explained that we had pre booked a deal which included the parking they were sceptical to start with but checked with reception whilst the car was unloaded and all was fine the desk staff were great and were very apologetic they sorted our room and made sure we knew where everything was the rooms are long and quite narrow but are perfect they are decorated really well and we immediately felt comfortable the facilities included a sofa fridge desk safe and hair dryer there is wifi included too all the staff were really helpful we walked from here to a wide selection of goodgreat restaurants the ferry to alcatraz and up the steep hill of hyde to lombard street beyond if you are driving i would definitely book the parking package as it is much cheaper and easier can not fault the facilities staff or location will definitely go back when in sf

amazing view and great cleaning staff customer service from the front was less than great and didnt seem like management really care about discrepancies however the view the rooms and location were all absolutely amazing

this nautical inspired hotel is a wonderful place to be by san franciscos fishermans wharf all the ships details throughout the halls and rooms the steel and the wood beams the sea glass by your room number the nautical beautiful plank floors and seaside concept carpeting the staff is fabulous and very helpful comfy cozy beds great shower and ambiance everywhere do not forget to visit the mermaid the museum right in the hotel the winery tasting room not to be missed lemon water in the lobby for you to enjoy i love the seasalt aroma in the air sit by a cozy fire during the day in a great plush velvet chair with brass nailhead detail and enjoy some delicious wine from next door wonderful hotel incredible service extremely knowledgeable and helpful five star service and atmosphere they even have a wii game in lobby to keep the younger ones occupied interesting concept

after a whirlwind weekend on the west coast in sonoma with some good friends we needed a place to relax and recover before heading back east the argonaut hotel provided just what we needed a clean and quiet room and a place to store our bags the next day while we explored the city before hopping on the red eye to boston all the staff members were very welcoming and accommodating and the location was great for being tourists for the day

hotel is great nautical theme tons of history directly across the street is the bay on one side is a very nice park with the start of the cablecar line the people in the hotel did a great job of making us feel athome even though we were strangers when we checked in john with the helmet and danny helped us get in and marilyn behind the desk even helped our family up to our room made sure we were comfortable and even helped us plan our exploring our room overlooked the street and bay so we felt inthemix the room was spacious enough to play around and stash our bags to the side plenty of pics online already not sure if the folks saw we were stressed from the plane ride or what but they made this hotel the place to be

made a second trip to the argonaut despite reservations of the previous trip didnt like the neighborhood or the crowds but stayed again because 1 the rooms are comfortable and clean 2 it is possible to get connecting rooms for families 3 other kimptons in sf didnt seem better appreciated the acces to public transportation a real plus

this was a great location you can walk to everything and the trolley car is right next to the hotel we had two rooms and they both were beautifully decorated and very comfortable we wish the museum inside the hotel had longer hours we never had a chance to visit it we traveled with a bus tour the only disappointment was the breakfast it was not a very good buffet

this is more than a place to lay your head it is a destination the bay view rooms are beautifully charming and the location is perfect i highly recommend this hotel for couples or families kids ben jerrys right next door

i would book again at the argonaut ditto the noble house chain staff there very helpful pleasantsan francisco very expensive and depressing lots of younger homeless obviously on drugsvery sad ca is no longer the land of milk honey

we had a great stay and a wonderful meal at the on site restaurant the blue mermaid hotel is very clean beds are comfy cannot beat the view from the bay view rooms we could see the golden gate bridge and the cable car turn around staff is friendly the lobby is very welcoming with a large fireplace and games you can borrow fun beer fountain too large rooms especially for san francisco try the crab chowder at the blue mermaid its amazing

nice hotel great location have stayed at the argonaut several timesmy first choice when in san francisco jr at the front was helpful and kind the blue mermaid has great food and service will stay again

me and my partner staying in this hotel in san francisco as part of a trip to america we was amazing with the size of the whole place rooms were massive very happy with the location walking distance to everywhere would recommend this place to anybody has everything in a hotel you are looking for with excellent customer service

firstly i want to thank the reviewers who wrote about argonaut as they were quite spot on the location is perfect its not as noisy as you would expect it to be as it is further up north from pier39 and most of the hustle and bustle of fishermans wharf make sure you dont miss the powell hyde turnaround right by the side before you reach ghiradelli square the maritime national historical park is a great place to walk about make sure you visit the maritime museum and the hyde street pier i was a little bit disappointed not all the exhibit areas of the museum was open i think it was maintenance work walk out on the municipal pier for a view of the sf golden gate bridge as for the hotel the staff are very friendly and very helpful we had to pay extra 50bucks to check in earlier than 3pm but we were upgraded to a bigger room so no complaints there the bathtub faucet diverter was really tight and difficult to use but the service was excellent the guy came almost immediately after we reported it note that because of the pandemic you do need to inform them if you want the room serviced otherwise you can ask for fresh towels and more coffee any time bring your own tea satchets though if you want a cuppa we tried asking but they didnt supply that if you have kids just be aware the cute soft toy on the bed is not a freebie the rooms are clean check out the mini museum just straight on from the reception its so cool to be in an historical building the nautical theme interior design is in line with the location maritime national historical park and when you head out for the day the staff was so kind they offered us bottled water if you need them back to location its close to the muni f line if the cable car proves a tad pricey with the muni mobile app you can buy a day pass for the cable car and ride them all for the experience its fun otherwise walking around this area is delightful

this beautiful historic gem in the heart of fishermans wharf easy access to ghirardelli square the wharf shopping just across the street alcatraz tours trolley station bicycle rentals and the golden gate bridge you can get everywhere from here the hotel is located as part of a restored cannery and keeps all the best features exposed brick walls massive beams and doors but adds all the modern amenities while we had miraculously good weather on our early february visit we still had moments where we appreciated the lobby fireplace we dined at the blue mermaid al fresco to the soft sounds of very talented street musicians first a saxophonist followed by a bluesy jazzy vocalist the quintessential chowder in a bread bowl was perfect the wine a perfect accompaniment after a long travel day from the east coast and the service was attentive this was truly a sublime vacation for us we saw new things in san francisco that we had not seen before always a possibility in san francisco we played hard and were so grateful for our gorgeous and comfortable room to return to

i would give this hotel three and a half stars but i am giving them 4 for the benefit of the doubt it is simply too expensive for what you get we booked two connecting rooms one a suite and the other to my recollection i was told a suite facing the water that is why we selected this hotel when we arrived the record showed differently and both of our suite and room were facing the street the building is old and the windows small although i know the management can do little about that another big surprise upon arrival was that the concierge worked remotely most of the time that was our first visit to san francisco and although the concierge responded to our calls quickly it would have been easier if she was live sometimes only one person was at the front and we could not ask lengthy questions and have others waiting in line behind us several positive things about this hotel one main item is the excellent location it is close to all the tourist areas they had a very nice staff and they tried to be helpful the surroundings were very quiet even though we were very close to all the action the beds were very comfortable they had a very nice restaurant attached to the hotel

the location is dynamite right by the water and next to ghirardelli the staff is so friendly and anticipates your needs the rooms are very clean and we had a stunning view of alcatraz i highly recommend and will definitely be back

first of all the location was more than we hoped for hotel is located 15 min walk from the pier 39 and 3 min walk from both cable car turnaround and ghirardelli square there are plenty of restaurants and pubs near the hotel so it was good to relax and enjoy at the same time the hotel also allowed us to keep our luggage 4 days prior to check in which made our road trip easier the room is well furnished and i loved the bay view it could be a bit noisy during the weekend afternoon but i thoguht that was also the part of the touristy atmosphere

we were right around the corner from the trolley turnaround stop ghirardelli and the golden gate park great view of alcatraz and bridge room was beautiful bed were beyond comfortable and we even had robes dont bother to bring soap because they provide the best smelling soap and shampoo mini bar was a hit with kids a little pricy but so is everything else in san fran we did not eat there we decided to eat where the locals go first night we stay at a cheaper hotel what a mistake that was dont over think you wont regret staying at the arganout

this hotel always pops up on travel sights when searching san francisco while its not a fivestar destination its a very nice property the rooms are clean and very comfortable great beds we had a room without a view basically an internal alley facing other rooms but who stays in their room in san francisco there are countless restaurants and attractions in walking distance it is right next to the cable car turnstile making it very convenient to get to chinatown or just go for a ride after stays in the business district as well as union square i find this area nice and i surprisingly dont have a sense of tourist overload i will absolutely stay here again

pretty disappointing stay particularly because the was almost empty due to fears over the coronavirus when we arrived we were assigned by a disinterested employee arguably the worst room in the hotel second floor interior dark view of roofing etc after specifically requesting an upper floor and bay view my guess is that the room assignment may have been because we were able to secure an excellent rate due to march visit and low occupancy not sure why our request was completely ignored television was glitchy turning off at will and when we request a late checkout we were told check out is noon no exceptions regardless of occupancy etc have stayed at this property in the past and enjoyed it very much as its location is perfect for exploring the fishermans wharf area access to cable cars ghirardelli square etc not this time particularly at this price point even with a great deal we still paid 25000 per night we had a choice between the fairmont and the argonaut hotel both at the same price point at this point in time we made a mistake its not the cool class hotel weve frequented in the past very dissatisfied and disappointing

my husband and i are from the east coast and spent 3 nights at the argonaut hotel this hotel was fabulous the standard room is very spacious and the nautical decor is ideal for its fishermans wharf setting the bed was extremely comfortable the location is absolutely perfect you have access to everything from that location including the powell hyde street cable car trolleys lombard street ghirardelli square alcatraz and amazing restaurants the concierge desk staff were extremely helpful in planning our trips so we got the most out of the area in the short time we were there take advantage of the complimentary bikes and ride over the golden gate bridge book this hotel you wont be disappointed

jo d than you so much for the raving review the argonaut is definitely the ultimate destination as we are located on the waterfront in the heart of all local attractions the cable car turn is next to the hotel ghirardelli square is a block away lombard street is two blocks away both the aquatic park and hyde street pier is across the street and pier 39 is just steps away please come see us again when your in san francisco best wishes keith hotel operations manger

the argonaut hotel is in the historic cannery in san francisco the rooms are very nice but try to get a room facing out if possible the hotels blue mermaid restaurant is excellent the hotel is close to all the restaurants and attractions on fishermans wharf it is a bit pricey but it is a great hotel in a great location

the argonaut was awesome to say the least right on fishermans wharf there was always something to do our room had a bay view and also the girardelli sign the room was always clean and had a lot of character

we booked this room for two days prior to a cruise the location was fantastic close to fishermans wharf but far enough from the craziness of that area we dined at the restaurant several times and were impressed with the quality of the food and the friendly waitstaff everyone in the hotel was friendly helpful without being in your face and very knowledgeable about the area we would stay there again in a heartbeat

rooms kind of small i called and told them it was our anniversary and they offered to upgrade to bay view when we checked in was given non view room called office and was told no notification so no upgradenice place but rooms are small and there is zero view from the non view rooms except a wall overall nice stay

my wife and i stayed here for the first 3 nights of our us road trip the argonaut was 50 in a cab and about 45mins from the airport in evening rush hour traffic we upgraded to a suite on the top floor room 411 which had a side view over the bay and was incredibly spacious with a big bed and roomy shower just what we needed after a long flight the breakfast at the blue mermaid next door was decent but we found more choice and better value at joanies and black pojnt nearby the hotel was well situated for exploring fishermans wharf including the vibrant pier 39 and getting to the alcatraz ferry at pier 33 many great eating options nearby and next door to the cable car which is a great option for getting up the hills and into the city only 6 very easy to get to the gg bridge from here too would definitely recommend staying here over some of more well known but pricier hotels in the city value parking at 50 plus tax per night was steep but perhaps typical of sf

great location for a first time trip as you are right by fishermans wharf lots of restaurants and places to eat blue mermaid restaurant next door which does great chowder cycle hire icecream shop a few doors away starbucks behind hotel if you like chocolate the hotel is just across from ghirardelli square with its restaurants and chocolateice cream parlour is just a 5 minutes walk across and being hotel the hotel in also right by the beach so you can do some nice walks we walked all the way to golden gate bridge and back which took about 2 and half hours but you can cycle it quicker powell and hyde tram stop is just next door to the hotel although it does get busy at peak times i am in two minds about the hotel itself its very stylish and boutique but just did not have the wow factor which for the price was disappointing felt a bit to business like

i have really mixed feelings about this hotel parts i absolutely love and somethings just want to make you go arrghhh we loved its location its right opposite a trolley stop and a short walk to fishermans walk and all the main attractions the room was lovely spacious and spotlessly cleanoverlooked the golden gate bridgeso whats not to love we arrived at 1am in the morning struggling with three large cases after a 16 hr flight the security guard just said hi no offer of help night receptionist was lovely and very polite we got a really great room however the noise from the air conditioning was just so loudso we switched it offstill really loud noise also came from the fridge switching on and off very loud spoke to the lovely reception staff in the morning who said oh its probably because the air conditioning equipment is on the roof but we will check it came back a few hours later it has been reported fixed at 110pm nothing had changed at all for 4 days it just made a loud noise on several days i asked if the concierge was available to be told oh we do not have one today one arrived on our check out day we were really looking forward to dining in the restaurant having read the reviewsthe food was lovelythe staff were really poor and it was the worst service we received in our whole stay in the usa after dinner we went to the lovely hotel lounge and i asked at reception where the bar was to get a nightcap by the lovely fireplace oh the only bar is in the restaurant and it closes at 9pmif you go outside of the hotel turn left and there is a bar up the street we have never stayed in a hotel with a bar that closes at 9pm leaving was a little like arriving reception staff lovely really helpfultwo members of staff on the door let me struggle with three large bags offering no help at all so overall if you want a funky hotel close to the wharf and if you are prepared to put up with noisy rooftop air conditioning have no bar after 9pm and some really helpful staff and some really unhelpful staff its for you personally we would think twice as the little bits which would have made the stay magical were just missing i am afraid which is sad to saybut eh it might just me me

we stayed here on our family vacation to ca in june and it was top notch all the way around of all the properties we visited while in ca expensive national park properties included the argonaut hotel was our absolute favorite their attention to detail both in cleaning and in decorhotel furnishings is remarkable the property is located at a terrific spot along the pier area and is walking distance to all the major tourist spots there is also a parking garage just behind the hotel that is super convenient if you have a vehicle the staff was extremely hospitable and i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to san francisco

the argonaut is well positioned at the end of the strip about 15 minutes walk from pier 39 and with views over the golden gate bridge its an old converted warehouse so the rooms retain some industrialnautical fittings they are spacious and well appointed there are plenty of restaurants close by to stagger back from and a beach to sit and watch the sunset san francisco is worth a visit and the argonaut is a comfortable clean and handy hotel to explore it from we recommend a tour by extranomical tours and ask for guide tony he brought a personal touch to site seeing the city

loved the argonaut staff were friendly rooms comfortablerestaurant was excellent we really liked the decorthe mix of old and new the location was ideal i would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends

we spent three nights at the argonaut while sightseeing around the city the staff was professional friendly and very helpful in planning tours during our stay we were in town for fleet week and it was the perfect location for seeing the fantastic airshow highly recommend this hotel a long weekend stay in sf

we decided to stay at the argonaut for the start of our trip to the states the hotel concierge was great and helpful and the check in was fast and good we didnt have a car but parking is very expensive the whole of san francisco is expensive in every way so the hotel was no exception great location to visit the wharf and plenty of places to eat and busestrams to catch would thoroughly recommend the hotel

on arriving at the hotel it was exactly what was expected we had read up visited the site seeing in person was so much better room was lovely and so boutique we honestly couldnt have asked for a better room even the view we opened the blinds to see the golden gate bridge honestly this is an amazing hotel however dont get taken in by the free breakfast offers they arent worth it 4 pieces of toast 2 slices of bread and not enough jam and the service is absolutely terrible from waiting at the door for 5 minutes to not being served or forgotten about fortunately plenty of other places to eat

an absolutely well led and beautiful hotel with an extraordinary good breakfast restaurant the barista and his capuccino just a blast friendly staff allover the closeness to pier 41 and 39 and specially to the turning point of the cable car makes the hotel an ideal one to explore and enjoy san francisco we will come back

rooms good restaurant prices mid range beds very comfy rooms super spacious very handy for fishermans wharf area wifi not the best but workable discount vouchers for food and beverage offered on arrival make eating in hotel very competitive would go back

we took our 2 boys to san francisco for spring break and stayed here for 5 nights first of all the location could not be better we had a view of the golden gate bridge from our window and a view of the cable cars getting ready for the day everything you want to do is walking distance or a short uber ride in the lobby there is a maritime museum run by the national parks service that is really well done and my boys earned a park service badge there is also a beach across the street that we could walk on if you are doing a family trip to san francisco this is the place food was excellent at the blue mermaid too

we really enjoyed our stay at the argonaut hotel perfectly located near all the sites we wanted to enjoy while in san francisco we had an interior room with no view but the comfort of the room and bed made up for it its decorated super cute blue mermaid attached to the hotel was yummy love the bread bowl corn and crab chowder would definitely stay here again

i was aware of the daily 25 resort fee but please tell me how the word resort applies upon arrival at our floor there were 2 trays of half eaten meals on the floor and 2 additional empty cocktail glasses at the foot of my room and there they remained for the next 2 days getting a single additional bar of soap proved quite the challenge with your staffregardless of asking no extra soap bar to be found in our bathroom and so we remained one little square of soap for my wife and i for our 6 night stayby day 3 i bought my own i enjoy music as much as anyone but i dont care to hear that disco beat pounding through the lobby and on the elevators at 56 am why 5am because thats the time i left my room every morning to walk to a local starbucks to get coffee 10 for your pot of 2 small cups did i mention the 25 daily resort fee oh that must mean the restaurant area deck chairs against the back wall adjacent to the restrooms shower curtains must be expensive to replace as evidenced by the mold along the bottom of mine there is some good to be said excellent locationyour desk staff is quite nice and friendlyyour blue mermaid restaurant staff were extremely pleasant and attentive and i was more than happy to leave them generous tips its the little thingsget your stuff together

this hotel in in a great place very close to everything pier 39 the golden gate bridge and alcatraz the rooms had enough space and so was the bathroom nice lounge area just off the foyer which had a fire there and water staff couldnt be more helpful value for money for sure

best place to be if you want sf bay front lots to visit do this historical hotel it self is beautiful clean rooms beautifully decorated hotel staff very friendly hospitality cable cars 1 block tour buses 2 blocks highly recommend pier 39 10 minute walk view of golden state bridge ghirardelli chocolate factory 5 minute walk and the famous irish coffee at the buena vista cafe one block walk lots of restaurants shops parks we had our car valet which was a little pricy but our car was safe brought to us when needed it one time this historical hotel is a safe place for walking around nite time too

lovely hotel with no surprises compared to their website friendly staff all round and comfortable rustic rooms close to all the good stuff our only complaint was that the rooms did suffer quite a bit from external noise cars party goers etc but all part of the atmosphere of the area i guess

we had an incredible stay here the front desk staff was beyond helpful and generous and the lobby is really fun and unique we loved our room we loved the ammenities and we loved the location the wharf is very touristy and busy but it has a charm to it and you can walk to tons of restaurants and bars our 4 year old had a blast and the hotel took great care to make sure he was taken care of we will definitely be coming back

we stayed at this hotel in san francisco from 26 to 29 may 2019 the hotel is brilliantly located in the very popular fishermans wharf and close to pier 39 the interior is very modern yet authentic to its location i requested a room as high as possible with a view of golden gate and they accommodated our request we were also surprised with a bottle of wine in our room upon arrival checking in was made a pleasant experience by zuri at reception we toured the usa for 4 weeks and this was by far the best checkin of all the hotels what a pleasant lady the room was extremely big and equipped with every luxury you could wish for the restaurant at the hotel the blue mermaid is a must visit when staying at this hotel the food and service were fantastic and the firepits outside were perfect for late afternoon cocktails thanks to our server mikael awesome service parking was available right behind the hotel at very affordable rates being faced as south africans with an extremely negative exchange rate of rand to dollar we were happy with all the discounts provided by the hotel regarding drinks bicycle rental etc just take care that bicycle rental is free but as always there is a but to this privilege when we requested to take advantage of the offer at 17hoo we were told all the vouchers were finished for the day luckily the bicycle rental place accommodated us we enjoyed our stay very much and i would stay at this hotel again without any doubt we can highly recommend it the only negative aspect regarding this hotel was concierge it felt like this gentleman was doing us a huge favour asking for information and help we experienced this on all three occasions we asked for assistance after all that is his job and privilege to help us this was really the only negative aspect about this hotel its concierge service

the location is absolutely unbeatable and so are the views you are minutes away from almost all of san franciscos major sights the building itself is stunning historic it is very well maintained and clean we loved the obvious fishing theme throughout ultimately what made it phenomenal was the service every person we came in contact with was super nice they knew everything and gave great recommendations i highly recommend staying here when visiting san francisco

the argonaut hotel is a great place to stay while in san francisco its walking distance to lots of things to see in the city and its a good value too i would encourage anyone to stay there good for business and family travel

argonaut is a lovely hotel clean and comfortable the staff are friendly and helpful it is conveniently located at the end of jefferson street by the hydepowell cable car terminal it is within walking distance to the famous pier 39 and all the hoponhopoff bus terminalsoffices there are tons of eating places close by we used lyft to get to and from the airport and it cost about 35

first trip to san francisco we found this hotel by chance when researching districts as we were only in the area for 4 days and wanted to be central for everything the hotel lived up to our expectations room and dcor lovely fantastic view from our room of alcatraz bar and restaurant were great too staff very helpful and friendly we would not hesitate to recommending this hotel

i booked this hotel for a fun trip with my son for his birthday the location was perfect walking distance to everything we wanted to do every staff member went out of their way to make us feel right at home they went above and beyond from the beautiful birthday surprise for my son to giving us the most spectacular room and always asking if we need anything everyone was always happy to see us and we felt right at home we loved waking up and getting the bicycles from the concierge we biked over the golden gate bridge and it was spectacular the location was ideal for us to walk to fabulous restaurants and sightsee but was far away from the tourist area it was quiet i loved waking up early the streets were so quiet it was like a movie set i enjoyed sitting on the beach by the swim club across the way i love the green lawn by ghirardelli and who wouldnt want to be able to walk right to the choctaw factory we didnt want to leave and decided to make it an annual trip thank you to everyone for making our stay so memorable we loved the hotel if i could give it six stars i would thats how happy i was i cant wait to see you again

wow we just checked out of argonaut this morning and i wish we couldve stayed longer the service was impeccable so welcoming and friendly at every encounter jeremiah and jason helped us with our car and luggage at check in and we needed help we are in the middle of a move and had plenty in tow with us we ordered from the restaurant for pickup and they brought it up to us instead the front desk team even watched my daughters fish for us while we walked to get coffee after check out the room was easily the best weve stayed at in sf super spacious and clean location of this hotel cant be beat for proximity to all things to do

the door man john is amazing everyone was very nice i would recommend for everyone to stay here the location was perfect had a wonderful view of alcatraz island within walking distance of the entire wharf

this hotel was wonderful i love the ambiance and decor with exposed brick walls and large wooden beams the location couldnt have been more idealright in the heart of fishermans wharf and just a few minutes walk from pier 39 and ghiradelli square we could see the water from our room and watch the fishing boats leave each morning i also love how the shuttered windows actually opened so we could enjoy the cool breeze and sounds of the citya luxury not many hotels afford we reserved three rooms for our trip and had several requests including a pack n play the staff was very accommodating and pleasant our room had two doubles so our daughter could have her own bed and our son slept in a pack n play there was plenty of room for the portable crib suitcases accommodating a family of four and a stroller we did not fee cramped at all i also enjoyed the wonderfully comfy robes we put the lovely lobby to good use and finished each night of our stay with a drink from the blue mermaid and conversation around the fireplace it was a great spot for a nightcap and room for the kids to stretch their legs and play we did have an issue after our stay with our credit card being charged several times for additional rooms even thought we had paid upfront for a package deal but with one short phone call everything was swiftly cleared up and apologies made overall i would highly recommend this darling boutique hotel to anyone staying in the heart of san fran we thoroughly enjoyed our stay

love the argonaut very personable staff which go out of their way to accommodate their guests ive stayed there before my last stay will stay there again it is located in the perfect spot between the buena vista the gold dust scomas my favorite places in s f

firstly a great location if you are a first timer in sfan easy walk along the fisherman wharf area to pier 39 and to the alcatraz ferries what was dissapointing and not the argonauts fault was the very large number of homeless people in that area which made it too uncomfortable for a pleasure walk we paid 900 for two nights room only not inexpensive in any country but we expected sheer luxury and was happy to pay unfortunately in my opinion the luxury fell way short we had an inside room that looked into all the other inside rooms looking into our room so not great the decor was basic so all in dissapointing the connected blue marlin bar continued our dissapointment as we had breakfast but the restaurant was not immaculate and the staff dressed in jeans and casual shirts that didnt exude quality we know sf is a very expensive city but this didnt stack up they do offer complementary basic drinks of beer wine between 5pm and 6pm call me a tight scotsman but at maybe 10 each this didnt make a 3 star hotel worth 5 star prices could do better to ensure guests return

it was our third time at the argonaut its a good choice great location but still quiet the room is large and clean unfortunately carpeting which i dont like what we didnt like and remembered differently was breakfast there are various dishes to choose from from from the menu next time wed go somewhere else for breakfast

the location of this hotel is a+ and a very classy place to stay easy walk to lots of attractions in san francisco the hotel room was a good size and comfortable very cute ocean themed room including octopus wallpaper in the bathroom which i would love in my home the only downsides were that i wish there was more staffguest interaction which would make it feel more welcoming the shower wasnt very hot and reception took quite a large deposit upon check in more than the total amount of my accommodation and it took 2 weeks to clear which hurt my credit card for future hotel deposits however these werent huge issues and i would 100 return on my next trip

we are taking a road trip around west coast and sf is first stop argonaut gives a flavour of the bygone fishing industry but with modern take loved it especially our first taste of chowder great location for fishermans wharf outside eating at the mermaid was a delight even when slightly chilly with heaters everywhere

we totally enjoyed our 7 night stay at the argonaut hotel when we got to the room i found a complimentary bottle of dry red wine its like they knew thats my favorite wine the front desk employees were so friendly and helpful if i go back to san francisco id definitely stay there again

we loved this place the room was beautiful bright and clean location was perfect short walk to pier 39 and the alcatraz tours close to ghiradelli square less than a 5 minute walk to the stop for the hop onoff bus and 2 mins from the cable car station it suited us perfectly the room was decorated beautifully the staff were all super friendly and the hotel is gorgeous wouldnt stay anywhere else in san fran

on our last trip to san fran 10 years ago we passed the argonaut and said well stay there the next time well it took a decade but we did it and im glad we did great location excellent staff perfect kimpton experience dont think twice just book it

great hotel great location if a little expensive i would definitely recommend sf cycle the golden gate bridge and see alcatraz the hotel bar offers great cocktails and bat snacks we had a suite which was plenty of room for a family of five

we stayed during our recent trip to celebrate our 39th wedding anniversary nice hotel nice rooms of a good size we booked a suite but in hindsight we would have been fine without the extra room because the bedroom was spacious definitely worth staying

nice friendly hotel ideally situated near fishermans wharf standard boutique fair its a great base for exploring wasnt noisy was well equipped and very near the cable car stop long term stay might get expensive but for a long weekend to blitz san fran it is perfect

this is a great hotel beautiful rooms great helpful staff location is excellent in the heart of everything we stayed as a family for 3 nights would highly recommend hotel arrange everything from trips to sightseeing all done with a smile an old fashioned polished service we loved it

this is a really fun hotel in a great location we arrived a bit late in the day and since we missed the wine tasting happy hour were given vouchers for cocktails at the restaurant connected to the hotel when this happens you know it is going to be a good stay the hotel decoration is nautical themed nicely done and just a tiny bit over the top but memorable the rooms very nice and spacious comfy beds and linens a great bathroom and quiet the restaurant is very good the location is awesome walking distance to the piers with plenty of restaurants nearby highly recommended

we have stayed here multiple times the location of this hotel cannot be beat it is right next to fishermans wharf but it is at the very end by beach street so you dont get all of the crowds and commotion beach street is the terminus of the cable car line so you can hop on and be to union square or market street in no time the trolley line is also close by so you can get down to the embarcadero or att park the hotel itself is in the old cannery building the brick and exposed beams give it a very unique feel they usually have a wine and cheese reception in the lobby in the late afternoon it is on the above average end of the price range but you get what you pay for and it often prices out the noisy kids in the am and the partying young adults in the evening you can walk to excellent restaurants along the wharf great place for a romantic weekend

best choice i never made the office executive assistant booked this for me and i was pleasantly surprised the staff were all very helpful and friendly i needed help printing out something late on my first night and the front desk was more than happy to help me obtain what i needed the room was very clean and comfortable i actually was given free wifi i am not certain if that is some arrangement my executive assistant made or something they offered for the conference i was there for but it was free i did eat at the restaurant attached to the hotel one evening it is a pretty good choice if you do not feel like venturing out however the hotel is within walking distance to some tourist attractions and several very good restaurants when i return for the conference this year i will request to stay here

we stayed on the 4th floor in a bay view room which was incredible the views of the bridge and the bay awesome great breakfast and service will definately stay here again the next time we are in san francisco

the hotel is located in the heart of fishermans wharf with lots of tourist but the rooms are very quiet and nicely renovated we loved the spacious room for san francisco and we had a partial ocean view too because the parking was more than we wanted to pay we didnt rent a car while we stayed here taxis were readily available and the staff were all very friendly and helpful

charming ambiance and beautifully kept our room was perfect for our trip with 2 teenage boys plenty of space and truly impeccable service located just a few blocks for everything on fishermans wharf theres no need to drive the furthest attraction was the ferry to alcatraz and it was less than a mile away convenient lovely and a perfect landing spot for our trip thank you to the staff of the argonaut for making our stay in san francisco absolutely perfect

argonaut is at the end of the embarcadero road and youre right in and on the action the rooms are comfortable and very clean the housestaff is superb front desk and concierge were very helpful only drawback is the onsite dining facility which is mediocre at best if you want an over the top breakfast experience walk three short blocks to the hollywood cafe the short wait is worth it

we found this hotel after walking out of a reservation that same day this was a perfect location spacious room very comfy beds delicious restaurant and friendly staff we highly recommend this and weee so glad we left the other and found this gem

the argonaut is right by everything san francisco has to offer you can use cable cars that connect to muni to really get around town we found the room comfortable with a friendly staff that worked hard to meet expectations

the argonaut is located right on the water front just a few steps from pier 39 lots of tourist attractions etc in the area location wise you cant beat it the hotel itself is what i will call eclectic elegance with a rustic charm service is wonderful the restaurant is also top notch beds are super comfortable with great pillows my review is based on staying in one of the suites but ive seen the rooms and they appear to be just as nice in short this is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in

we loved the argonaut it is in a perfect location and is so comfortable just what we needed as travellers from the uk the room was perfect the beds were a dream and the bathroom was stunning the whole hotel has such characterand the first thing you see as you walk out of the door is alcatraz and its right next to the famous cable car wed love to return one day

we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the argonaut great room great service quiet and easily walkable to great restaurants the alcatraz launch and all of fishermans wharf and trolleys and the cable car hub were close as well making it easy to get from the airport as well as to other sights downtown
would definitely stay here again ideal location right on the pier staff were very friendly and accommodating the restaurant was reasonably priced especially with the daily 10 residents discount

amazing location close to everything that you might want not a huge amount in the way of facilities at the hotel but clean comfortable rooms with good beds and sound insulation most of rooms do not have any kind of view despite the location

my husband and i have been to sf many times but have never stayed on the wharf we chose this hotel from expedia and were not disappointed the location is great for all sf has to offer the hotel door is right next to ben and jerrys and the waffle cone smell greeted us each morning the hotel is very clean the beds comfy and the decor wowed me every detail was thought outthe chandeliers in the lobby the colors the chairs the fixturesloved it our room was nice and quiet and we had room service twice which was yummy check out the adjoining wine bar

understanding that we are i san francisco and that the hotel is very well positioned i still think there are better value for money options around or more luxury options if money is not a problem the rooms are nice but small many with no views on the bay the lobby is nice and there is a lively atmosphere and becomes very busy for the happy hour around 5 with wine and beer offered parking around is very complicated so the almost 60usd valet is almost a bargain

very nice hotel clean comfortable quiet spacious rooms helpful accommodating staff excellent location near activities sights parks restaurants wish we could have stayed longer in this convenient locationdelightful hotel

im staying at the argonaut for a few days for a conference its in a terrific location on fishermans whart but i wouldnt rate it as a luxury hotel despite the luxury hotel price tag our room on the second floor has no view at all and is a bit short on amenities no turn down service no complementary bottles of water its really just an average hotel in a great location the concierge and front desk staff are friendly and helpful but our room had coffee grounds in the bathroom sink when we arrived so the cleaning left a bit to be desired and its either the walls that are thin or just bad design but you can hear what is going on in the room next to you next time ill book a hotel in the downtown area and enjoy the walk to fishermans wharf as opposed to staying in this hotel

i booked this hotel for two reasons 1 i had stayed here before and liked that it is so close to everything along the pier 2 second time was for the shark fest that was right a cross the street from the hotel this place is comfortable and the staff has always been very friendly

stepping into the argonaut at fishermans wharf was like stepping into a dream i frequent san francisco annually for my daughters birthday and had requested other hotels to offer her something for her birthday but no one remembered the argonaut remembered and delivered sharon the front desk staff is extremely helpful kind and accommodating i appreciate how she listened and helped us the whole staff from the valet to thebelman to the front desk was amazing the restaurant is delicious true cuisine thank you aragonout for accommodating my daughter and i for her 14th birthday i appreciate you all and we will be coming back

this is undoubtedly one of the best hotels i have stayed in the rooms are enormous and beautifully appointed the staff were very friendly and helpful there is a large lounge area with relaxing chairs and an open fire a good restaurant and an outside eating area with fire pits no expense has been spared in the refurbishment making it a much sought after location parking is by valet service and quite expensive at 59 per day but the location close to fishermans wharf and the trolleybus terminus makes it very convenient we did not use our car during the four day stay

this hotel is a nice hotel in a great location for activities with kids great places to walk you can ride over the golden gate bridge there is a beach head down all the piers catch the hyde st cable carthe hotel itself is nice but the walls seemed a little thin as we could hear the rooms next door tv at night and doorbell in the morning quite well staff were great as well as the wine hour and fruit water would stay here again with kids

we really liked the argonaut during our four day stay the location is just perfect the staff were very helpful and housekeeping were excellent good sized rooms and ours had a view of the golden gate bridge just we would have given the argonaut an unreserved five star rating but it is terribly let down by the shambles which is their blue mermaid restaurant poor service and poor food on our last day there were evidently staffing problems and we were asked to wait 20 mins for a table in fairness when i told peter at reception he did say the management were aware of the problems and were working to resolve them the sooner the better we highly recommend the argonaut and hope that the catering issues are resolved by the time you arrive

when i traveled to san francisco ive always used sir francisco drake under total renovation or hotel vital closed during pandemic so i had to find a new option my requirements are 1 pet friendly 2 close to grassy area 3 fun and safe location ive found this cute hotel on bringfidocom and checked google map and found its at the end of fishermans village area and is right next to the maritime park with huge grass area though i wish they didnt have a pet fee like sir francis drake or vital its 75pet per stay hotel staff are super friendly and nice decor is cute and rooms are spacious and comfortable overall it was a very good choice for us id come back to stay here with my dogs again

we stayed here while in the city for a wedding the location was great as everyone had access to the main tourist areas and great dining i found the atmosphere fun and the decor eclectic bedding was comfortable and clean we had a great view from our room as did others in our party but some felt their rooms had too much street noise it was not peaceful at night but not to be expected in a setting such as this

excellent experience checkin an hour early quick very informative and helpful stayed in a deluxe king comfy bed large room and setup with sofa area perfect location for touring the city restaurant attached to the hotel for convenience all employees were helpful and pleasant everyone was masked would definitely stay again

the argonaut used to be a kimpton and was bummed out to hear that it was not this is not my first trip but upon arriving i noticed things were the same if not better if you want a hotel with about as good a location as you can get to the piers this is it the rooms are a great size and clean and cool as always

loved the location close to all the major sites to see and very convenient for us to pop in and out of the hotel during the day also liked that the hotel was a bit removed from the major crowds dont think you need to get a bay view room as youre hardly spending time in your room during the day save your money to use on excursions

we stayed here for 4 nights we had a bay view room which was large and comfortable with a view of the golden gate bridge the hotel is ideally located to explore the city the cable car starts just outside the hotel so we were able to ride the cable car early before the crowds came along

we booked a large suite with jacuzzi tub and it was extremely spacious and wellmaintained we had a dining table as well as sofachairs in living area bathroom included jacuzzi tub shower stall and toilet in separate closet we did not request a waterbay view and had a view of the street which was not a problem except for the noise at night the kids slept in the living room pullout sofa so they werent affected by the noise in the main bedroom the staff was super friendly and helpful the hotel location was great for exploring fishermans wharf and alcatraz and for hopping onoff the cable cars we did not eat at the hotel at all during our stay but we would definitely come back to stay here again

the third floor corner suite we had was perfectly suited for our family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers surprisingly quiet and extremely comfortable with plenty of living space plus a dining table for breakfast in the morning location was great for an evening walk around fishermans wharf and an ideal jumping off point to head over to presidio and the golden gate bridge

definitely a 4 star hotel nice rooms clean and well maintained it looks like they converted an old post and beam factory there were a couple of 14 wood beams in our room they do have a wonderful hour of wine tasting between 5 and 600 where you actually meet some of your fellow guests the only faults they charge 50day for parking which is horrendous it does include unlimited valet parking but really several nearby hotels offer the same service for 32day you are in the middle of tourist country and it is very busy and intense if this bothers you try somewhere further away you only have to be about blocks from fishermans wharf to be out of the crowds

the argonaut is not at all corporate it has quirky interiors that work well the staff are friendly and efficient the hotel is an easy walk to all fishermans wharf attractions and only about 30 minute stroll to down town sf rooms are bright and well furnished with usb charging points and wifi

much better than the downtown hotels very friendly staff well maintained the location is unbeatable close to everything but at the same time in the calmer part of fishermans wharf at the end of jefferson st

while i have tended to shy away from fishermans wharf the argonaut has changed my mind the staff are exceptionally friendly helpful and just full of good cheer the hotel is well appointed terrifically clean the room is very comfortable and well laid out its quiet its a haven compared to areas of town where many of the big hotels are its certainly everything i need and more on a business trip as other reviewers say it must also be great for vacationers my expectations for this family of hotels is always high but the argonaut has exceeded even those give this place a try its great value and a wonderful experience all around

this hotel is very nice i had the room shown in the pictures the bed was very comfortable with luxury linens the hotel is located in the middle of fishermans wharf area and the cannery building lots of restaurants and shops in the immediate area hotel security is well done and i felt safe as a female solo traveler the restaurant in the lobby chowder house was very good service was professional and friendly prices were reasonable the only complaint i have is the 30 plus taxes daily resort fee

we are repeat guests at this hotel this was our first visit since it has been run by noble house group and while the hotel is still as beautiful as ever we were disappointed to notice the usual personalization in service missing this trip i hope that it was just a fluke during past visits weve been greeted by name and friendly commentsquestions about our day by the bellmen as we walked in and out of the front door which made us feel so welcomed and appreciated as guests this trip we were celebrating a very special milestone birthday and it wasnt even really acknowledged nor were we really it doesnt need to be much but the ultimate reason we booked here for this trip was for the personalized service to have it missing was very disappointing especially given we considered two of our favorite hotels and ultimately chose to stay here and paid a higher rate thinking it was worth it for that personalization reason

we chose the argonaut to be close to san francisco bay for a 1 night stay following a medical appointment the doorman and reception staff were very friendly and professional all covid precautions were observed our room was excellent very comfortable beds quiet with a direct view of the golden gate bridge delicious food at the hotels blue mermaid rates are in line with 4+ and 5 star hotels that we have stayed at in san francisco at the quieter end of fishermans wharf we will recommend to anyone seeking a san francisco experience in a beautiful location on the bay

hotel was clean spacious and comfortable we didnt spend time in the lobby or bar but it looked nice location was great and area around the hotel felt pretty safe fairly close to great food in chinatown and north beach area overall had a good stay

found the location and facilities excellent staff professional and friendly we were referred by previous guests who are friends of ours i in turn have since told many others of your hotel one family of which will be booking soon

we enjoyed the ambience at the argonaut hotel the staff was very friendly and the location is great too unfortunately there were no kingsized beds available we spent 3 nights there and my husband and i joked that we were sleeping in ricky and lucy beds we recently traveled to italy with our children and found that most of the hotels there simply moved two beds together or separated them accommodating the needs of their guests easily the elevators were slow but otherwise it was quite comfortable

our 3rd stay in the hotel this time for 3 nights from the hotel straight on fishermans wharf next to the hotel the maritime museum ghirardelli park and the cable cars the hotel itself is very luxurious blue mermaid barrestaurant and a fitness center its an old warehouse and beautiful elements are still visible in the rooms

we spent the night here this month while visiting california the people are sooooo sweet and friendly they ended up giving us free drink coupons free appetizer coupons and let us keep our car there most of the next day while we were sight seeing the city very clean and excellent location

hello josephine1996 thank you for providing us with such a kind review we are giving some high fives over here at the argonaut after hearing that we made your bucket list what a great idea please come back and see us again soon warm regards marc

wish we had a longer trip to san francisco so that we could have spent more time at this hotel quaint quiet beautiful property with extremely helpful and friendly staff the cleanliness of the rooms was impeccable very welcoming and enjoyable experience

great location within walking distance to so many sites and close to cable car station concierge very helpful with planning how to fit the most fun into a short stay valet parking was great room was an interior room and quite small but tastefully decorated and we didnt spend much time there anyway inside rooms are much quieter

we also stayed here three years ago and im happy to say that the upkeep of the hotel has been great as everything seemed just as it should be this time the staff are friendly rooms large clean and very comfortable considering the hotel is in a very busy location and our room was facing fishermans wharf it was very quiet just around the corner from the argonaut are the cable cars which can get you easily into the city in a very picturesque way

we stayed here for a girls trip we asked where we could go for happy hour and they told us to check in with the concierge by the time we went up to the room they called with three options for us the beds were super comfortable rooms were very nice the hotel is right across from the beach and the ghiradelli square and right by the embarcadero so we walked everywhere although uber would always be an option the only disappointing thing was when we checked out they charged us a 25 resort fee which i thought was ridiculous because we were not told about it until we checked out however i would stay there again and their staff was extremely helpful we bought our room through groupon but i would not do that again as it would have been cheaper with the triple a discount of twenty percent

this is simply one of the best hotels weve ever stayed at the friendliness and impeccable service of all the staff ranks this hotel above the other boutique name brands we used to always stay at four seasons hotels i now look for kimpton

my wife and i have been to san francisco several times over the past 20 years and found the argonaut was a great fit of us and our two teenage daughters the location is right at the end of fishermans wharf in a former 100 year old warehouse it looks like a warehouse with exposed brick and steel beams that looks more than tough enough to survive an earthquake the front desk and the concierge were both helpful with our stay and they easily accommodated us when our flight was cancelled due to bad weather back east down the hallway is a little office area in case you need to jump online and print tickets or other tripbusiness related chores we had an inside room and it was one of the quietest rooms ive ever stayed in most probably due to the brick walls i cant make a comment on the street facing rooms as far as the noise coming from the street the location was very convenient to take a walk down fishermans wharf or to pick up the powellhyde cable car which has a end of the line turnaround right across the side street from 56 pm they have a nightly wine tasting and it changes here and there because i saw beer available and one chilly night they offered hot toddies i didnt hit the onsite gym but i understand its available if you want to get a workout in i almost forgot to mention that theres free wifi throughout the facility if we get a chance to travel to san francisco again i will make the argonaut my first choice

we decided on taking a quick trip to san fransisco for 1 night we decided on the argonaut hotel because of its central location on the wharf and nob hill hotel is quaint pet friendly and clean prices were a bit high for what we got which was 1 king room with no view staff was friendlyfor some reason there were lots of kids running about the hallways and main entrance of the hotel you could hear them running up and downthats a negative i would recommend this place if you are interested in hanging out on the wharf best thing to do is purchase tickets to the sightseeing double decker buses and do hop ons and offs during the day that way you can see the city and not get caught up in the heavy parking and congestion of the city

i loved the warehouse feel clever decor with all the steel strapping at baseboards and other areas friendly staff and very helpful with entertainment recommendations great seafood at most restaurants within walking distance we never had to use our car in the two days we were there

really enjoyed our time at argonaut awesome location literally across the road from the pier fishermans wharf starbucks and ghirardelli square service was fantastic and the room was huge with a great feel to it the building is historic and has an awesome vibe to it

spent a few days in this hotel late september 2016 its a great location and about a 1 minute walk to the cable car turnaround station where you can hop on and enjoy the world famous clang clang clang went the trolley the f line street car that runs all the way up to castro is at the end of the block also a walgreens store is a short walk complimentary bikes from the bike the bridge shop next door are available the hotel room was ok a little bigger would have been good staff at the hotel were all very friendly helpful and professional we had breakfast one morning in the hotel restaurant sat outside in the sun which was the only positive about the experience find somewhere else for breakfast plenty of choice around

from check in to check out an unbelievable experience in the heart of the wharf we had the best room and view in the city corinne and steven on check in were fantastic rose the concierge was great help room was clean large and the views were fantastic we will be back on our leaving the doorman was more than helpful in assisting us with our scenic route out of the city beautiful hotel great history not a generic look to it

a friendly welcome from front of house staff where we were shown a beautiful spacious room with two queen size beds the decor linen etc is first class and we enjoyed our five days stay and look forward to returning one day the lounge is family friendly at night the outside seating area of the bar is pleasant listening to street musicians playing jazz

the hotel was the perfect location and very nice close to ghiradelli square cable cars starbucks also nice walk to alcatraz tours and pier 39 great restaurant across the street and would definitely stay again

i was a challenge at first but the front desk attendant kumar was a pro realizing that it was my cab driver not the hotel irritating me i was treated like a valued guest right away and attention to detail was apparent throughout the hotel the guest receptions in the evening are also a nice touch the lobby is inviting and relaxing and we loved that the rooms draw on their cannery history no complaints here i would totally stay here again

at the pricier end but well worth it beautiful hotel and excellent location near docks for trip to alxatraz near ead of cable car that goes straight past the steep windy road and spitting distance to a good bike hire place for riding over the golden gate bridge good restaurants near by starbucks directly behind and fast food too
we spent the first night of our honeymoon here over 400 dollars for a very average room with limescale everywhere in the bathroom food also very average in the hotel wont be coming back in a hurry

have stayed at the argonaut a kimpton hotel on a number of occasions if you want a fishermans wharf location this is an ideal hotel to stay with easy access to the attractions of the wharf and easy access to the tramcar to take you into the centre of the city the rooms are very spacious with all expected amenities one great drawcard is the happy hour each evening when you can attend a wine tasting and have a chat with other guests from various parts of the world would always stay here again if we go to san francisco the restaurant onsite blue mermaid is accessible from the front foyer and serves a good breakfast and a great menu for dinner

we had a wonderful rime staying at the argonaut so much was within walking distance and if we needed a cab the doorman jason put us in the hands of a truly awesome cab driver the rooms are clean the restaurant has really good food and the wait staff were very friendly and accomodating i will recommend your hotel to anyone i know that plans to visit san fran thank you again

this is a great hotel in a historic building with lots of character retained from its previous life as a fruit packing warehouse the spacious and long rooms are tastefully done to maintain the character with exposed brick and beams with a nautical twist the hotel building is recessed into a steep hill so if you are in a room at the back of the hotel on the third floor it will still seem like you are almost on ground level so for a higher view ask to be closer to the front of the hotel we were about half way back on the third floor and when looking out of our window it seemed we were almost street level we did have a view of the park and the golden gate bridge in the distance the room had lovely toiletries and bathrobes and a very comfortable bed the wine tasting next to the hotel is worth a visit we had 5 different tasters for 15 with a sparkling and an extra glass thrown in for free the blue mermaid bar and restaurant connected to the hotel is also very good nice dcor and the award winning crab chowder was delicious the free bikes offered by the hotel were all gone by the time we tried to get them which was fine as we walked over the bridge but if this is something you want to do then book early my only negative is just thats its really expensive for a 4 star hotel i suppose it is a lovely hotel right in the tourist area and we were staying over a weekend but our bill for 3 nights without breakfast was nearly 1800ouch it was more expensive than our 5 star apartment room in vegas so although i loved this hotel the price wasnt really justified and i would only stay again if i could get a cheaper deal

we enjoyed our trip to san francisco and in part do to the great hotel and its location to all sorts of great things to do the rooms are nice and quiet not once were we disturbed by noises coming from the hall or any place we will be back

we are going to try elsewhere this next time because the 1 bedroom has just gotten too expensive on most days it is nearly 500 and that is not including the parking i understand that this hotel is immaculate and the location is hard to beat near the bay and ghiradelli however they have priced us out

really enjoyed our stay walking distance to pier 39 and the alcatraz tour right near tram stop room service never seemed to be available unless it was during restaurant hours which kind of defeats the purpose of needing room service

the argonaut is a really great hotel in the perfect location in fishermans wharf san francisco its suitable for couples and familys in among the action but in the quieter end of the strip the authentic decor has a real historic feel the rooms are a little snug but again are very comfortable with a design in keeping with the history of the area hire bikes ride over the golden gate bridge into sausalito grab some lunch and catch the ferry back past alcatraz dont bike back the hill coming down off the bridge would be really tough and you would miss out on the ferry experience the argonaut provided a great leg on our california road trip

we booked because of tripadvisor reviews the location was amazing beyond that not worth the money the hotel is dog friendly but maybe they should tell people after 2 miserable nights wheezing and coughing my daughter figured out the problem 2 room moves later the second smelled of smoke we were told we were on a pet fee floor although better i continued to wheeze and wake up with swollen eyes the last night the dog next door barked all night so much for animal free rooms

it was a first time visit for one of us and the argonaut did not disappoint we had wonderful service proximity to restaurants and places we needed to see and a great concierge who helped us reserve tickets

i knew this hotel was going to be wonderful and it exceed my expectations we had a bay view king room with a spot on view of alcatraz and some of the golden gate bridge the bed was super comfortable and the location of the room right near the elevator was great it was my birthday and our anniversary so they greeted us in the room with a bottle of wine and snacks with a nice hand written card the lobby was great for kids and adults theres a big warm fireplace that is always on and we met people from out of town just by sitting there there was a tv with kid friendly video games going as well there was even a table with dog treats and poop bags for the dog people you walk out the front door and you are on fishermans wharf and right next to the start of the cable cars right behind the hotel is an early open starbucks and around the corner ghiradelli square could not have asked for a better place to stay oh and theres a restaurant attached as well for meals

this hotel smells just like a dog kennel which i love dogs but i do not like the smell on my cloths and the whole hotel smells like wet dogs my stay was not pleasant at all i told them i do not want to be put in a room with prior dogs in it i am very allergic to dogsi get hives i did not expect the place to be like this at all the hotel is located in a perfect spot main street and closed to cable cars views of the golden gate bridge because of this i think the hotel gets too many great reviews and if i saw anything about the wet dog smells i would not have booked this hotel at all the worst part was my expensive cloths smelled of dogs all week its was awful

from the moment we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff and the checkin was as smooth as it could be the lobby common areas and rooms were very clean and tastefully decorated our room faced the courtyard and to our surprise it wasnt noisy

we needed a local long weekend destination that could cater to my 2 boys imagination and interests and decided that we would brave fishermans wharf in sf which in only about 40 minutes from where we live while searching for hotels near the wharf i got a little concerned none of them quite fit the standards and style we typically prefer when traveling as a family then i found the argonaut lets start with the location it is so close to the wharf and pier and within steps from many family friendly restaurants cafes ice cream shops and stores we were greeted by the most friendly doorman who entertained my boys while we checked in the lobby is beautiful spacious and a perfect place to sit down for a quick drink we were able to stay at one of the suites which was decently spacious and adorable furnished in nautical theme room was clean and the window looked out to the bustling wharf the jacuzzi didnt work but its ok it wanted to avoid it anyways since if my boys got in they wont ever want to get out 45 minutes after we settled into our room we were greeted with a complimentary bottle of wine what a lovely surprise they know tired parents we found the staff extremely kids friendly which is always a relief i loved that even being family friendly they still cared about the little nice luxury details id highly recommend this for anyone looking for a highend but also family appropriate hotel spot wed definitely come back
the location of the hotel is perfect to walk down fishermans wharf and visit san franciscos piers its near to the platform of powellhyde cable car line which can bring you directly to lombard street

we stayed at this hotel for 6 days and five nights in mid april the argonaut hotel is located in the perfect location right at the end of fishermans wharf on the main strip upon checkin the staff was friendly and attentive especially with the lobby being pretty busy we arrived early 4 hours before checkin time and were told they could have our room ready early that it would just be a little wait they secured our bags to the side took down our cell phone number and called us within 40 minutes our room was clean updated and comfortable we had the best nights sleep our mini bar was constantly stocked with liter bottles of water daily for us at a price of course this is big for us as we are always having to go out and buy water when on vacation so this was a nice convenience our room was cleaned every morning by the fast and efficient cleaning staff the hotel has an adjacent bar and restaurant there is a complimentary happy hour daily with wine beer connected to the hotel is a maritime museum the hotel has a nautical historical feel which was really cool we used the fitness facilities almost daily while there and it was never over crowded from the hotel there are endless activities and attractions within an easy walking distance ghiraradelli square a starbucks the buena vista restaurant the trolley pick up endless shops and restaurants pier 39 the boat to alcatraz are just some of them there are various bike rentals locally making biking the golden gate very convenient san fran is a beautiful city and we will be sure to return and stay at the argonaut again

our family of four 2 teenage boys stayed in a deluxe room with 2 queen sized beds the room was pretty comfortable not the biggest weve stayed in but this is an old building that has to accommodate a hotel so that is understandable we had a great stay and the hotel is in the perfect location for a family pluses location easy walk to cable car terminus bike hire for gg bridge lots of family friendly restaurants shops ghirardelli square pier 39 fishermans wharf nice restaurant bar attached comfy lounge area with board games wii great concierge service quiet bedroom minuses lack of clothes storage in bedroom for family of 4 just a small chest of drawers + 2 other drawers a wardrobe nowhere to hang clothes in bathroom when taking a shower pretty low powered shower over the bath restaurant is small for the size of the hotel takes non residents so we faced a 1 hour wait for a breakfast table on checkout day not end of world as other options out of hotel but no warning that we should book either
