we live in the bay area and had a special evening planned so we decided to stay in the city we had not stayed here before but we cant wait to go back the nautical dcor was really well done and did not feel gimmicky the winebeer happy hour was well attended and fun from the front door to the front desk and the housekeepers the staff was friendly welcoming and attentive the bed was comfortable i love the kimpton whimsical touches in the room including the animal print robes and yoga mat oh and the umbrella on a practical note the multiplugs at the desk allowed us to plug in several devices for charging at one time brilliant join the kimpton karma program and you will get wifi and a chance to eat some munchies out of the mini bar included this is hotel is really well located for visitors to san francisco you can walk to the wharf ghirardelli square the cannery be sure to stop at the buena vista for an irish coffee

great hotel in the best location lovely friendly staff very knowledges and there to help would definitely stay here again great view of alcatraz from the room breakfast at 8am round the first we was amazing too

we have always enjoyed staying at the agrenout the historical beautiful building at a great location beautiful comfortable rooms great restaurant all staff are very professional and makes you feel at home that is why i can say i recomend you to stay at this hotel next time in sf you will never regret that

we were encouraged to stay at this hotel whose rates are usually prohibitive to us because of its special offer its a lovely hotel were glad we did the historical nautical theme was consistent throughout the staff was polite considerate informative the room was gorgeous

beautiful hotel with one of the best views in the city one of the finest rooms ive been in and a perfect location for strolling the waterfront it wasnt cheap but the best rarely is if you want to give someone a first class san francisco experience this is a good place to do it

stayed here on our last night of our road trip in the us on great ta reviews and i can only agree actually i think it could be the best us hotel i have stayed in not cheap and i agree that breakfast could have been included although that is unusual anywhere these days but i have paid this for a matchbox in london with second hand furniture all the staff were super friendly not just american false if you know what i mean and we were upgraded to a room with a great view of the harbour but still quiet tasteful seaside theme and superfast wifi my only problem was that we only had one night here and had spent many in below par hotels on our trip i wouldnt hesitate to stay here again when in san francisco

very nice hotel i recommended to my aunt and she stayed in november blue mermaid restaurant was fabulous everyone was friendly and helpful centrally located valet parking i would definitely stay here again

loved most everything about our two night stay parking was priced too high took the free tour which was an nice amenity the lobby should have more plugs to charge phones as the only ones were located on the high table with stools

i stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate my 30th birthday it cost us around 1300 the hotel is spotlessly clean and really nicely decorated our room had a view of the golden gate bridge and upon arrival a note to wish me a happy birthday and a bottle of wine were in the roomive no idea how the hotel knew it was my birthday my boyfriend is adamant he didnt mention it so i can only assume this is how much attention to detail is given for booking that they noticed the date all the staff we came across throughout the stay were really friendly and went out of the way to ensure our stay was perfect the wine hour is great the free bicycle hire would have been fantastic if i could ride a bike however after borrowing one from the hotel it became evident very quickly that i lost that ability somewhere in the last 15 years haha the restaurant in the hotel is lovely but there are some really great ones in the courtyard next door too especially the mexican which was excellent the location is perfect easy to get a cab close to sightseeing buses cable car turn table and a short walk to pier 39 easy to walk to the alcatraz landing from here too room was warm and cosy bathrobes were super cute and all the staff we came across were super friendly the only negative point i have about the hotel is that our room whilst lovely was tiny perhaps it was because we had just arrived there after a week in caesars palace lv but im pretty sure we must have had one of the smallest rooms in the hotel it wasnt a problem as we didnt spend long in the room anyway but if you arent planning on exploring and want to stay in the room i would recommend upgrading to a larger room

first off its a great boutique hotel fairly large with a pretty cool nautical theme the bar at the restaurant downstairs was cool as well everyone was helpful it was clean and upkept very well best part however was the location it is literally across the street from the maritime museum and about a block from fishermans wharf everything youd like to see in a long weekend is in walking distance ie no rental car needed i was at a conference so i didnt have all of the free time in the world but id definitely stay there again for pleasure

clean warm and comfortable but a long walk from reception to our room friendly staff but once again no free wifi no breakfast included or else they forgot to mention it and the most annoying they even charged for the bottled water in the room certainly americans like to milk every penny they can from tourists but that was pure meanness

i was told a late checkout was not available but was available for 100 bucks more pretty shady also the walls were pretty thin and if you face the east window the sunlight is pretty strong great location though

this is the fourth kimpton we have stayed in and one of the best we are loyal to the brand and always try and find a kimpton wherever we go the location of the argonaut is perfect you are on the edge of one of the biggest tourist areas in the world but barely notice having the buena vista next door for breakfast is a huge plus staff at this hotel was hands down friendly courteous and helpful doormen went to great lengths to hail cabs at times running down the street and yelling front desk was super nice on check inout even honoring a rewards perk when they did not have to only real complaint is we never got our fish we noted that this hotel is pet friendly and met some nice dogs in the lobby at times found this to be a plus even though we dont travel with our cats we never heard a bark growl or anything else negative in this regard had a deluxe king room and was very impressed the rawexposed building elements brick wall wood beams etc were a very nice touch bed was super comfy with excellent linens room was large for big city standards and overall very comfortable we would certainly recommend this hotel as well as stay here on our next visit although there are other nice looking kimpton properties in sf that look fun as well

it is a nice hotel friendly staff and great location i would recommend this hotel for business or personal stays location is convenient to attractions and great restaurants and the front desk personnel were very accommodating

we stayed for a second time in this historic in american terms hotel quirky maritime theme may not suit all tastes but the room was large with a view of the golden gate bridge staff were very friendly and helpful spent all day on a wine tasting tour and returning to find free wine being served by the fire was a nice touch as was the free bottle presented in the room when they found out we were celebrating a birthday far better than the usual corporate fair in sf

the location was great the staff were very helpful and the room was also very nice i was amazed with how quiet the rooms were at night we slept great the water pressure was good and we never ran out of hot water the amenities were nice including the attached restaurant and the games and comfortable chairs in the lobby we never utilized the concierge service but it was available just a great experience and we would definitely stay here again in the future

the argonaut is charming loved the old bones of the building and our room was huge the location is great for walking to wharf attractions and accessing public transportation we also enjoyed the free bike rental

this is a fantastic hotel very friendly staff the wine tasting gave everyone a chance to interact rooms very clean and comfortable our deluxe room with a view of the golden gate bridge was better than we had expected the only let down was the mermaid chowder restaurantthe food was served on cold plates and was cold when it arrived at the table

i did not stay in here but used the lobby and i loved this hotel this was my second option and only second as lots of people say dont stay at fishermans warf but next time i visit san francisco this is the place ill be amazing location beautiful hotel dont know the rooms but im sure its great cable car station ghiradelli is next door

the hotel was very nice very clean the staff were greatthe only issue was you can litterly hear the next door talking and tv the house keeping lady was very nice and took care of our room front desk was very nice and helpfulalso they have a great valet team they were very polite and help me in and out of my wheelchair

not only is this hotel located in a great area for touring the wharf city the bed was hands down the most comfortable i have ever found in a hotel like sleeping on a cloud fabulous staff from housekeeping to front desk to bellman all very helpful friendly i will definitely be staying here again

its located on the end of crazy the very busy touristy pier strip of fishermans wharf its a brick four story building located right next to the cable car hyde street its a walking distance to many attractions restaurants fort masonetc the lobby and the overall decor is very nautical beautiful and fitting with the surrounding they have a restaurant and a wine tasting room the staff was friendly and helpful the walls are thick and the brick structure does the trick its very quiet despite the busy location free wifi

great location at the warf in walking distance to ghiridelli square boudin tons of restaurants and shopping the cable cars friendly staff and very helpful bed is comfy with a relaxing spacious shower with all the upscale amenities

we recently stayed in a king bayview room which looked out directly at alcatraz the hotel was great the staff was wonderful and we had the best time exploring the city this location is an easy walk to ghirardelli square and the piers but we managed to walk to north beach chinatown and the embarcco as well

we really enjoyed our stay at the argonaut the staff were very professional polite and welcoming and made us feel really special the rooms are nice in a themey kind of way but a little dark and the bathrooms were very underwhelming also under the television where the mini bar area is was very dirty so maybe housekeeping could be a little more attentive the location is on the edge of the fishermans wharf area so its easy to avoid the chaos like i said in the title of this review this is a solid hotel over priced in my opinion but a safe bet in the fishermans wharf area particularly loved the infused water in the foyer

we stayed at the argonaut for 2 nights the location is excellent our room had a lovely view of the golden gate bridge and the cable car turn around the hotel is an old factory the brick and exposed beams were beautiful the only negative was an added fee for things we had no interest in using i was not told of the fee at checking when i enquired the next day the clerk wouldnt remove it from the pervious night but didnt charge us for the second night

we reserved two adjoining rooms they were each unique and beautiful good size rooms for downtown san francisco the decor in this hotel is gorgeous down to the smallest detail and it seemed new as there was no wear and tear we had a beautiful view of the bay everyone was very friendly too

my husband and i recently stayed here for an anniversarybirthday trip and had such a wonderful time the area was great but the cable car and street cars stops were such a short walk from the property that we were able to explore other areas of the city as well the public transportation system is a breeze but the concierge will help you out if you have any questions special thanks to steven at check in chuck in housekeeping and richard and vuk y at the blue mermaid for making our trip so memorable

lovely hotel right on fishermans wharf quiet luxury hotel with great bar restaurant the wharf is definitely aimed at tourists so youll pay more but if you want to spend time on the wharf access the various piers close to cable car stops and hop on tour buses this hotel is great

this was a great hotel far end of all the piers and wharfs where we like eating but that was ok still plenty of shops and things to bop into around the hotel also we truly were in the hotel from just after a late dinner to check out for the flight home so cant comment on a lot of the ammenities but i did like the place and certainly would look to book again should the need to stay in san francisco arise

the best location on fishermans wharf walk along the pier and close to restaurants i was pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel i pay close attention to little things like the grout in the bathroom it was spotless plenty of space on the room for four of us would definitely choose to stay here again

excellent location super helpful and friendly staff easy walking to golden gate bridge pier 39 and beyond bedroom and bed very comfy no tea just coffee provided interior view means everyone elses shutters but theyre all white wooden ones so look good blue mermaid restaurant does delicious breakfast but a little pricey we paid 62 for the 2 of us however they are big portions and lots of great coffee refills really enjoyed our 2 might stay an route to new zealand from the uk

i stayed here with my mum back in march for my birthday as a short getaway from the moment we checked in the hotel team were friendly and very welcoming the hotel has a very unique looking design which fits in with its location in fishermans wharf the location is great for going out sight seeing and very close to public transport including the old style trams i cant compliment the hotel team enough they knew it was my birthday and laid out a few surprises which were lovely

the argonaut is in a great location it is slightly away from the main touristy area of pier 39 but still not too far away the building itself is beautiful and the nautical theme is nice the staff are all extremely professional and helpful from reception the door people and the cleaning people a warm hello from the cleaning people is always a great touch also the room was as expected of a high standard and most of all the bed was comfortable gone are the days when i can sleep on any kind of bed and my back appreciated the firmness of the mattress it wasnt too firm it was just perfect we had breakfast at the hotel which was very nice but for a more all singing all dancing kind of a breakfast id recommend the hollywood cafe on north point street we went on quite a few tours during our time in san francisco our favourites were out to visit the coastal redwoods at muir woods and of course alcatraz island dont forget the 5 all day vintage street car pass

hotel has the wow factor when you arrive and the continued all the way to your room we had a wharf view room and was well worth the extra cost to soak up the atmosphere the room had everything you could want breakfast was a bit pricey but thats a choice thing great location cable car stop literal 2 minutes away lots of shops and restaurants close to ferry for alcatraz and the sea lions absolutely loved this hotel and san francisco

the argonaut is in a great location in fishermans wharf the rooms are wellappointed spacious and nicely styled in the nautical theme but if you stay here dont go to the bar we were seated at the bar to get a drink waited 15 minutes without even being acknowledged by the bartender and then left to have a predinner drink at our restaurant instead during this time multiple customers had to walk to the bar to request their checks not great when one of the justifications for the resortservice fee is a 10 bar credit

we will definitely be staying here again we loved the hotel the staff was incredible and went above and beyond for us the location is perfect and we felt very safe at our hotel the hotel and room was very clean and well kept this will be our go to when we visit sf

we enjoyed a one night getaway at the argonaut and loved every minute of it the location was fabulous and so were the nautical themed rooms would definitely recommend staying her with families and enjoy the view from the starboard side of the hotel

stay was great the room and location to lots of great things was amazing the staff was very friendly would definitely stay here again only issue is parking so expensive 5075 a day and thats not even if you want to go in and out other than that very nice
